ï»¿ALMAYER 'S FOLLY : A STORY OF [AN EASTERN RIVER]153-an eastern river by [Joseph Conrad]67-joseph conrad Qui de nous n'a eu sa terre promise , [son jour d'extase et sa fin en exil]154-son jour d'extase et sa fin en exil ? - [AMIEL]68-amiel . [LONDON]1-london : [T. FISHER UNWIN]69-t. fisher unwin , LTD . [ADELPHI TERRACE First Edition]2-adelphi terrace first edition . . . 1895 Second Impression , 1907 Third , , 1914 Fourth , , 1915 To the memory of T. B. CHAPTER I. " [Kaspar]70-kaspar ! [Makan]71-makan ! "[69-t. fisher unwin] The well - known shrill voice startled [Almayer]72-almayer from [his]155-he dream of splendid future into the unpleasant realities of the present hour . An unpleasant voice too . [He]155-he had heard it for many years , and with every year [he]155-he liked it less . No matter ; there would be an end to all this soon . [He]155-he shuffled uneasily , but took no further notice of the call . Leaning with both [his]155-he elbows on the balustrade of [the verandah]156-the verandah , [he]155-he went on looking fixedly at [the great river that flowed]157-the great river that flowed - indifferent and hurried - before [his]155-he eyes . [He]155-he liked to look at it about the time of sunset ; perhaps because at that time the sinking sun would spread a glowing gold tinge on [the waters of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]158-the waters of the pantai , and [Almayer]72-almayer 's thoughts were often busy with gold ; gold [he]155-he had failed to secure ; gold [the others]159-the others had secured - dishonestly , of course - or gold [he]155-he meant to secure yet , through [his]155-he own honest exertions , for [himself]155-he and [Nina]73-nina . [He]155-he absorbed [himself]155-he in [his]155-he dream of wealth and power away from [this coast where [he]155-he had dwelt for so many years]160-this coast where he had dwelt for so many years , forgetting the bitterness of toil and strife in the vision of a great and splendid reward . [They]161-they would live in [Europe]4-europe , [he]155-he and [[his]155-he daughter]162-his daughter . [They]161-they would be rich and respected . [Nobody]163-nobody would think of [her]73-nina mixed blood in the presence of [her]73-nina great beauty and of [his]155-he immense wealth . Witnessing [her]73-nina triumphs [he]155-he would grow young again , [he]155-he would forget the twenty - five years of heart - breaking struggle on [this coast]164-this coast where [he]155-he felt like [a prisoner]165-a prisoner . All this was nearly within [his]155-he reach . Let only [Dain]74-dain return ! And return soon [he]155-he must - in [his]155-he own interest , for [his]155-he own share . [He]155-he was now more than a week late ! Perhaps [he]155-he would return to - night . Such were [Almayer]72-almayer 's thoughts as , standing on the verandah of [[his]155-he new but already decaying house]166-his new but already decaying house - that last failure of [his]155-he life - [he]155-he looked on [the broad river]167-the broad river . There was no tinge of gold on [it]167-the broad river this evening , for [it]167-the broad river had been swollen by the rains , and rolled an angry and muddy flood under [his]155-he inattentive eyes , carrying small drift - wood and big dead logs , and whole uprooted trees with branches and foliage , amongst which the water swirled and roared angrily . One of those drifting trees grounded on [the shelving shore]168-the shelving shore , just by [the house]169-the house , and [Almayer]72-almayer , neglecting [his]155-he dream , watched it with languid interest . The tree swung slowly round , amid the hiss and foam of the water , and soon getting free of the obstruction began to move down stream again , rolling slowly over , raising upwards a long , denuded branch , like a hand lifted in mute appeal to heaven against [the river]170-the river 's brutal and unnecessary violence . [Almayer]72-almayer 's interest in the fate of that tree increased rapidly . [He]155-he leaned over to see if it would clear the low point below . It did ; then [he]155-he drew back , thinking that now its course was free down to [the sea]171-the sea , and [he]155-he envied the lot of that inanimate thing now growing small and indistinct in the deepening darkness . As [he]155-he lost sight of it altogether [he]155-he began to wonder how far out to [sea]172-sea [it]167-the broad river would drift . Would the current carry it north or south ? South , probably , till it drifted in sight of [Celebes]5-celebes , as far as [Macassar]75-macassar , perhaps ! [Macassar]75-macassar ! [Almayer]72-almayer 's quickened fancy distanced the tree on its imaginary voyage , but [his]155-he memory lagging behind some twenty years or more in point of time saw [a young and slim Almayer , clad all in white and modest - looking]173-a young and slim almayer , clad all in white and modest - looking , landing from [the Dutch mail - boat]174-the dutch mail - boat on [the dusty jetty of [Macassar]75-macassar]175-the dusty jetty of macassar , coming to woo fortune in [the godowns of old [Hudig]75-macassar]176-the godowns of old hudig . It was an important epoch in [his]155-he life , the beginning of a new existence for [him]155-he . [[His]155-he father]177-his father , [a subordinate official employed in [the Botanical Gardens of [Buitenzorg]8-buitenzorg]179-the botanical gardens of buitenzorg]178-a subordinate official employed in the botanical gardens of buitenzorg , was no doubt delighted to place [[his]177-his father son]180-his son in such a firm . [The young man]181-the young man [himself]181-the young man too was nothing loth to leave [the poisonous shores of [Java]9-java]182-the poisonous shores of java , and the meagre comforts of [the parental bungalow]183-the parental bungalow , where [the father]184-the father grumbled all day at the stupidity of [native gardeners]185-native gardeners , and [the mother]186-the mother from the depths of [her]186-the mother long easy - chair bewailed the lost glories of [Amsterdam]10-amsterdam , where [she]186-the mother had been brought up , and of [her]186-the mother position as [the daughter of [a cigar dealer there]188-a cigar dealer there]187-the daughter of a cigar dealer there . [Almayer]72-almayer had left [[his]181-the young man home]189-his home with a light heart and a lighter pocket , speaking English well , and strong in arithmetic ; ready to conquer [the world]190-the world , never doubting that [he]181-the young man would . After those twenty years , standing in the close and stifling heat of a Bornean evening , [he]181-the young man recalled with pleasurable regret the image of [[Hudig]75-macassar 's lofty and cool warehouses]191-hudig 's lofty and cool warehouses with [[their]191-hudig 's lofty and cool warehouses long and straight avenues of gin cases and bales of Manchester goods]192-their long and straight avenues of gin cases and bales of manchester goods ; the big door swinging noiselessly ; the dim light of [the place]193-the place , so delightful after the glare of [the streets]194-the streets ; [the little railed - off spaces]195-the little railed - off spaces amongst piles of merchandise where [the Chinese clerks]196-the chinese clerks , neat , cool , and sad - eyed , wrote rapidly and in silence amidst the din of [the working gangs]197-the working gangs rolling casks or shifting cases to a muttered song , ending with a desperate yell . At the upper end , facing the great door , there was [a larger space railed off]198-a larger space railed off , well lighted ; there the noise was subdued by distance , and above it rose the soft and continuous clink of silver guilders which [other discreet Chinamen]199-other discreet chinamen were counting and piling up under the supervision of [Mr. Vinck]76-mr. vinck , [the cashier]200-the cashier , [the genius presiding in [the place]193-the place]201-the genius presiding in the place - [the right hand of [the Master]204-the master]203-the right hand of the master . In [that clear space]205-that clear space [Almayer]72-almayer worked at [his]181-the young man table not far from a little green painted door , by which always stood a Malay in a red sash and turban , and whose hand , holding a small string dangling from above , moved up and down with the regularity of a machine . The string worked a punkah on the other side of the green door , where [the so - called private office]206-the so - called private office was , and where old [Hudig]75-macassar - [the Master]204-the master - sat enthroned , holding noisy receptions . Sometimes the little door would fly open disclosing to [the outer world]208-the outer world , through the bluish haze of tobacco smoke , a long table loaded with bottles of various shapes and tall water - pitchers , rattan easy - chairs occupied by [noisy men in sprawling attitudes]209-noisy men in sprawling attitudes , while [the Master]204-the master would put [his]204-the master head through and , holding by the handle , would grunt confidentially to [Vinck]76-mr. vinck ; perhaps send an order thundering down [the warehouse]211-the warehouse , or spy [a hesitating stranger]212-a hesitating stranger and greet [him]212-a hesitating stranger with a friendly roar , " Welgome , [Gapitan]11-gapitan ! ver ' [you]212-a hesitating stranger gome vrom ? [Bali]12-bali , eh ? [Got bonies]2593-got bonies ? [I]209-noisy men in sprawling attitudes vant bonies ! Vant all [you]212-a hesitating stranger got ; ha ! ha ! ha ! Gome in ! "[209-noisy men in sprawling attitudes] Then [the stranger]213-the stranger was dragged in , in a tempest of yells , the door was shut , and the usual noises refilled [the place]193-the place ; the song of [the workmen]215-the workmen , the rumble of barrels , the scratch of rapid pens ; while above all rose the musical chink of broad silver pieces streaming ceaselessly through the yellow fingers of [the attentive Chinamen]216-the attentive chinamen . At that time [Macassar]75-macassar was teeming with life and commerce . It was the point in [the islands]217-the islands where tended [all those bold spirits who , fitting out schooners on [the [Australian]13-australian coast]219-the australian coast]218-all those bold spirits who , fitting out schooners on the australian coast , invaded [the Malay Archipelago]14-the malay archipelago in search of money and adventure . Bold , reckless , keen in business , not disinclined for a brush with the pirates that were to be found on [many a coast]220-many a coast as yet , making money fast , [they]218-all those bold spirits who , fitting out schooners on the australian coast used to have a general " rendezvous "[224-english pedlars] in [the bay]221-the bay for purposes of trade and dissipation . [The Dutch merchants]222-the dutch merchants called [those men]223-those men [English pedlars]224-english pedlars ; [some of [them]223-those men]225-some of them were undoubtedly [gentlemen for whom that kind of life had a charm]226-gentlemen for whom that kind of life had a charm ; [most]227-most were [seamen]228-seamen ; [the acknowledged king of [them]223-those men all]229-the acknowledged king of them all was [Tom Lingard]77-lingard , [[he]77-lingard whom [the Malays]231-the malays , honest or dishonest , [quiet fishermen]232-quiet fishermen or [desperate cut - throats]233-desperate cut - throats , recognised as " [the Rajah - Laut]78-the rajah "[77-lingard] - [the King of [the Sea]15-the sea]234-the king of the sea]230-he whom the malays , honest or dishonest , quiet fishermen or desperate cut - throats , recognised as " the rajah - laut " - the king of the sea . [Almayer]72-almayer had heard of [him]77-lingard before [he]77-lingard had been three days in [Macassar]75-macassar , had heard the stories of [his]77-lingard smart business transactions , [his]77-lingard loves , and also of [his]77-lingard desperate fights with [the Sulu pirates]235-the sulu pirates , together with the romantic tale of [some child]236-some child - [a girl]237-a girl - found in a piratical prau by [the victorious Lingard]77-lingard , when , after a long contest , [he]77-lingard boarded [the craft]238-the craft , driving [the crew]239-the crew overboard . [This girl]240-this girl , it was generally known , [Lingard]77-lingard had adopted , was having [her]240-this girl educated in [some convent in [Java]9-java]241-some convent in java , and spoke of [her]240-this girl as " [[my]77-lingard daughter]2594-my daughter . "[77-lingard] [He]77-lingard had sworn a mighty oath to marry [her]240-this girl to [a white man]242-a white man before [he]77-lingard went [home]243-home and to leave [her]240-this girl all [his]77-lingard money . " And [Captain Lingard]79-lingard has lots of money , "[76-mr. vinck] would say [Mr. Vinck]76-mr. vinck solemnly , with [his]76-mr. vinck head on one side , " lots of money ; more than [Hudig]75-macassar ! "[76-mr. vinck] And after a pause - just to let [[his]76-mr. vinck hearers]244-his hearers recover from [their]244-his hearers astonishment at such an incredible assertion - [he]76-mr. vinck would add in an explanatory whisper , " [You]244-his hearers know , [he]76-mr. vinck has discovered [a river]2595-a river . "[76-mr. vinck] That was it ! [He]76-mr. vinck had discovered [a river]2595-a river ! That was the fact placing [old Lingard]79-lingard so much above [the common crowd of sea - going adventurers who traded with [Hudig]75-macassar in the daytime and drank champagne , gambled , sang noisy songs , and made love to half - caste girls]246-the common crowd of sea - going adventurers who traded with hudig in the daytime and drank champagne , gambled , sang noisy songs , and made love to half - caste girls under [the broad verandah of [the Sunda Hotel]248-the sunda hotel]247-the broad verandah of the sunda hotel at night . Into [that river]249-that river , whose entrances [himself]79-lingard only knew , [Lingard]79-lingard used to take [his]79-lingard assorted cargo of Manchester goods , brass gongs , rifles and gunpowder . [His]79-lingard brig Flash , which [he]79-lingard commanded [himself]79-lingard , would on those occasions disappear quietly during the night from [the roadstead]250-the roadstead while [[his]79-lingard companions]251-his companions were sleeping off the effects of [the midnight carouse]252-the midnight carouse , [Lingard]79-lingard seeing [them]251-his companions drunk under the table before going on board , [himself]79-lingard unaffected by any amount of liquor . [Many]253-many tried to follow [him]79-lingard and find [that land of plenty for gutta - percha]254-that land of plenty for gutta - percha and rattans , pearl shells and birds ' nests , wax and gum - dammar , but [the little Flash]255-the little flash could outsail [every craft]256-every craft in [those seas]257-those seas . [A few of [them]253-many]258-a few of them came to grief on [hidden sandbanks]259-hidden sandbanks and [coral reefs]260-coral reefs , losing [their]258-a few of them all and barely escaping with life from the cruel grip of [this sunny and smiling sea]261-this sunny and smiling sea ; [others]262-others got discouraged ; and for many years [the green and peaceful - looking islands guarding the entrances to [the promised land]264-the promised land]263-the green and peaceful - looking islands guarding the entrances to the promised land kept [their]263-the green and peaceful - looking islands guarding the entrances to the promised land secret with all the merciless serenity of tropical nature . And so [Lingard]79-lingard came and went on [his]79-lingard secret or open expeditions , becoming [a hero]265-a hero in [Almayer]72-almayer 's eyes by the boldness and enormous profits of [his]79-lingard ventures , seeming to [Almayer]72-almayer [a very great man]266-a very great man indeed as [he]267-he saw [him]79-lingard marching up [the warehouse]211-the warehouse , grunting a " how are [you]79-lingard ? "[267-he] to [Vinck]76-mr. vinck , or greeting [Hudig]75-macassar , [the Master]204-the master , with a boisterous " Hallo , [old pirate]2596-old pirate ! Alive yet ? "[267-he] as a preliminary to transacting business behind the little green door . Often of an evening , in the silence of [the then deserted warehouse]270-the then deserted warehouse , [Almayer]72-almayer putting away [his]79-lingard papers before driving [home]243-home with [Mr. Vinck]76-mr. vinck , in whose [[household]272-household [he]79-lingard lived]273-household he lived , would pause listening to the noise of a hot discussion in [the private office]274-the private office , would hear the deep and monotonous growl of [the Master]204-the master , and the roared - out interruptions of [Lingard]79-lingard - two mastiffs fighting over a marrowy bone . But to [Almayer]72-almayer 's ears it sounded like a quarrel of [Titans]80-titans - a battle of [the gods]276-the gods . After a year or so [Lingard]79-lingard , having been brought often in contact with [Almayer]72-almayer in the course of business , took a sudden and , to [the onlookers]277-the onlookers , a rather inexplicable fancy to [the young man]181-the young man . [He]79-lingard sang [his]79-lingard praises , late at night , over a convivial glass to [[his]79-lingard cronies]279-his cronies in [the Sunda Hotel]248-the sunda hotel , and one fine morning electrified [Vinck]76-mr. vinck by declaring that [he]76-mr. vinck must have " [that young fellow]2597-that young fellow for a supercargo . [Kind of [[captain]2599-captain 's clerk]2600-captain 's clerk]2598-kind of captain 's clerk . Do all [my]79-lingard quill - driving for [me]79-lingard . "[79-lingard] [Hudig]75-macassar consented . [Almayer]72-almayer , with [youth]281-youth 's natural craving for change , was nothing loth , and packing [his]181-the young man few belongings , started in [the Flash]282-the flash on one of those long cruises when [the old seaman]283-the old seaman was wo nt to visit [almost every island in [the archipelago]285-the archipelago]284-almost every island in the archipelago . Months slipped by , and [Lingard]79-lingard 's friendship seemed to increase . Often pacing [the deck]286-the deck with [Almayer]72-almayer , when the faint night breeze , heavy with aromatic exhalations of [the islands]217-the islands , shoved [the brig]288-the brig gently along under the peaceful and sparkling sky , did [the old seaman]283-the old seaman open [his]283-the old seaman heart to [his]283-the old seaman entranced listener . [He]283-the old seaman spoke of [his]283-the old seaman past life , of escaped dangers , of big profits in [his]283-the old seaman trade , of new combinations that were in the future to bring profits bigger still . Often [he]283-the old seaman had mentioned [[his]283-the old seaman daughter]162-his daughter , [the girl found in [the pirate prau]292-the pirate prau]291-the girl found in the pirate prau , speaking of [her]162-his daughter with a strange assumption of fatherly tenderness . " [She]162-his daughter must be [a big girl]2601-a big girl now , "[283-the old seaman] [he]283-the old seaman used to say . " It 's nigh unto four years since [I]283-the old seaman have seen [her]162-his daughter ! [Damme]81-damme , [Almayer]72-almayer , if [I]283-the old seaman do n't think [we]2602-we will run into [Sourabaya]16-sourabaya this trip . "[283-the old seaman] And after such a declaration [he]283-the old seaman always dived into [[his]283-the old seaman cabin]293-his cabin muttering to [himself]283-the old seaman , " Something must be done - must be done . "[283-the old seaman] More than once [he]283-the old seaman would astonish [Almayer]72-almayer by walking up to [him]283-the old seaman rapidly , clearing [his]283-the old seaman throat with a powerful " Hem ! "[283-the old seaman] as if [he]283-the old seaman was going to say something , and then turning abruptly away to lean over [the bulwarks]294-the bulwarks in silence , and watch , motionless , for hours , the gleam and sparkle of the phosphorescent sea along [the ship]295-the ship 's side . It was the night before arriving in [Sourabaya]16-sourabaya when one of those attempts at confidential communication succeeded . After clearing [his]283-the old seaman throat [he]283-the old seaman spoke . [He]283-the old seaman spoke to some purpose . [He]283-the old seaman wanted [Almayer]72-almayer to marry [[his]283-the old seaman adopted daughter]296-his adopted daughter . " And do n't [you]297-the surprised young man kick because [you]297-the surprised young man 're white ! "[283-the old seaman] [he]283-the old seaman shouted , suddenly , not giving [the surprised young man]297-the surprised young man the time to say a word . " None of that with [me]283-the old seaman ! [Nobody]163-nobody will see the colour of [[your]297-the surprised young man wife]2604-your wife 's skin . The dollars are too thick for that , [I]283-the old seaman tell [you]297-the surprised young man ! And mind [you]297-the surprised young man , they will be thicker yet before [I]283-the old seaman die . There will be [millions]2605-millions , [Kaspar]70-kaspar ! Millions [I]283-the old seaman say ! And all for [her]2604-your wife - and for [you]297-the surprised young man , if [you]297-the surprised young man do what [you]297-the surprised young man are told . "[283-the old seaman] Startled by the unexpected proposal , [Almayer]72-almayer hesitated , and remained silent for a minute . [He]283-the old seaman was gifted with a strong and active imagination , and in that short space of time [he]283-the old seaman saw , as in a flash of dazzling light , great piles of [shining guilders]298-shining guilders , and realised all the possibilities of an opulent existence . The consideration , the indolent ease of life - for which [he]283-the old seaman felt [himself]283-the old seaman so well fitted - [[his]283-the old seaman ships]299-his ships , [[his]283-the old seaman warehouses]300-his warehouses , [his]283-the old seaman merchandise [old Lingard]79-lingard would not live for ever , and , crowning all , in the far future gleamed like [a fairy palace [the big mansion in [Amsterdam]10-amsterdam]302-the big mansion in amsterdam]301-a fairy palace the big mansion in amsterdam , [that earthly paradise of [his]283-the old seaman dreams , where , made king amongst [men]304-men by [old Lingard]79-lingard 's money]303-that earthly paradise of his dreams , where , made king amongst men by old lingard 's money , [he]283-the old seaman would pass the evening of [his]283-the old seaman days in inexpressible splendour . As to the other side of the picture - the companionship for life of [a Malay girl]305-a malay girl , that legacy of [a boatful of [pirates]307-pirates]306-a boatful of pirates - there was only within [him]283-the old seaman a confused consciousness of shame that [he]283-the old seaman [a white man]242-a white man - Still , a convent education of four years ! - and then [she]305-a malay girl may mercifully die . [He]283-the old seaman was always lucky , and money is powerful ! Go through it . Why not ? [He]283-the old seaman had a vague idea of shutting [her]305-a malay girl up somewhere , anywhere , out of [his]283-the old seaman gorgeous future . Easy enough to dispose of [a Malay woman]309-a malay woman , [a slave]310-a slave , after all , to [[his]283-the old seaman Eastern mind]311-his eastern mind , [convent]312-convent or [no convent]313-no convent , ceremony or no ceremony . [He]283-the old seaman lifted [his]283-the old seaman head and confronted [the anxious yet irate seaman]314-the anxious yet irate seaman . " [I]283-the old seaman - of course - anything [you]283-the old seaman wish , [Captain Lingard]79-lingard . "[283-the old seaman] " Call [me]315-the mollified old adventurer [father]2606-father , [[my]315-the mollified old adventurer boy]2607-my boy . [She]305-a malay girl does , "[315-the mollified old adventurer] said [the mollified old adventurer]315-the mollified old adventurer . " [Damme]81-damme , though , if [I]315-the mollified old adventurer did n't think [you]283-the old seaman were going to refuse . Mind [you]283-the old seaman , [Kaspar]70-kaspar , [I]315-the mollified old adventurer always get [my]315-the mollified old adventurer way , so it would have been no use . But [you]283-the old seaman are [no fool]2608-no fool . "[315-the mollified old adventurer] [He]283-the old seaman remembered well that time - the look , the accent , the words , the effect they produced on [him]283-the old seaman , [his]283-the old seaman very surroundings . [He]283-the old seaman remembered [the narrow slanting deck of [the brig]288-the brig]316-the narrow slanting deck of the brig , [the silent sleeping coast]318-the silent sleeping coast , the smooth black surface of [the sea]171-the sea with a great bar of gold laid on it by the rising moon . [He]283-the old seaman remembered it all , and [he]283-the old seaman remembered [his]283-the old seaman feelings of mad exultation at the thought of that fortune thrown into [his]283-the old seaman hands . [He]283-the old seaman was [no fool]2608-no fool then , and [he]283-the old seaman was [no fool]2608-no fool now . Circumstances had been against [him]283-the old seaman ; the fortune was gone , but hope remained . [He]283-the old seaman shivered in the night air , and suddenly became aware of the intense darkness which , on the sun 's departure , had closed in upon [the river]170-the river , blotting out the outlines of [the opposite shore]323-the opposite shore . Only the fire of dry branches lit outside [the stockade of the Rajah 's compound]324-the stockade of the rajah 's compound called fitfully into view the ragged trunks of the surrounding trees , putting a stain of glowing red half - way across [the river]170-the river where the drifting logs were hurrying towards [the sea]171-the sea through the impenetrable gloom . [He]283-the old seaman had a hazy recollection of having been called some time during the evening by [[his]283-the old seaman wife]327-his wife . To [his]283-the old seaman dinner probably . But [a man busy contemplating the wreckage of [his]283-the old seaman past in the dawn of new hopes]328-a man busy contemplating the wreckage of his past in the dawn of new hopes can not be hungry whenever [his]283-the old seaman rice is ready . Time [he]283-the old seaman went [home]243-home , though ; it was getting late . [He]283-the old seaman stepped cautiously on the loose planks towards the ladder . [A lizard , disturbed by the noise]330-a lizard , disturbed by the noise , emitted a plaintive note and scurried through the long grass growing on [the bank]331-the bank . [Almayer]72-almayer descended the ladder carefully , now thoroughly recalled to the realities of life by the care necessary to prevent a fall on the uneven ground where the stones , decaying planks , and half - sawn beams were piled up in inextricable confusion . As [he]283-the old seaman turned towards [the house where [he]283-the old seaman lived]332-the house where he lived - " [[my]283-the old seaman old house]2609-my old house "[283-the old seaman] [he]283-the old seaman called [it]332-the house where he lived - [his]283-the old seaman ear detected the splash of paddles away in the darkness of [the river]170-the river . [He]283-the old seaman stood still in the path , attentive and surprised at anybody being on [the river]170-the river at this late hour during such a heavy freshet . Now [he]283-the old seaman could hear the paddles distinctly , and even a rapidly exchanged word in low tones , the heavy breathing of [men fighting with the current]335-men fighting with the current , and hugging the bank on which [he]283-the old seaman stood . Quite close , too , but it was too dark to distinguish anything under the overhanging bushes . " [Arabs]82-the arabs , no doubt , "[72-almayer] muttered [Almayer]72-almayer to [himself]72-almayer , peering into the solid blackness . " What are [they]339-they up to now ? Some of [Abdulla]83-abdulla 's business ; curse [him]83-abdulla ! "[72-almayer] [The boat]336-the boat was very close now . " Oh , ya ! [Man]2610-man ! "[72-almayer] hailed [Almayer]72-almayer . The sound of voices ceased , but the paddles worked as furiously as before . Then [the bush in front of [Almayer]72-almayer]337-the bush in front of almayer shook , and the sharp sound of the paddles falling into [the canoe]338-the canoe rang in the quiet night . " But [you]74-dain are too far here . "[72-almayer] There was no answer to that invitation . " What is it ? "[72-almayer] asked [Almayer]72-almayer , uneasily . " There is nothing wrong with [the brig]288-the brig , [I]72-almayer hope ? The bush , released from the grasp of the bowman , sprung back with a swish , scattering a shower of muddy water over [Almayer]72-almayer , as [he]344-he bent forward , trying to see . In a little while [the canoe]338-the canoe shot into the streak of light that streamed on [the river]170-the river from the big fire on [the opposite shore]323-the opposite shore , disclosing the outline of [two men]348-two men bending to [their]348-two men work , and [a third figure in the stern flourishing the steering paddle]349-a third figure in the stern flourishing the steering paddle , [his]349-a third figure in the stern flourishing the steering paddle head covered with an enormous round hat , like a fantastically exaggerated mushroom . [Almayer]72-almayer watched [the canoe]338-the canoe till it passed out of the line of light . Shortly after the murmur of many voices reached [him]344-he across [the water]351-the water . [He]344-he could see the torches being snatched out of the burning pile , and rendering visible for a moment the gate in the stockade round which [they]348-two men crowded . Then [they]348-two men went in apparently . The torches disappeared , and the scattered fire sent out only a dim and fitful glare . [Almayer]72-almayer stepped homewards with long strides and mind uneasy . Surely [Dain]74-dain was not thinking of playing [him]344-he false . It was absurd . [Dain]74-dain and [Lakamba]85-lakamba were both too much interested in the success of [his]344-he scheme . Trusting to [Malays]86-malays was poor work ; but then [even Malays]352-even malays have some sense and understand [their]352-even malays own interest . All would be well - must be well . At this point in [his]344-he meditation [he]344-he found [himself]344-he at the foot of the steps leading to [the verandah of [[his]344-he home]189-his home]353-the verandah of his home . From [the low point of land]355-the low point of land where [he]344-he stood [he]344-he could see [both branches of [the river]170-the river]356-both branches of the river . [The main branch of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]358-the main branch of the pantai was lost in complete darkness , for the fire at [the Rajah 's]359-the rajah 's had gone out altogether ; but up [the Sambir]87-sambir reach [his]344-he eye could follow the long line of [Malay houses crowding [the bank]331-the bank]360-malay houses crowding the bank , with here and there a dim light twinkling through bamboo walls , or a smoky torch burning on the platforms built out over [the river]170-the river . Further away , where [the island]363-the island ended in [a low cliff]364-a low cliff , rose [a dark mass of buildings towering above [the Malay structures]366-the malay structures]365-a dark mass of buildings towering above the malay structures . Founded solidly on [a firm ground with plenty of space]367-a firm ground with plenty of space , starred by many lights burning strong and white , with a suggestion of paraffin and lamp- glasses , stood [the house]169-the house and [the godowns of [Abdulla bin Selim]88-abdulla bin selim]369-the godowns of abdulla bin selim , [the great trader of [Sambir]20-sambir]370-the great trader of sambir . To [Almayer]72-almayer the sight was very distasteful , and [he]344-he shook [his]344-he fist towards [the buildings that in [their]371-the buildings that in their evident prosperity looked to him cold and insolent , and contemptuous of his own fallen fortunes evident prosperity looked to [him]344-he cold and insolent , and contemptuous of [his]344-he own fallen fortunes]371-the buildings that in their evident prosperity looked to him cold and insolent , and contemptuous of his own fallen fortunes . [He]344-he mounted the steps of [[his]344-he house]372-his house slowly . In the middle of [the verandah]156-the verandah there was a round table . On [it]374-it a paraffin lamp without a globe shed a hard glare on the three inner sides . The fourth side was open , and faced [the river]170-the river . Between the rough supports of the high - pitched roof hung torn rattan screens . There was no ceiling , and the harsh brilliance of the lamp was toned above into a soft half- light that lost itself in the obscurity amongst the rafters . The front wall was cut in two by the doorway of a central passage closed by a red curtain . [[The women]376-the women 's room]377-the women 's room opened into [that passage]378-that passage , which led to [the back courtyard]379-the back courtyard and to [the cooking shed]380-the cooking shed . In one of the side walls there was a doorway . Half obliterated words - " Office : [Lingard]79-lingard and Co. "[376-the women] - were still legible on the dusty door , which looked as if it had not been opened for a very long time . Close to the other side wall stood a bent- wood rocking - chair , and by the table and about [the verandah]156-the verandah four wooden armchairs straggled forlornly , as if ashamed of [their]382-their shabby surroundings . A heap of common mats lay in one corner , with an old hammock slung diagonally above . In the other corner , [his]344-he head wrapped in a piece of red calico , huddled into a shapeless heap , slept [a Malay]89-malay , [one of [[Almayer]72-almayer 's domestic slaves]384-almayer 's domestic slaves]383-one of almayer 's domestic slaves - " [[my]344-he own people]2626-my own people , "[344-he] [he]344-he used to call [them]385-them . [A numerous and representative assembly of moths]386-a numerous and representative assembly of moths were holding high revels round the lamp to the spirited music of swarming mosquitoes . Under the palm - leaf thatch lizards raced on the beams calling softly . A monkey , chained to one of [the verandah supports]387-the verandah supports - retired for the night under the eaves - peered and grinned at [Almayer]72-almayer , as it swung to one of the bamboo roof sticks and caused a shower of dust and bits of dried leaves to settle on the shabby table . The floor was uneven , with many withered plants and dried earth scattered about . A general air of squalid neglect pervaded [the place]193-the place . Great red stains on the floor and walls testified to frequent and indiscriminate betel - nut chewing . The light breeze from [the river]170-the river swayed gently the tattered blinds , sending from [the woods]390-the woods opposite a faint and sickly perfume as of decaying flowers . Under [Almayer]72-almayer 's heavy tread the boards of [the verandah]156-the verandah creaked loudly . [The sleeper in the corner]392-the sleeper in the corner moved uneasily , muttering indistinct words . [Nina]73-nina stood by the table , one hand lightly resting on its edge , the other hanging listlessly by [her]73-nina side . [Her]73-nina face turned towards the outer darkness , through which [her]73-nina dreamy eyes seemed to see some entrancing picture , wore a look of impatient expectancy . [She]73-nina was tall for [a half- caste]395-a half- caste , with the correct profile of [the father]184-the father , modified and strengthened by the squareness of the lower part of the face inherited from [[her]73-nina maternal ancestors]397-her maternal ancestors - [the Sulu pirates]235-the sulu pirates . [Her]73-nina firm mouth , with the lips slightly parted and disclosing a gleam of white teeth , put a vague suggestion of ferocity into the impatient expression of [her]73-nina features . And yet [her]73-nina dark and perfect eyes had all the tender softness of expression common to [Malay women]399-malay women , but with a gleam of superior intelligence ; [they]400-they looked gravely , wide open and steady , as if facing something invisible to all other eyes , while [she]73-nina stood there all in white , straight , flexible , graceful , unconscious of [herself]73-nina , [her]73-nina low but broad forehead crowned with a shining mass of long black hair that fell in heavy tresses over [her]73-nina shoulders , and made [her]73-nina pale olive complexion look paler still by the contrast of its coal - black hue . [[my]184-the father friend]2646-my friend [Abdulla]88-abdulla bin selim , "[184-the father] [he]184-the father cried , " [we]404-we shall see who will have the best of it after all these years ! "[184-the father] [He]184-the father looked up [the river]170-the river and remarked calmly : " Another thunderstorm . Well ! " [You]2644-little girl do not seem to be very happy to - night , but to - morrow [you]2644-little girl will show a brighter face . Eh ? "[184-the father] [Nina]73-nina had listened to [[her]73-nina father]408-her father with [her]73-nina face unmoved , with [her]73-nina half - closed eyes still gazing into the night now made more intense by a heavy thunder - cloud that had crept down from [the hills]409-the hills blotting out the stars , merging sky , forest , and [river]410-river into one mass of almost palpable blackness . The faint breeze had died out , but the distant rumble of thunder and pale flashes of lightning gave warning of the approaching storm . With a sigh [the girl]402-the girl turned towards the table . [Almayer]72-almayer was in [his]184-the father hammock now , already half asleep . " Take the lamp , [Nina]73-nina , "[184-the father] [he]184-the father muttered , drowsily . " [This place]2648-this place is full of mosquitoes . Go to sleep , [daughter]2649-daughter . "[184-the father] But [Nina]73-nina put the lamp out and turned back again towards the balustrade of [the verandah]156-the verandah , standing with [her]73-nina arm round the wooden support and looking eagerly towards [the Pantai reach]413-the pantai reach . And motionless there in the oppressive calm of the tropical night [she]73-nina could see at each flash of lightning [the forest lining both banks up [the river]170-the river]414-the forest lining both banks up the river , bending before the furious blast of the coming tempest , [the upper reach of [the river]170-the river]416-the upper reach of the river whipped into white foam by the wind , and the black clouds torn into fantastic shapes trailing low over the swaying trees . Round [her]73-nina all was as yet stillness and peace , but [she]73-nina could hear afar off the roar of the wind , the hiss of heavy rain , the wash of the waves on [the tormented river]418-the tormented river . It came nearer and nearer , with loud thunder - claps and long flashes of vivid lightning , followed by short periods of appalling blackness . When the storm reached [the low point dividing [the river]170-the river]419-the low point dividing the river , [the house]169-the house shook in the wind , and the rain pattered loudly on the palm - leaf roof , the thunder spoke in one prolonged roll , and the incessant lightning disclosed a turmoil of leaping waters , driving logs , and the big trees bending before a brutal and merciless force . Undisturbed by the nightly event of the rainy monsoon , [the father]184-the father slept quietly , oblivious alike of [his]184-the father hopes , [his]184-the father misfortunes , [[his]184-the father friends]423-his friends , and [[his]184-the father enemies]424-his enemies ; and [the daughter]425-the daughter stood motionless , at each flash of lightning eagerly scanning [the broad river]167-the broad river with a steady and anxious gaze . CHAPTER II . When , in compliance with [Lingard]79-lingard 's abrupt demand , [Almayer]72-almayer consented to [we]427-we d [the Malay girl]428-the malay girl , [no one]429-no one knew that on the day when [the interesting young convert]430-the interesting young convert had lost all [her]428-the malay girl natural relations and found [a white father]431-a white father , [she]428-the malay girl had been fighting desperately like the rest of [them]432-them on board [the prau]433-the prau , and was only prevented from leaping overboard , like [the few other survivors]434-the few other survivors , by a severe wound in the leg . There , on [the fore - deck of [the prau]433-the prau]435-the fore - deck of the prau , [old Lingard]79-lingard found [her]428-the malay girl under [a heap of dead and dying pirates]437-a heap of dead and dying pirates , and had [her]428-the malay girl carried on the poop of the Flash before [the Malay craft]438-the malay craft was set on fire and sent adrift . [She]428-the malay girl was conscious , and in the great peace and stillness of the tropical evening succeeding the turmoil of the battle , [she]428-the malay girl watched all [she]428-the malay girl held dear on [earth]439-earth after [her]428-the malay girl own savage manner , drift away into the gloom in a great roar of flame and smoke . [She]428-the malay girl lay there unheeding the careful hands attending to [her]428-the malay girl wound , silent and absorbed in gazing at the funeral pile of [those brave men [she]428-the malay girl had so much admired and so well helped in [their]432-them contest with the redoubtable " Rajah - Laut]2650-those brave men she had so much admired and so well helped in their contest with the redoubtable " rajah - laut . "[2650-those brave men she had so much admired and so well helped in their contest with the redoubtable " rajah - laut] The light night breeze fanned [the brig]288-the brig gently to the southward , and the great blaze of light got smaller and smaller till it twinkled only on the horizon like a setting star . It set : the heavy canopy of smoke reflected the glare of hidden flames for a short time and then disappeared also . [She]428-the malay girl realised that with this vanishing gleam [her]428-the malay girl old life departed too . Thenceforth there was slavery in [the far countries]441-the far countries , amongst [strangers]442-strangers , in [unknown and perhaps terrible surroundings]443-unknown and perhaps terrible surroundings . Being fourteen years old , [she]428-the malay girl realised [her]428-the malay girl position and came to that conclusion , the only one possible to [a Malay girl]305-a malay girl , soon ripened under a tropical sun , and not unaware of [her]428-the malay girl personal charms , of which [she]428-the malay girl heard [many a young brave warrior of [[her]428-the malay girl father 's crew]446-her father 's crew]445-many a young brave warrior of her father 's crew express an appreciative admiration . There was in [her]428-the malay girl the dread of the unknown ; otherwise [she]428-the malay girl accepted [her]428-the malay girl position calmly , after the manner of [[her]428-the malay girl people]447-her people , and even considered it quite natural ; for was [she]428-the malay girl not [a daughter of [warriors]449-warriors]448-a daughter of warriors , conquered in battle , and did [she]428-the malay girl not belong rightfully to [the victorious Rajah]450-the victorious rajah ? Even the evident kindness of [the terrible old man]451-the terrible old man must spring , [she]428-the malay girl thought , from admiration for [[his]451-the terrible old man captive]452-his captive , and the flattered vanity eased for [her]428-the malay girl the pangs of sorrow after such an awful calamity . Perhaps had [she]428-the malay girl known of the high walls , [the quiet gardens]453-the quiet gardens , and [the silent nuns of [the Samarang convent]455-the samarang convent]454-the silent nuns of the samarang convent , where [her]428-the malay girl destiny was leading [her]428-the malay girl , [she]428-the malay girl would have sought death in [her]428-the malay girl dread and hate of such a restraint . But in imagination [she]428-the malay girl pictured to [herself]428-the malay girl the usual life of [a Malay girl]305-a malay girl - the usual succession of heavy work and fierce love , of intrigues , gold ornaments , of domestic drudgery , and of that great but occult influence which is one of the few rights of [half - savage womankind]457-half - savage womankind . But [her]428-the malay girl destiny in the rough hands of the old sea - dog , acting under unreasoning impulses of the heart , took a strange and to [her]428-the malay girl a terrible shape . [She]428-the malay girl bore it all - the restraint and the teaching and the new faith - with calm submission , concealing [her]428-the malay girl hate and contempt for all that new life . [She]428-the malay girl learned the language very easily , yet understood but little of the new faith [the good sisters]458-the good sisters taught [her]428-the malay girl , assimilating quickly only the superstitious elements of the religion . [She]428-the malay girl called [[Lingard]79-lingard [father]2606-father]459-lingard father , gently and caressingly , at each of [his]79-lingard short and noisy visits , under the clear impression that [he]79-lingard was a great and dangerous power it was good to propitiate . Was [he]79-lingard not now [[her]428-the malay girl master]394-her master ? And during those long four years [she]428-the malay girl nourished a hope of finding favour in [his]79-lingard eyes and ultimately becoming [[his]79-lingard wife]327-his wife , [counsellor]463-counsellor , and [guide]464-guide . Those dreams of the future were dispelled by [the Rajah Laut]78-the rajah 's " fiat , "[78-the rajah] which made [Almayer]72-almayer 's fortune , as [that young man]465-that young man fondly hoped . And dressed in the hateful finery of [Europe]4-europe , the centre of [an interested circle of Batavian society]466-an interested circle of batavian society , [the young convert]467-the young convert stood before the altar with [an unknown and sulky - looking white man]468-an unknown and sulky - looking white man . For [Almayer]72-almayer was uneasy , a little disgusted , and greatly inclined to run away . A judicious fear of [the adopted father - in - law]469-the adopted father - in - law and a just regard for [his]469-the adopted father - in - law own material welfare prevented [him]469-the adopted father - in - law from making a scandal ; yet , while swearing fidelity , [he]469-the adopted father - in - law was concocting plans for getting rid of [the pretty Malay girl]470-the pretty malay girl in a more or less distant future . [She]428-the malay girl , however , had retained enough of conventual teaching to understand well that according to [white men]471-white men 's laws [she]428-the malay girl was going to be [[Almayer]72-almayer 's companion]472-almayer 's companion and not [[his]469-the adopted father - in - law slave]473-his slave , and promised to [herself]428-the malay girl to act accordingly . So when [the Flash]282-the flash freighted with materials for building [a new house]475-a new house left [the harbour of [Batavia]21-batavia]476-the harbour of batavia , taking away [the young couple]477-the young couple into [the unknown]478-the unknown [Borneo]91-borneo , [she]428-the malay girl did not carry on [her]428-the malay girl deck so much love and happiness as [old Lingard]79-lingard was wo nt to boast of before [[his]79-lingard casual friends]479-his casual friends in [the verandahs of [various hotels]481-various hotels]480-the verandahs of various hotels . [The old seaman]283-the old seaman [himself]283-the old seaman was perfectly happy . Now [he]283-the old seaman had done [his]283-the old seaman duty by [the girl]402-the girl . " [You]428-the malay girl know [I]283-the old seaman made [her]402-the girl [an orphan]2651-an orphan , "[283-the old seaman] [he]283-the old seaman often concluded solemnly , when talking about [his]283-the old seaman own affairs to [a scratch audience of shore loafers]484-a scratch audience of shore loafers - as it was [his]283-the old seaman habit to do . And the approbative shouts of [[his]283-the old seaman half - intoxicated auditors]485-his half - intoxicated auditors filled [his]283-the old seaman simple soul with delight and pride . " [I]283-the old seaman carry everything right through , "[283-the old seaman] was another of [his]283-the old seaman sayings , and in pursuance of that principle [he]283-the old seaman pushed the building of [[house]486-house and [godowns]488-godowns on [the Pantai River]22-the pantai river]487-house and godowns on the pantai river with feverish haste . [The house]169-the house for [the young couple]477-the young couple ; the godowns for the big trade [Almayer]72-almayer was going to develop while [he]283-the old seaman [Lingard]79-lingard would be able to give [himself]79-lingard up to some mysterious work which was only spoken of in hints , but was understood to relate to gold and diamonds in [the interior of [the island]363-the island]491-the interior of the island . [Almayer]72-almayer was impatient too . Had [he]283-the old seaman known what was before [him]283-the old seaman [he]283-the old seaman might not have been so eager and full of hope as [he]283-the old seaman stood watching the last canoe of the [Lingard]79-lingard expedition disappear in [the bend up [the river]170-the river]493-the bend up the river . When , turning round , [he]283-the old seaman beheld [the pretty little house]495-the pretty little house , [the big godowns built neatly by [an army of Chinese carpenters]497-an army of chinese carpenters]496-the big godowns built neatly by an army of chinese carpenters , [the new jetty round which were clustered [the trading canoes]499-the trading canoes]498-the new jetty round which were clustered the trading canoes , [he]283-the old seaman felt a sudden elation in the thought that [the world]190-the world was [his]283-the old seaman . But [the world]190-the world had to be conquered first , and its conquest was not so easy as [he]283-the old seaman thought . [He]283-the old seaman was very soon made to understand that [he]283-the old seaman was not wanted in [that corner of [it]190-the world]502-that corner of it where [old Lingard]79-lingard and [his]79-lingard own weak will placed [him]283-the old seaman , in the midst of unscrupulous intrigues and of a fierce trade competition . [The Arabs]503-the arabs had found out [the river]170-the river , had established [a trading post in [Sambir]20-sambir]505-a trading post in sambir , and where [they]503-the arabs traded [they]503-the arabs would be [masters]506-masters and suffer [no rival]507-no rival . [Lingard]79-lingard returned unsuccessful from [his]79-lingard first expedition , and departed again spending all the profits of the legitimate trade on [his]79-lingard mysterious journeys . [Almayer]72-almayer struggled with the difficulties of [his]283-the old seaman position , friendless and unaided , save for the protection given to [him]283-the old seaman for [Lingard]79-lingard 's sake by [the old Rajah]78-the rajah , [the predecessor of [Lakamba]85-lakamba]508-the predecessor of lakamba . [Lakamba]85-lakamba [himself]85-lakamba , then living as [a private individual]509-a private individual on [a rice clearing]510-a rice clearing , seven miles down [the river]170-the river , exercised all [his]85-lakamba influence towards the help of [[the white man]512-the white man 's enemies]513-the white man 's enemies , plotting against [the old Rajah]78-the rajah and [Almayer]72-almayer with a certainty of combination , pointing clearly to a profound knowledge of [their]514-their most secret affairs . Outwardly friendly , [his]85-lakamba portly form was often to be seen on [[Almayer]72-almayer 's verandah]515-almayer 's verandah ; [his]85-lakamba green turban and gold - embroidered jacket shone in the front rank of the decorous throng of Malays coming to greet [Lingard]79-lingard on [his]85-lakamba returns from [the interior]516-the interior ; [his]85-lakamba salaams were of the lowest , and [his]85-lakamba hand- shakings of the heartiest , when welcoming [the old trader]517-the old trader . But [his]85-lakamba small eyes took in the signs of the times , and [he]85-lakamba departed from those interviews with a satisfied and furtive smile to hold long consultations with [[his]85-lakamba friend]518-his friend and ally , [Syed Abdulla]83-abdulla , [the chief of [the Arab trading post]520-the arab trading post]519-the chief of the arab trading post , [a man of great wealth and of great influence in [the islands]217-the islands]521-a man of great wealth and of great influence in the islands . It was currently believed at that time in [the settlement]523-the settlement that [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's visits to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house were not limited to those official interviews . Often on moonlight nights [the belated fishermen of [Sambira]23-sambira]525-the belated fishermen of sambira saw [a small canoe]526-a small canoe shooting out from [the narrow creek]527-the narrow creek at the back of [[the white man]512-the white man 's house]529-the white man 's house , and [the solitary occupant]530-the solitary occupant paddle cautiously down [the river]170-the river in the deep shadows of [the bank]331-the bank ; and those events , duly reported , were discussed round the evening fires far into the night with the cynicism of expression common to [aristocratic Malays]533-aristocratic malays , and with a malicious pleasure in the domestic misfortunes of [the Orang Blando]92-the orang blando - [the hated Dutchman]534-the hated dutchman . [Almayer]72-almayer went on struggling desperately , but with a feebleness of purpose depriving [him]535-he of all chance of success against [men so unscrupulous and resolute as [[his]535-he rivals [the Arabs]82-the arabs]537-his rivals the arabs]536-men so unscrupulous and resolute as his rivals the arabs . The trade fell away from [the large godowns]538-the large godowns , and [the godowns]539-the godowns [themselves]539-the godowns rotted piecemeal . [[The old man]540-the old man 's banker]541-the old man 's banker , [Hudig of Macassar]75-macassar , failed , and with this went the whole available capital . The profits of past years had been swallowed up in [Lingard]79-lingard 's exploring craze . [Lingard]79-lingard was in the interior - perhaps dead - at all events giving no sign of life . [Almayer]72-almayer stood alone in the midst of those adverse circumstances , deriving only a little comfort from the companionship of [[his]535-he little daughter]542-his little daughter , born two years after the marriage , and at the time some six years old . [[His]535-he wife]327-his wife had soon commenced to treat [him]535-he with a savage contempt expressed by sulky silence , only occasionally varied by a flood of savage invective . [He]535-he felt [she]327-his wife hated [him]535-he , and saw [her]327-his wife jealous eyes watching [himself]535-he and [the child]544-the child with almost an expression of hate . [She]327-his wife was jealous of [the little girl]545-the little girl 's evident preference for [the father]184-the father , and [Almayer]72-almayer felt [he]535-he was not safe with [that woman in [the house]169-the house]547-that woman in the house . While [she]327-his wife was burning the furniture , and tearing down the pretty curtains in [her]327-his wife unreasoning hate of those signs of civilisation , [Almayer]72-almayer , cowed by these outbursts of savage nature , meditated in silence on the best way of getting rid of [her]327-his wife . [He]535-he thought of everything ; even planned murder in an undecided and feeble sort of way , but dared do nothing - expecting every day the return of [Lingard]79-lingard with news of some immense good fortune . [He]535-he returned indeed , but aged , ill , a ghost of [[his]535-he former self]549-his former self , with the fire of fever burning in [his]535-he sunken eyes , almost [the only survivor of the numerous expedition]550-the only survivor of the numerous expedition . But [he]535-he was successful at last ! Untold riches were in [his]535-he grasp ; [he]535-he wanted more money - only a little more torealise a dream of fabulous fortune . And [Hudig]75-macassar had failed ! [Almayer]72-almayer scraped all [he]535-he could together , but [the old man]540-the old man wanted more . If [Almayer]72-almayer could not get it [he]540-the old man would go to [Singapore]24-singapore - to [Europe]4-europe even , but before all to [Singapore]24-singapore ; and [he]540-the old man would take [the little Nina]73-nina with [him]540-the old man . [The child]544-the child must be brought up decently . [He]540-the old man had [good friends in [Singapore]24-singapore who would take care of [her]544-the child and have [her]544-the child taught properly . All would be well , and [that girl]554-that girl , upon whom [the old seaman]283-the old seaman seemed to have transferred all [his]283-the old seaman former affection for [the mother]186-the mother]553-good friends in singapore who would take care of her and have her taught properly . all would be well , and that girl , upon whom the old seaman seemed to have transferred all his former affection for the mother , would be [the richest woman in [the East]558-the east]557-the richest woman in the east - in [the world]190-the world even . [So old Lingard]79-lingard shouted , pacing [the verandah]156-the verandah with [his]283-the old seaman heavy quarter- deck step , gesticulating with a smouldering cheroot ; ragged , dishevelled , enthusiastic ; and [Almayer]72-almayer , sitting huddled up on a pile of mats , thought with dread of the separation with [the only human being [he]540-the old man loved]561-the only human being he loved - with greater dread still , perhaps , of the scene with [[his]283-the old seaman wife]327-his wife , [the savage tigress deprived of [her]327-his wife young]563-the savage tigress deprived of her young . [She]327-his wife will poison [me]0-i , thought [the poor wretch , well aware of that easy and final manner of solving the social , political , or family problems in [Malay]89-malay life]564-the poor wretch , well aware of that easy and final manner of solving the social , political , or family problems in malay life . To [his]283-the old seaman great surprise [she]327-his wife took the news very quietly , giving only [him]283-the old seaman and [Lingard]79-lingard a furtive glance , and saying not a word . This , however , did not prevent [her]327-his wife the next day from jumping into [the river]170-the river and swimming after [the boat]336-the boat in which [Lingard]79-lingard was carrying away [the nurse]567-the nurse with [the screaming child]568-the screaming child . [Almayer]72-almayer had to give chase with [[his]540-the old man whale - boat]569-his whale - boat and drag [her]327-his wife in by the hair in the midst of cries and curses enough to make heaven fall . Yet after two days spent in wailing , [she]327-his wife returned to [her]327-his wife former mode of life , chewing betel - nut , and sitting all day amongst [[her]327-his wife women]570-her women in stupefied idleness . [She]327-his wife aged very rapidly after that , and only roused [herself]327-his wife from [her]327-his wife apathy to acknowledge by a scathing remark or an insulting exclamation the accidental presence of [[her]327-his wife husband]571-her husband . [He]571-her husband had built for [her]327-his wife [a riverside hut in [the compound]573-the compound where [she]327-his wife dwelt in perfect seclusion]572-a riverside hut in the compound where she dwelt in perfect seclusion . [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's visits had ceased when , by a convenient decree of [Providence]93-providence and the help of a little scientific manipulation , [the old ruler of [Sambir]20-sambir]574-the old ruler of sambir departed this life . [Lakamba]85-lakamba reigned in [his]85-lakamba stead now , having been well served by [[his]85-lakamba Arab friends]575-his arab friends with [the Dutch authorities]576-the dutch authorities . [Syed Abdulla]83-abdulla was [the great man and trader of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]577-the great man and trader of the pantai . [Almayer]72-almayer lay ruined and helpless under the close - meshed net of [their]578-their intrigues , owing [his]571-her husband life only to [his]571-her husband supposed knowledge of [Lingard]79-lingard 's valuable secret . [Lingard]79-lingard had disappeared . [He]571-her husband wrote once from [Singapore]24-singapore saying [the child]544-the child was well , and under the care of [a Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck , and that [he]571-her husband [himself]571-her husband was going to [Europe]4-europe to raise money for the great enterprise . " [He]571-her husband was coming back soon . There would be no difficulties , "[571-her husband] [he]571-her husband wrote ; " [people]2652-people would rush in with [their]2652-people money . "[571-her husband] Evidently [they]580-they did not , for there was only one letter more from [him]571-her husband saying [he]571-her husband was ill , had found [no relation living]581-no relation living , but little else besides . Then came a complete silence . [Europe]4-europe had swallowed up [the Rajah Laut]78-the rajah apparently , and [Almayer]72-almayer looked vainly westward for a ray of light out of the gloom of [his]571-her husband shattered hopes . Years passed , and the rare letters from [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck , later on from [the girl]402-the girl [herself]402-the girl , were the only thing to be looked to to make life bearable amongst the triumphant savagery of [the river]170-the river . [Almayer]72-almayer lived now alone , having even ceased to visit [[his]571-her husband debtors who would not pay , sure of [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's protection]584-his debtors who would not pay , sure of lakamba 's protection . [The faithful Sumatrese Ali]95-ali cooked [his]95-ali rice and made [his]95-ali coffee , for [he]95-ali dared not trust [any one else]585-any one else , and least of all [[his]95-ali wife]327-his wife . [He]95-ali killed time wandering sadly in [the overgrown paths round [the house]169-the house]587-the overgrown paths round the house , visiting [the ruined godowns]589-the ruined godowns where a few brass guns covered with verdigris and only a few broken cases of mouldering Manchester goods reminded [him]95-ali of the good early times when all this was full of life and merchandise , and [he]95-ali overlooked [a busy scene on [the river bank]591-the river bank]590-a busy scene on the river bank , [[his]95-ali little daughter]542-his little daughter by [his]95-ali side . Now [the up - country canoes]593-the up - country canoes glided past [the little rotten wharf of [Lingard]77-lingard and [Co.]27-co.]594-the little rotten wharf of lingard and co. , to paddle up [the [Pantai]3-the pantai branch]595-the pantai branch , and cluster round [the new jetty belonging to [Abdulla]83-abdulla]596-the new jetty belonging to abdulla . Not that [they]597-they loved [Abdulla]83-abdulla , but [they]597-they dared not trade with [the man whose star had set]598-the man whose star had set . Had [they]597-they done so [they]597-they knew there was no mercy to be expected from [Arab]96-arab or [Rajah]78-the rajah ; no rice to be got on credit in the times of scarcity from either ; and [Almayer]72-almayer could not help [them]597-they , having at times hardly enough for [himself]72-almayer . [Almayer]72-almayer , in [his]599-he isolation and despair , often envied [[his]599-he near neighbour]600-his near neighbour [the Chinaman]97-the chinaman , [Jim- Eng]98-jim- eng , whom [he]599-he could see stretched on a pile of cool mats , a wooden pillow under [his]98-jim- eng head , an opium pipe in [his]98-jim- eng nerveless fingers . [He]599-he did not seek , however , consolation in opium - perhaps it was too expensive - perhaps [[his]599-he white man]601-his white man 's pride saved [him]599-he from that degradation ; but most likely it was the thought of [[his]599-he little daughter]542-his little daughter in [the far - off [Straits Settlements]29-straits settlements]603-the far - off straits settlements . [He]599-he heard from [her]542-his little daughter oftener since [Abdulla]83-abdulla bought [a steamer]604-a steamer , which ran now between [Singapore]24-singapore and [the Pantai settlement]605-the pantai settlement every three months or so . [Almayer]72-almayer felt [himself]72-almayer nearer [[his]599-he daughter]162-his daughter . [He]599-he longed to see [her]542-his little daughter , and planned a voyage to [Singapore]24-singapore , but put off [his]599-he departure from year to year , always expecting some favourable turn of fortune . [He]599-he did not want to meet [her]542-his little daughter with empty hands and with no words of hope on [his]599-he lips . [He]599-he could not take [her]542-his little daughter back into that savage life to which [he]599-he was condemned [himself]599-he . [He]599-he was also a little afraid of [her]542-his little daughter . What would [she]542-his little daughter think of [him]599-he ? [He]599-he reckoned the years . [A grown woman]607-a grown woman . [A civilised woman]608-a civilised woman , young and hopeful ; while [he]599-he felt old and hopeless , and very much like [those savages round [him]599-he]609-those savages round him . [He]599-he asked [himself]599-he what was going to be [her]542-his little daughter future . [He]599-he could not answer that question yet , and [he]599-he dared not face [her]542-his little daughter . And yet [he]599-he longed after [her]542-his little daughter . [He]599-he hesitated for years . [His]599-he hesitation was put an end to by [Nina]73-nina 's unexpected appearance in [Sambir]20-sambir . [She]73-nina arrived in [the steamer]610-the steamer under [the captain]611-the captain 's care . [Almayer]72-almayer beheld [her]73-nina with surprise not unmixed with wonder . During those ten years [the child]544-the child had changed into [a woman]613-a woman , black - haired , olive - skinned , tall , and beautiful , with great sad eyes , where the startled expression common to [Malay womankind]614-malay womankind was modified by a thoughtful tinge inherited from [her]73-nina European ancestry . [Almayer]72-almayer thought with dismay of the meeting of [[his]599-he wife]327-his wife and [daughter]2649-daughter , of what [this grave girl in European clothes]617-this grave girl in european clothes would think of [[her]73-nina betel - nut chewing mother]618-her betel - nut chewing mother , squatting in [a dark hut]619-a dark hut , disorderly , half naked , and sulky . [He]599-he also feared an outbreak of temper on the part of [that pest of [a woman [he]599-he had hitherto managed to keep tolerably quiet , thereby saving the remnants of [his]599-he dilapidated furniture]621-a woman he had hitherto managed to keep tolerably quiet , thereby saving the remnants of his dilapidated furniture]620-that pest of a woman he had hitherto managed to keep tolerably quiet , thereby saving the remnants of his dilapidated furniture . And [he]599-he stood there before the closed door of [the hut]622-the hut in the blazing sunshine listening to the murmur of voices , wondering what went on inside , wherefrom [all the servant - maids]623-all the servant - maids had been expelled at the beginning of the interview , and now stood clustered by the palings with half - covered faces in a chatter of curious speculation . [He]599-he forgot [himself]599-he there trying to catch a stray word through the bamboo walls , till [the captain of [the steamer]610-the steamer , who had walked up with [the girl , fearing a sunstroke]626-the girl , fearing a sunstroke]624-the captain of the steamer , who had walked up with the girl , fearing a sunstroke , took [him]599-he under the arm and led [him]599-he into the shade of [[his]599-he own verandah]627-his own verandah : where [Nina]73-nina 's trunk stood already , having been landed by [[the steamer]610-the steamer 's men]629-the steamer 's men . As soon as [Captain Ford]99-ford had [his]99-ford glass before [him]99-ford and [his]99-ford cheroot lighted , [Almayer]72-almayer asked for the explanation of [[his]99-ford daughter]162-his daughter 's unexpected arrival . [Ford]99-ford said little beyond generalising in vague but violent terms upon the foolishness of [women]631-women in general , and of [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck in particular . " [You]72-almayer know , [Kaspar]70-kaspar , "[99-ford] said [he]99-ford , in conclusion , to the excited [Almayer]72-almayer , " it is deucedly awkward to have [a half - caste girl in [the house]169-the house]2653-a half - caste girl in the house . There 's [such a lot of [fools about]2656-fools about]2655-such a lot of fools about . There was [that young fellow from the bank who used to ride to [the Vinck bungalow]2658-the vinck bungalow early and late]2657-that young fellow from the bank who used to ride to the vinck bungalow early and late . [That old woman]2659-that old woman thought it was for [that Emma of [hers]2659-that old woman]2660-that emma of hers . When [she]2659-that old woman found out what [he]2657-that young fellow from the bank who used to ride to the vinck bungalow early and late wanted exactly , there was a row , [I]99-ford can tell [you]72-almayer . [She]2659-that old woman would not have [Nina]73-nina - not an hour longer - in [the house]169-the house . Fact is , [I]99-ford heard of this affair and took [the girl]402-the girl to [[my]99-ford wife]2663-my wife . [[My]99-ford wife]2663-my wife is [a pretty good woman]2665-a pretty good woman - as [women]631-women go - and upon [my]99-ford word [we]2667-we would have kept [the girl]402-the girl for [you]72-almayer , only [she]402-the girl would not stay . Now , then ! Do n't flare up , [Kaspar]70-kaspar . Sit still . What can [you]72-almayer do ? It is better so . Let [her]402-the girl stay with [you]72-almayer . [She]402-the girl was never happy over [there]2669-there . [Those two Vinck girls]2670-those two vinck girls are no better than dressed - up monkeys . [They]2670-those two vinck girls slighted [her]402-the girl . [You]72-almayer ca n't make [her]402-the girl white . It 's no use [you]72-almayer swearing at [me]99-ford . [You]72-almayer ca n't . [She]402-the girl is [a good girl]2671-a good girl for all that , but [she]402-the girl would not tell [[my]99-ford wife]2663-my wife anything . If [you]72-almayer want to know , ask [her]402-the girl [yourself]72-almayer ; but if [I]99-ford was [you]72-almayer [I]99-ford would leave [her]402-the girl alone . [You]72-almayer are welcome to [her]402-the girl passage money , [old fellow]2673-old fellow , if [you]72-almayer are short now . "[99-ford] And [the skipper]632-the skipper , throwing away [his]632-the skipper cigar , walked off to " wake [them]2674-them up on board , "[632-the skipper] as [he]632-the skipper expressed it . [Almayer]72-almayer vainly expected to hear of the cause of [[his]632-the skipper daughter]162-his daughter 's return from [[his]632-the skipper daughter]162-his daughter 's lips . Not that day , not on any other day did [she]162-his daughter ever allude to [her]162-his daughter Singapore life . [He]632-the skipper did not care to ask , awed by the calm impassiveness of [her]162-his daughter face , by those solemn eyes looking past [him]632-the skipper on the great , still forests sleeping in majestic repose to the murmur of [the broad river]167-the broad river . [He]632-the skipper accepted the situation , happy in the gentle and protecting affection [the girl]402-the girl showed [him]632-the skipper , fitfully enough , for [she]402-the girl had , as [she]402-the girl called it , [her]402-the girl bad days when [she]402-the girl used to visit [[her]402-the girl mother]637-her mother and remain long hours in [the riverside hut]638-the riverside hut , coming out as inscrutable as ever , but with a contemptuous look and a short word ready to answer any of [his]632-the skipper speeches . [He]632-the skipper got used even to that , and on those days kept quiet , although greatly alarmed by [[his]632-the skipper wife]327-his wife 's influence upon [the girl]402-the girl . [Otherwise Nina]73-nina adapted [herself]162-his daughter wonderfully to the circumstances of a half - savage and miserable life . [She]162-his daughter accepted without question or apparent disgust the neglect , the decay , the poverty of [the household]641-the household , the absence of furniture , and the preponderance of rice diet on the family table . [She]162-his daughter lived with [Almayer]72-almayer in [the little house now sadly decaying built originally by [Lingard]79-lingard for [the young couple]477-the young couple]642-the little house now sadly decaying built originally by lingard for the young couple . [The Malays]86-malays eagerly discussed [her]162-his daughter arrival . There were at the beginning [crowded levees of [Malay women]399-malay women with [[their]399-malay women children]646-their children]644-crowded levees of malay women with their children , seeking eagerly after " Ubat "[644-crowded levees of malay women with their children] for all the ills of the flesh from [the young Mem Putih]100-mem putih . In the cool of the evening [grave Arabs in long white shirts and yellow sleeveless jackets]647-grave arabs in long white shirts and yellow sleeveless jackets walked slowly on the dusty path by [the riverside]648-the riverside towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's gate]649-almayer 's gate , and made solemn calls upon [that Unbeliever]650-that unbeliever under shallow pretences of business , only to get a glimpse of [the young girl]651-the young girl in a highly decorous manner . [Even Lakamba]85-lakamba came out of [his]85-lakamba stockade in a great pomp of war canoes and red umbrellas , and landed on [the rotten little jetty of [Lingard]79-lingard]652-the rotten little jetty of lingard and [Co.]27-co. [He]85-lakamba came , [he]85-lakamba said , to buy a couple of brass guns as a present to [[his]85-lakamba friend]518-his friend [the chief of [Sambir Dyaks]87-sambir]654-the chief of sambir dyaks ; and while [Almayer]72-almayer , suspicious but polite , busied [himself]72-almayer in unearthing the old popguns in [the godowns]539-the godowns , [the Rajah]656-the rajah sat on an armchair in [the verandah]156-the verandah , surrounded by [[his]656-the rajah respectful retinue]658-his respectful retinue waiting in vain for [Nina]73-nina 's appearance . [She]73-nina was in one of [her]73-nina bad days , and remained in [[[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother 's hut]660-her mother 's hut watching with [her]73-nina the ceremonious proceedings on [the verandah]156-the verandah . [The Rajah]656-the rajah departed , baffled but courteous , and soon [Almayer]72-almayer began to reap the benefit of improved relations with [the ruler]663-the ruler in the shape of the recovery of some debts , paid to [him]656-the rajah with many apologies and many a low salaam by [debtors]664-debtors till then considered hopelessly insolvent . Under these improving circumstances [Almayer]72-almayer brightened up a little . All was not lost perhaps . [Those Arabs]82-the arabs and [Malays]665-malays saw at last that [he]656-the rajah was [a man of some ability]666-a man of some ability , [he]656-the rajah thought . And [he]656-the rajah began , after [his]656-the rajah manner , to plan great things , to dream of great fortunes for [himself]656-the rajah and [Nina]73-nina . Especially for [Nina]73-nina ! Under these vivifying impulses [he]656-the rajah asked [Captain Ford]99-ford to write to [[his]99-ford friends]423-his friends in [England]30-england making inquiries after [Lingard]79-lingard . Was [he]99-ford alive or dead ? If dead , had [he]99-ford left any papers , documents ; any indications or hints as to [his]99-ford great enterprise ? Meantime [he]656-the rajah had found amongst the rubbish in one of [the empty rooms]668-the empty rooms a note - book belonging to [the old adventurer]669-the old adventurer . [He]656-the rajah studied the crabbed handwriting of its pages and often grew meditative over it . Other things also woke [him]656-the rajah up from [his]656-the rajah apathy . The stir made in [the whole of [the island]363-the island]670-the whole of the island by the establishment of [the British Borneo Company]31-the british borneo company affected even the sluggish flow of [the Pantai]3-the pantai life . Great changes were expected ; annexation was talked of ; [the Arabs]503-the arabs grew civil . [Almayer]72-almayer began building [[his]656-the rajah new house]673-his new house for the use of [the future engineers]674-the future engineers , [agents]675-agents , or [settlers of [the new Company]677-the new company]676-settlers of the new company . [He]656-the rajah spent every available guilder on [it]673-his new house with a confiding heart . One thing only disturbed [his]656-the rajah happiness : [[his]656-the rajah wife]327-his wife came out of [her]327-his wife seclusion , importing [her]327-his wife green jacket , scant sarongs , shrill voice , and witch - like appearance , into [his]656-the rajah quiet life in [the small bungalow]679-the small bungalow . And [[his]656-the rajah daughter]162-his daughter seemed to accept that savage intrusion into [their]681-their daily existence with wonderful equanimity . [He]656-the rajah did not like it , but dared say nothing . CHAPTER III . The deliberations conducted in [London]1-london have a far - reaching importance , and so the decision issued from [the fog - veiled offices of [the Borneo Company]683-the borneo company]682-the fog - veiled offices of the borneo company darkened for [Almayer]72-almayer the brilliant sunshine of [the Tropics]32-the tropics , and added another drop of bitterness to the cup of [his]656-the rajah disenchantments . The claim to [that part of [the East Coast]33-the east coast]684-that part of the east coast was abandoned , leaving [the Pantai river]685-the pantai river under the nominal power of [Holland]34-holland . In [Sambir]20-sambir there was joy and excitement . [The slaves]686-the slaves were hurried out of sight into [the forest and jungle]687-the forest and jungle , and the flags were run up to tall poles in [the Rajah 's compound]688-the rajah 's compound in expectation of a visit from [Dutch man - of - war boats]689-dutch man - of - war boats . [The frigate]690-the frigate remained anchored outside [the mouth of [the river]170-the river]691-the mouth of the river , and [the boats]693-the boats came up in tow of [the steam launch]694-the steam launch , threading [their]693-the boats way cautiously amongst [a crowd of canoes filled with [gaily dressed Malays]696-gaily dressed malays]695-a crowd of canoes filled with gaily dressed malays . [The officer in command]697-the officer in command listened gravely to the loyal speeches of [Lakamba]85-lakamba , returned the salaams of [Abdulla]83-abdulla , and assured [those gentlemen in choice [Malay]89-malay of the great Rajah 's]698-those gentlemen in choice malay of the great rajah 's - down in [Batavia]21-batavia - friendship and goodwill towards [the ruler and inhabitants of [this model state of Sambir]700-this model state of sambir]699-the ruler and inhabitants of this model state of sambir .
