[Almayer]72-almayer from [[his]701-his verandah]702-his verandah watched across [the river]170-the river the festive proceedings , heard the report of brass guns saluting the new flag presented to [Lakamba]85-lakamba , and the deep murmur of [the crowd of spectators surging round the stockade]704-the crowd of spectators surging round the stockade . The smoke of the firing rose in white clouds on the green background of [the forests]705-the forests , and [he]701-his could not help comparing [his]701-his own fleeting hopes to the rapidly disappearing vapour . [He]701-his was by no means patriotically elated by the event , yet [he]701-his had to force [himself]701-his into a gracious behaviour when , the official reception being over , [the naval officers of [the Commission]707-the commission]706-the naval officers of the commission crossed [the river]170-the river to pay a visit to [the solitary white man of whom [they]706-the naval officers of the commission had heard]709-the solitary white man of whom they had heard , no doubt wishing also to catch a glimpse of [[his]701-his daughter]162-his daughter . In that [they]706-the naval officers of the commission were disappointed , [Nina]73-nina refusing to show [herself]73-nina ; but [they]706-the naval officers of the commission seemed easily consoled by the gin and cheroots set before [them]706-the naval officers of the commission by [the hospitable Almayer]72-almayer ; and sprawling comfortably on the lame armchairs under the shade of [the verandah]156-the verandah , while the blazing sunshine outside seemed to set [the great river]712-the great river simmering in the heat , [they]706-the naval officers of the commission filled [the little bungalow]713-the little bungalow with the unusual sounds of European languages , with noise and laughter produced by naval witticisms at the expense of [the fat Lakamba whom [they]706-the naval officers of the commission had been complimenting so much that very morning]714-the fat lakamba whom they had been complimenting so much that very morning . [The younger men in an access of good fellowship]715-the younger men in an access of good fellowship made [[their]715-the younger men in an access of good fellowship host]716-their host talk , and [Almayer]72-almayer , excited by the sight of European faces , by the sound of European voices , opened [his]701-his heart before [the sympathising strangers]717-the sympathising strangers , unaware of the amusement the recital of [his]701-his many misfortunes caused to [those future admirals]718-those future admirals . [They]717-the sympathising strangers drank [his]701-his health , wished [him]701-his many big diamonds and a mountain of gold , expressed even an envy of the high destinies awaiting [him]701-his yet . Encouraged by so much friendliness , [the grey- headed and foolish dreamer]719-the grey- headed and foolish dreamer invited [[his]701-his guests]720-his guests to visit [[his]701-his new house]673-his new house . [They]720-his guests went there through the long grass in a straggling procession while [[their]720-his guests boats]722-their boats were got ready for the return down [the river]170-the river in the cool of the evening . And in [the great empty rooms]724-the great empty rooms where the tepid wind entering through the sashless windows whirled gently the dried leaves and the dust of many days of neglect , [Almayer]72-almayer in [his]701-his white jacket and flowered sarong , surrounded by a circle of glittering uniforms , stamped [his]701-his foot to show the solidity of the neatly - fitting floors and expatiated upon the beauties and convenience of [the building]725-the building . [They]717-the sympathising strangers listened and assented , amazed by the wonderful simplicity and the foolish hopefulness of [the man]726-the man , till [Almayer]72-almayer , carried away by [his]701-his excitement , disclosed [his]701-his regret at the non - arrival of [the English]727-the english , " who knew how to develop [a rich country]2675-a rich country , "[701-his] as [he]701-his expressed it . There was a general laugh amongst [the Dutch officers]728-the dutch officers at that unsophisticated statement , and a move was made towards [the boats]693-the boats ; but when [Almayer]72-almayer , stepping cautiously on the rotten boards of [the Lingard jetty]730-the lingard jetty , tried to approach [the chief of the Commission]731-the chief of the commission with some timid hints anent the protection required by [the Dutch subject]732-the dutch subject against [the wily Arabs]82-the arabs , [that salt water diplomat]733-that salt water diplomat told [him]701-his significantly that [the Arabs]82-the arabs were [better subjects]734-better subjects than [Hollanders who dealt illegally in gunpowder with [the Malays]86-malays]735-hollanders who dealt illegally in gunpowder with the malays . [The innocent Almayer]72-almayer recognised there at once the oily tongue of [Abdulla]83-abdulla and the solemn persuasiveness of [Lakamba]85-lakamba , but ere [he]701-his had time to frame an indignant protest the steam launch and the string of [boats]736-boats moved rapidly down [the river]170-the river leaving [him]701-his on [the jetty]2614-the jetty , standing open - mouthed in [his]701-his surprise and anger . There are [thirty miles of river from [Sambir]20-sambir]739-thirty miles of river from sambir to [the gem - like islands of [the estuary]741-the estuary where [the frigate]690-the frigate was awaiting the return of [the boats]693-the boats]740-the gem - like islands of the estuary where the frigate was awaiting the return of the boats . The moon rose long before [the boats]693-the boats had traversed half that distance , and [the black forest]745-the black forest sleeping peacefully under [her]746-her cold rays woke up that night to the ringing laughter in the small flotilla provoked by some reminiscence of [Almayer]72-almayer 's lamentable narrative . Salt - water jests at [the poor man]747-the poor man 's expense were passed from [boat]748-boat to [boat]748-boat , the non - appearance of [[his]747-the poor man daughter]162-his daughter was commented upon with severe displeasure , and [the half - finished house built for the reception of [Englishmen]752-englishmen]751-the half - finished house built for the reception of englishmen received on that joyous night the name of " [Almayer]72-almayer 's Folly "[73-nina] by the unanimous vote of [the lighthearted seamen]753-the lighthearted seamen . For many weeks after this visit life in [Sambir]20-sambir resumed its even and uneventful flow . Each day 's sun shooting its morning rays above the tree- tops lit up the usual scene of daily activity . [Nina]73-nina walking on the path that formed [the only street in [the settlement]523-the settlement]754-the only street in the settlement saw the accustomed sight of [men]304-men lolling on the shady side of [the houses]757-the houses , on [the high platforms]758-the high platforms ; of [women]631-women busily engaged in husking the daily rice ; of [naked brown children]760-naked brown children racing along the shady and narrow paths leading to [the clearings]761-the clearings . [Jim- Eng]98-jim- eng , strolling before [[his]98-jim- eng house]372-his house , greeted [her]73-nina with a friendly nod before climbing up [indoors]763-indoors to seek [his]98-jim- eng beloved opium pipe . [The elder children]764-the elder children clustered round [her]73-nina , daring from long acquaintance , pulling the skirts of [her]73-nina white robe with [their]764-the elder children dark fingers , and showing [their]764-the elder children brilliant teeth in expectation of a shower of glass beads . [She]73-nina greeted [them]764-the elder children with a quiet smile , but always had a few friendly words for [a Siamese girl]765-a siamese girl , [a slave owned by [Bulangi]102-bulangi , whose [numerous wives were said to be of a violent temper]767-numerous wives were said to be of a violent temper]766-a slave owned by bulangi , whose numerous wives were said to be of a violent temper . Well - founded rumour said also that the domestic squabbles of [that industrious cultivator]768-that industrious cultivator ended generally in a combined assault of [all [his]768-that industrious cultivator wives]769-all his wives upon [the Siamese slave]770-the siamese slave . [The girl]402-the girl [herself]402-the girl never complained - perhaps from dictates of prudence , but more likely through the strange , resigned apathy of [half - savage womankind]457-half - savage womankind . From early morning [she]402-the girl was to be seen on [the paths]773-the paths amongst [the houses]757-the houses - by [the riverside]648-the riverside or on [the jetties]776-the jetties , the tray of pastry , it was [her]402-the girl mission to sell , skilfully balanced on [her]402-the girl head . During the great heat of the day [she]402-the girl usually sought refuge in [[Almayer]72-almayer 's campong]777-almayer 's campong , often finding shelter in a shady corner of [the verandah]156-the verandah , where [she]402-the girl squatted with [her]402-the girl tray before [her]402-the girl , when invited by [Nina]73-nina . For " [Mem Putih]100-mem putih "[402-the girl] [she]402-the girl had always a smile , but the presence of [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer , the very sound of [her]72-almayer shrill voice , was the signal for a hurried departure . To [this girl]240-this girl [Nina]73-nina often spoke ; [the other inhabitants of [Sambir]20-sambir]780-the other inhabitants of sambir seldom or never heard the sound of [her]73-nina voice . [They]780-the other inhabitants of sambir got used to the silent figure moving in [their]780-the other inhabitants of sambir midst calm and white - robed , a being from [another world]781-another world and incomprehensible to [them]780-the other inhabitants of sambir . Yet [Nina]73-nina 's life for all [her]73-nina outward composure , for all the seeming detachment from the things and people surrounding [her]73-nina , was far from quiet , in consequence of [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer being much too active for the happiness and even safety of [the household]641-the household . [She]73-nina had resumed some intercourse with [Lakamba]85-lakamba , not personally , it is true for the dignity of [that potentate]783-that potentate kept [him]85-lakamba inside [his]85-lakamba stockade , but through the agency of [[that potentate]783-that potentate 's prime minister]785-that potentate 's prime minister , [harbour master]786-harbour master , [financial adviser]787-financial adviser , and [general factotum]788-general factotum . [That gentleman - of Sulu origin]789-that gentleman - of sulu origin - was certainly endowed with statesmanlike qualities , although [he]85-lakamba was totally devoid of personal charms . In truth [he]85-lakamba was perfectly repulsive , possessing only one eye and a pockmarked face , with nose and lips horribly disfigured by the small - pox . [This unengaging individual]790-this unengaging individual often strolled into [[Almayer]72-almayer 's garden]791-almayer 's garden in unofficial costume , composed of a piece of pink calico round [his]85-lakamba waist . There at the back of [the house]169-the house , squatting on [his]85-lakamba heels on scattered embers , in close proximity to the great iron boiler , where [the family]793-the family daily rice was being cooked by [the women under [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's superintendence]794-the women under mrs. almayer 's superintendence , did [that astute negotiator]795-that astute negotiator carry on long conversations in Sulu language with [[Almayer]72-almayer 's wife]796-almayer 's wife . What the subject of [their]797-their discourses was might have been guessed from the subsequent domestic scenes by [Almayer]72-almayer 's hearthstone . Of late [Almayer]72-almayer had taken to excursions up [the river]170-the river . In [a small canoe]526-a small canoe with [two paddlers]800-two paddlers and [the faithful Ali]801-the faithful ali for [a steersman]802-a steersman [he]85-lakamba would disappear for a few days at a time . All [his]85-lakamba movements were no doubt closely watched by [Lakamba]85-lakamba and [Abdulla]83-abdulla , for [the man once in the confidence of [Rajah Laut]78-the rajah]803-the man once in the confidence of rajah laut was supposed to be in possession of valuable secrets . [The coast population of [Borneo]91-borneo]804-the coast population of borneo believes implicitly in diamonds of fabulous value , in gold mines of enormous richness in [the interior]516-the interior . And all those imaginings are heightened by the difficulty of penetrating far inland , especially on [the north - east coast]806-the north - east coast , where [the Malays]231-the malays and [the river tribes of [Dyaks]87-sambir]808-the river tribes of dyaks or [Head - hunters]809-head - hunters are eternally quarrelling . It is true enough that some gold reaches [the coast]810-the coast in the hands of [those Dyaks]811-those dyaks when , during short periods of truce in the desultory warfare , [they]811-those dyaks visit [the coast settlements of [Malays]86-malays]812-the coast settlements of malays . And so the wildest exaggerations are built up and added to on the slight basis of that fact . [Almayer]72-almayer in [his]85-lakamba quality of [white man]813-white man - as [Lingard]79-lingard before [him]85-lakamba - had somewhat better relations with [the up - river tribes]814-the up - river tribes . Yet even [his]85-lakamba excursions were not without danger , and [his]85-lakamba returns were eagerly looked for by [the impatient Lakamba]85-lakamba . But every time [the Rajah]78-the rajah was disappointed . Vain were the conferences by the rice - pot of [[his]85-lakamba factotum]815-his factotum [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi with [[the white man]512-the white man 's wife]817-the white man 's wife . [The white man]512-the white man [himself]512-the white man was impenetrable - impenetrable to persuasion , coaxing , abuse ; to soft words and shrill revilings ; to desperate beseechings or murderous threats ; for [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer , in [her]72-almayer extreme desire to persuade [[her]72-almayer husband]571-her husband into an alliance with [Lakamba]85-lakamba , played upon the whole gamut of passion . With [her]72-almayer soiled robe wound tightly under the armpits across [her]72-almayer lean bosom , [her]72-almayer scant grayish hair tumbled in disorder over [her]72-almayer projecting cheek - bones , in suppliant attitude , [she]72-almayer depicted with shrill volubility the advantages of close union with [a man so good and so fair dealing]820-a man so good and so fair dealing . " Why do n't [you]571-her husband go to [the Rajah]656-the rajah ? "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer screamed . " Why do [you]571-her husband go back to those Dyaks in [the great forest]2677-the great forest ? [They]2678-they should be killed . [You]571-her husband can not kill [them]2678-they , [you]571-her husband can not ; but [[our]2679-our [Rajah]78-the rajah 's men]2680-our rajah 's men are brave ! [You]571-her husband tell [the Rajah]656-the rajah where [the old white man]2682-the old white man 's treasure is . [[Our]2679-our [Rajah]78-the rajah]2683-our rajah is good ! [He]78-the rajah is [[our]2679-our very grandfather]2684-our very grandfather , [Datu Besar]104-datu besar ! [He]78-the rajah will kill [those wretched Dyaks]2685-those wretched dyaks , and [you]571-her husband shall have half the treasure . Oh , [Kaspar]70-kaspar , tell where the treasure is ! Tell [me]72-almayer ! Tell [me]72-almayer out of [[the old man]540-the old man 's surat]2687-the old man 's surat where [you]571-her husband read so often at night . "[72-almayer] On those occasions [Almayer]72-almayer sat with rounded shoulders bending to the blast of this domestic tempest , accentuating only each pause in the torrent of [[his]821-his wife]327-his wife 's eloquence by an angry growl , " There is no treasure ! Go away , [woman]2688-woman ! "[327-his wife] Exasperated by the sight of [his]821-his patiently bent back , [she]327-his wife would at last walk round so as to face [him]821-his across the table , and clasping [her]327-his wife robe with one hand [she]327-his wife stretched the other lean arm and claw- like hand to emphasise , in a passion of anger and contempt , the rapid rush of scathing remarks and bitter cursings heaped on the head of [the man unworthy to associate with [brave Malay chiefs]824-brave malay chiefs]823-the man unworthy to associate with brave malay chiefs . It ended generally by [Almayer]72-almayer rising slowly , [his]821-his long pipe in hand , [his]821-his face set into a look of inward pain , and walking away in silence . [He]821-his descended the steps and plunged into the long grass on [his]821-his way to the solitude of [[his]821-his new house]673-his new house , dragging [his]821-his feet in a state of physical collapse from disgust and fear before that fury . [She]327-his wife followed to the head of the steps , and sent the shafts of indiscriminate abuse after the retreating form . And each of those scenes was concluded by a piercing shriek , reaching [him]821-his far away . " [You]821-his know , [Kaspar]70-kaspar , [I]327-his wife am [[your]821-his wife]2604-your wife ! [[your]821-his own Christian wife]2690-your own christian wife after [your]821-his own Blanda law ! "[327-his wife] For [she]327-his wife knew that this was the bitterest thing of all ; the greatest regret of [that man]826-that man 's life . All these scenes [Nina]73-nina witnessed unmoved . [She]73-nina might have been deaf , dumb , without any feeling as far as any expression of opinion went . Yet oft when [[her]73-nina father]408-her father had sought the refuge of [the great dusty rooms of " [Almayer]72-almayer 's Folly]2691-the great dusty rooms of " almayer 's folly , "[637-her mother] and [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother , exhausted by rhetorical efforts , squatted wearily on [her]637-her mother heels with [her]637-her mother back against the leg of the table , [Nina]73-nina would approach [her]637-her mother curiously , guarding [her]73-nina skirts from betel juice besprinkling the floor , and gaze down upon [her]637-her mother as one might look into the quiescent crater of a volcano after a destructive eruption . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's thoughts , after these scenes , were usually turned into a channel of childhood reminiscences , and [she]72-almayer gave them utterance in a kind of monotonous recitative - slightly disconnected , but generally describing the glories of [the Sultan of [Sulu]105-sulu]829-the sultan of sulu , [his]829-the sultan of sulu great splendour , [his]829-the sultan of sulu power , [his]829-the sultan of sulu great prowess ; the fear which benumbed the hearts of [white men]471-white men at the sight of [his]829-the sultan of sulu swift piratical praus . And these muttered statements of [[her]73-nina grandfather]831-her grandfather 's might were mixed up with bits of later recollections , where the great fight with [the " White Devil 's "[832-the " white devil 's " brig] brig]832-the " white devil 's " brig and the convent life in [Samarang]37-samarang occupied the principal place . At that point [she]72-almayer usually dropped the thread of [her]72-almayer narrative , and pulling out the little brass cross , always suspended round [her]72-almayer neck , [she]72-almayer contemplated it with superstitious awe . That superstitious feeling connected with some vague talismanic properties of the little bit of metal , and the still more hazy but terrible notion of [some bad Djinns]833-some bad djinns and horrible torments invented , as [she]72-almayer thought , for [her]72-almayer especial punishment by [the good Mother Superior in case of the loss of the above charm]834-the good mother superior in case of the loss of the above charm , were [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's only theological luggage for the stormy road of life . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer had at least something tangible to cling to , but [Nina]73-nina , brought up under the Protestant wing of the proper [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck , had not even a little piece of brass to remind [her]73-nina of past teaching . And listening to the recital of those savage glories , those barbarous fights and savage feasting , to the story of deeds valorous , albeit somewhat bloodthirsty , where [men of [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother 's race]835-men of her mother 's race shone far above [the Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda , [she]72-almayer felt [herself]72-almayer irresistibly fascinated , and saw with vague surprise the narrow mantle of civilised morality , in which [good - meaning people]837-good - meaning people had wrapped [her]73-nina young soul , fall away and leave [her]73-nina shivering and helpless as if on the edge of [some deep and unknown abyss]838-some deep and unknown abyss . Strangest of all , [this abyss]839-this abyss did not frighten [her]73-nina when [she]73-nina was under the influence of [the witch - like being [she]73-nina called [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother]840-the witch - like being she called her mother . [She]73-nina seemed to have forgotten in civilised surroundings [her]73-nina life before the time when [Lingard]79-lingard had , so to speak , kidnapped [her]73-nina from [Brow]39-brow . Since then [she]73-nina had had Christian teaching , social education , and a good glimpse of civilised life . Unfortunately [[her]73-nina teachers]842-her teachers did not understand [her]73-nina nature , and the education ended in a scene of humiliation , in an outburst of contempt from [white people]843-white people for [her]73-nina mixed blood . [She]73-nina had tasted the whole bitterness of it and remembered distinctly that [the virtuous Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck 's indignation was not so much directed against [the young man from [the bank]331-the bank]844-the young man from the bank as against the innocent cause of [that young man]465-that young man 's infatuation . And there was also no doubt in [her]73-nina mind that the principal cause of [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck 's indignation was the thought that such a thing should happen in a white nest , where [her]94-mrs. vinck snow - white doves , the two [Misses Vinck]106-misses vinck , had just returned from [Europe]4-europe , to find shelter under the maternal wing , and there await the coming of [irreproachable men of [their]848-their destiny]847-irreproachable men of their destiny . Not even the thought of the money so painfully scraped together by [Almayer]72-almayer , and so punctually sent for [Nina]73-nina 's expenses , could dissuade [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck from [her]94-mrs. vinck virtuous resolve . [Nina]73-nina was sent away , and in truth [the girl]402-the girl [herself]402-the girl wanted to go , although a little frightened by the impending change . And now [she]73-nina had lived on [the river]170-the river for three years with [a savage mother]851-a savage mother and [a father walking about amongst pitfalls]852-a father walking about amongst pitfalls , with [his]852-a father walking about amongst pitfalls head in the clouds , weak , irresolute , and unhappy . [She]73-nina had lived a life devoid of all the decencies of civilisation , in miserable domestic conditions ; [she]73-nina had breathed in the atmosphere of sordid plottings for gain , of the no less disgusting intrigues and crimes for lust or money ; and those things , together with the domestic quarrels , were the only events of [her]73-nina three years ' existence . [She]73-nina did not die from despair and disgust the first month , as [she]73-nina expected and almost hoped for . On the contrary , at the end of half a year it had seemed to [her]73-nina that [she]73-nina had known no other life . [Her]73-nina young mind having been unskilfully permitted to glance at better things , and then thrown back again into the hopeless quagmire of barbarism , full of strong and uncontrolled passions , had lost the power to discriminate . It seemed to [Nina]73-nina that there was no change and no difference . Whether [they]853-they traded in [brick godowns]854-brick godowns or on [the muddy river bank]855-the muddy river bank ; whether [they]853-they reached after much or little ; whether [they]853-they made love under the shadows of the great trees or in the shadow of [the cathedral]856-the cathedral on [the Singapore promenade]857-the singapore promenade ; whether [they]853-they plotted for [their]853-they own ends under the protection of laws and according to the rules of Christian conduct , or whether [they]853-they sought the gratification of [their]853-they desires with the savage cunning and the unrestrained fierceness of natures as innocent of culture as [their]853-they own immense and gloomy forests , [Nina]73-nina saw only the same manifestations of love and hate and of sordid greed chasing the uncertain dollar in all its multifarious and vanishing shapes . To [her]73-nina resolute nature , however , after all these years , the savage and uncompromising sincerity of purpose shown by [[her]73-nina Malay kinsmen]858-her malay kinsmen seemed at last preferable to the sleek hypocrisy , to the polite disguises , to the virtuous pretences of [such white people]859-such white people as [she]73-nina had had the misfortune to come in contact with . After all it was [her]73-nina life ; it was going to be [her]73-nina life , and so thinking [she]73-nina fell more and more under the influence of [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother . Seeking , in [her]73-nina ignorance , a better side to that life , [she]73-nina listened with avidity to [the old woman]861-the old woman 's tales of the departed glories of [the Rajahs]107-rajahs , from whose race [she]73-nina had sprung , and [she]73-nina became gradually more indifferent , more contemptuous of the white side of [her]73-nina descent represented by [a feeble and traditionless father]862-a feeble and traditionless father . [Almayer]72-almayer 's difficulties were by no means diminished by [the girl]402-the girl 's presence in [Sambir]20-sambir . The stir caused by [her]402-the girl arrival had died out , it is true , and [Lakamba]85-lakamba had not renewed [his]85-lakamba visits ; but about a year after the departure of [the man - of - war]864-the man - of - war boats [the nephew of [Abdulla]83-abdulla]865-the nephew of abdulla , [Syed Reshid]108-reshid , returned from [his]108-reshid pilgrimage to [Mecca]40-mecca , rejoicing in a green jacket and the proud title of [Hadji]109-hadji . There was a great letting off of rockets on board [the steamer]610-the steamer which brought [him]108-reshid in , and a great beating of drums all night in [[Abdulla]83-abdulla 's compound]867-abdulla 's compound , while the feast of welcome was prolonged far into the small hours of the morning . [Reshid]108-reshid was [the favourite nephew and heir of [Abdulla]83-abdulla]868-the favourite nephew and heir of abdulla , and [that loving uncle]869-that loving uncle , meeting [Almayer]72-almayer one day by [the riverside]648-the riverside , stopped politely to exchange civilities and to ask solemnly for an interview . [Almayer]72-almayer suspected some attempt at a swindle , or at any rate something unpleasant , but of course consented with a great show of rejoicing . Accordingly the next evening , after sunset , [Abdulla]83-abdulla came , accompanied by several other grey - beards and by [[his]83-abdulla nephew]871-his nephew . [That young man - of a very rakish and dissipated appearance]872-that young man - of a very rakish and dissipated appearance - affected the greatest indifference as to the whole of the proceedings . When [the torch - bearers]873-the torch - bearers had grouped [themselves]873-the torch - bearers below the steps , and [the visitors]874-the visitors had seated [themselves]874-the visitors on various lame chairs , [Reshid]108-reshid stood apart in the shadow , examining [his]108-reshid aristocratically small hands with great attention . [Almayer]72-almayer , surprised by the great solemnity of [[his]875-his visitors]876-his visitors , perched [himself]875-his on the corner of the table with a characteristic want of dignity quickly noted by [the Arabs]503-the arabs with grave disapproval . But [Abdulla]83-abdulla spoke now , looking straight past [Almayer]72-almayer at the red curtain hanging in the doorway , where a slight tremor disclosed the presence of [women on the other side]878-women on the other side . [He]83-abdulla began by neatly complimenting [Almayer]72-almayer upon the long years [they]879-they had dwelt together in [cordial neighbourhood]880-cordial neighbourhood , and called upon [Allah]110-allah to give [him]83-abdulla many more years to gladden the eyes of [[his]83-abdulla friends]423-his friends by [his]83-abdulla welcome presence . [He]83-abdulla made a polite allusion to the great consideration shown [him]83-abdulla [Almayer]72-almayer by [the Dutch " Commissie]2692-the dutch " commissie , "[83-abdulla] and drew thence the flattering inference of [Almayer]72-almayer 's great importance amongst [[his]83-abdulla own people]882-his own people . [He]83-abdulla - [Abdulla]83-abdulla - was also important amongst all [the Arabs]503-the arabs , and [[his]83-abdulla nephew]871-his nephew [Reshid]108-reshid would be [heir of that social position and of great riches]885-heir of that social position and of great riches . Now [Reshid]108-reshid was [a Hadji]886-a hadji . [He]108-reshid was [possessor of several [Malay women]399-malay women]887-possessor of several malay women , went on [Abdulla]83-abdulla , but it was time [he]108-reshid had [a favourite wife]889-a favourite wife , [the first of the four allowed by [the Prophet]891-the prophet]890-the first of the four allowed by the prophet . And , speaking with well - bred politeness , [he]108-reshid explained further to [the dumbfounded Almayer]72-almayer that , if [he]108-reshid would consent to the alliance of [[his]108-reshid offspring]892-his offspring with [that true believer and virtuous man Reshid]893-that true believer and virtuous man reshid , [she]889-a favourite wife would be [the mistress of all the splendours of [[Reshid]108-reshid 's house]895-reshid 's house]894-the mistress of all the splendours of reshid 's house , and [first wife of [the first Arab]897-the first arab in [the Islands]41-the islands]896-first wife of the first arab in the islands , when [he]108-reshid - [Abdulla]83-abdulla - was called to the joys of Paradise by [Allah the All - merciful]110-allah . " [You]72-almayer know , [Tuan]103-babalatchi , "[108-reshid] [he]108-reshid said , in conclusion , " [the other women]2693-the other women would be [[her]889-a favourite wife slaves]2694-her slaves , and [[Reshid]108-reshid 's house]895-reshid 's house is great . From [Bombay]42-bombay [he]108-reshid has brought great divans , and costly carpets , and European furniture . There is also a great looking - glass in a frame shining like gold . What could [a girl]237-a girl want more ? "[108-reshid] And while [Almayer]72-almayer looked upon [him]108-reshid in silent dismay [Abdulla]83-abdulla spoke in a more confidential tone , waving [[his]83-abdulla attendants]898-his attendants away , and finished [his]83-abdulla speech by pointing out the material advantages of such an alliance , and offering to settle upon [Almayer]72-almayer three thousand dollars as a sign of [his]83-abdulla sincere friendship and the price of [the girl]402-the girl . [Poor Almayer]111-poor almayer was nearly having a fit . Burning with the desire of taking [Abdulla]83-abdulla by the throat , [he]111-poor almayer had but to think of [his]111-poor almayer helpless position in the midst of [lawless men]900-lawless men to comprehend the necessity of diplomatic conciliation . [He]111-poor almayer mastered [his]111-poor almayer impulses , and spoke politely and coldly , saying [the girl]402-the girl was young and as the apple of [his]111-poor almayer eye . [Tuan Reshid]112-reshid , [a Faithful]902-a faithful and [a Hadji]886-a hadji , would not want [an infidel woman]904-an infidel woman in [[his]112-reshid harem]905-his harem ; and , seeing [Abdulla]83-abdulla smile sceptically at that last objection , [he]111-poor almayer remained silent , not trusting [himself]111-poor almayer to speak more , not daring to refuse point- blank , nor yet to say anything compromising . [Abdulla]83-abdulla understood the meaning of that silence , and rose to take leave with a grave salaam . [He]83-abdulla wished [[his]83-abdulla friend]518-his friend [Almayer]72-almayer " a thousand years , "[72-almayer] and moved down the steps , helped dutifully by [Reshid]112-reshid . [The torch - bearers]873-the torch - bearers shook [their]873-the torch - bearers torches , scattering a shower of sparks into [the river]170-the river , and [the cortege]909-the cortege moved off , leaving [Almayer]72-almayer agitated but greatly relieved by [their]909-the cortege departure . [He]83-abdulla dropped into a chair and watched the glimmer of the lights amongst the tree trunks till they disappeared and complete silence succeeded the tramp of feet and the murmur of voices . [He]83-abdulla did not move till the curtain rustled and [Nina]73-nina came out on [the verandah]156-the verandah and sat in the rocking - chair , where [she]73-nina used to spend many hours every day . [She]73-nina gave a slight rocking motion to [her]73-nina seat , leaning back with half - closed eyes , [her]73-nina long hair shading [her]73-nina face from the smoky light of the lamp on the table . [Almayer]72-almayer looked at [her]73-nina furtively , but the face was as impassible as ever . [She]73-nina turned [her]73-nina head slightly towards [[her]73-nina father]408-her father , and , speaking , to [his]83-abdulla great surprise , in English , asked - " Was that [Abdulla]83-abdulla here ? "[73-nina] " Yes , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer - " just gone . "[72-almayer] " And what did [he]83-abdulla want , [father]2606-father ? "[73-nina] " [He]83-abdulla wanted to buy [you]73-nina for [Reshid]112-reshid , "[72-almayer] answered [Almayer]72-almayer , brutally , [his]83-abdulla anger getting the better of [him]83-abdulla , and looking at [the girl]402-the girl as if in expectation of some outbreak of feeling . But [Nina]73-nina remained apparently unmoved , gazing dreamily into the black night outside . " Be careful , [Nina]73-nina , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , after a short silence and rising from [his]83-abdulla chair , " when [you]73-nina go paddling alone into the creeks in [[your]73-nina canoe]2698-your canoe . That [Reshid]112-reshid is [a violent scoundrel]2699-a violent scoundrel , and there is no saying what [he]112-reshid may do . Do [you]73-nina hear [me]72-almayer ? "[72-almayer] [She]73-nina was standing now , ready to go in , one hand grasping the curtain in the doorway . [She]73-nina turned round , throwing [her]73-nina heavy tresses back by a sudden gesture . " Do [you]72-almayer think [he]112-reshid would dare ? "[73-nina] [she]73-nina asked , quickly , and then turned again to go in , adding in a lower tone , " [He]112-reshid would not dare . [Arabs]2700-arabs are [all cowards]2701-all cowards . "[73-nina] [Almayer]72-almayer looked after [her]73-nina , astonished . [He]83-abdulla did not seek the repose of [his]83-abdulla hammock . [He]83-abdulla walked [the floor]913-the floor absently , sometimes stopping by [the balustrade]914-the balustrade to think . The lamp went out . The first streak of dawn broke over [the forest]915-the forest ; [Almayer]72-almayer shivered in the damp air . " [I]83-abdulla give it up , "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla muttered to [himself]83-abdulla , lying down wearily . " Damn [those women]2702-those women ! Well ! If [the girl]402-the girl did not look as if [she]402-the girl wanted to be kidnapped ! "[83-abdulla] And [he]83-abdulla felt a nameless fear creep into [his]83-abdulla heart , making [him]83-abdulla shiver again . CHAPTER IV . That year , towards the breaking up of the south - west monsoon , disquieting rumours reached [Sambir]20-sambir . [Captain Ford]99-ford , coming up to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house for an evening 's chat , brought late numbers of the Straits Times giving the news of [Acheen]43-acheen war and of [the unsuccessful Dutch expedition]917-the unsuccessful dutch expedition . [The Nakhodas of [the rare trading praus ascending [the river]170-the river]919-the rare trading praus ascending the river]918-the nakhodas of the rare trading praus ascending the river paid visits to [Lakamba]85-lakamba , discussing with [that potentate]783-that potentate the unsettled state of affairs , and wagged [their]918-the nakhodas of the rare trading praus ascending the river heads gravely over the recital of [Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda exaction , severity , and general tyranny , as exemplified in the total stoppage of gunpowder trade and the rigorous visiting of all suspicious craft trading in [the straits of [Macassar]75-macassar]922-the straits of macassar . Even [the loyal soul of [Lakamba]85-lakamba]923-the loyal soul of lakamba was stirred into a state of inward discontent by the withdrawal of [his]85-lakamba license for powder and by the abrupt confiscation of one hundred and fifty barrels of that commodity by [the gunboat]924-the gunboat [Princess Amelia]45-princess amelia , when , after a hazardous voyage , it had almost reached [the mouth of [the river]170-the river]691-the mouth of the river . The unpleasant news was given [him]85-lakamba by [Reshid]112-reshid , who , after the unsuccessful issue of [his]112-reshid matrimonial projects , had made a long voyage amongst [the islands]217-the islands for trading purposes ; had bought the powder for [[his]112-reshid friend]518-his friend , and was overhauled and deprived of it on [his]112-reshid return when actually congratulating [himself]112-reshid on [his]112-reshid acuteness in avoiding detection . [Reshid]112-reshid 's wrath was principally directed against [Almayer]72-almayer , whom [he]112-reshid suspected of having notified [the Dutch authorities]576-the dutch authorities of the desultory warfare carried on by [the Arabs]82-the arabs and [the Rajah]78-the rajah with [the up - river Dyak tribes]930-the up - river dyak tribes . To [Reshid]112-reshid 's great surprise [the Rajah]78-the rajah received [his]112-reshid complaints very coldly , and showed no signs of vengeful disposition towards [the white man]512-the white man . In truth , [Lakamba]85-lakamba knew very well that [Almayer]72-almayer was perfectly innocent of any meddling in state affairs ; and besides , [his]85-lakamba attitude towards [that much persecuted individual]932-that much persecuted individual was wholly changed in consequence of a reconciliation effected between [him]85-lakamba and [[his]85-lakamba old enemy]933-his old enemy by [[Almayer]72-almayer 's newly- found friend]934-almayer 's newly- found friend , [Dain Maroola]74-dain . [Almayer]72-almayer had now [a friend]2611-a friend . Shortly after [Reshid]112-reshid 's departure on [his]112-reshid commercial journey , [Nina]73-nina , drifting slowly with the tide in [the canoe]338-the canoe on [her]73-nina return [home]243-home after one of [her]73-nina solitary excursions , heard in one of [the small creeks]938-the small creeks a splashing , as if of heavy ropes dropping in the water , and the prolonged song of [Malay seamen]939-malay seamen when some heavy pulling is to be done . Through the thick fringe of bushes hiding [the mouth of [the creek]941-the creek]940-the mouth of the creek [she]73-nina saw the tall spars of [some European - rigged sailing vessel]942-some european - rigged sailing vessel overtopping [the summits of [the Nipa palms]944-the nipa palms]943-the summits of the nipa palms . [A brig]945-a brig was being hauled out of [the small creek]946-the small creek into [the main stream]947-the main stream . The sun had set , and during the short moments of twilight [Nina]73-nina saw [the brig]288-the brig , aided by the evening breeze and the flowing tide , head towards [Sambir]20-sambir under [her]73-nina set foresail . [The girl]402-the girl turned [[her]402-the girl canoe]950-her canoe out of [the main river]951-the main river into [one of the many narrow channels amongst [the wooded islets]953-the wooded islets]952-one of the many narrow channels amongst the wooded islets , and paddled vigorously over [the black and sleepy backwaters]954-the black and sleepy backwaters towards [Sambir]20-sambir . [Her]402-the girl canoe brushed [the water - palms]955-the water - palms , skirted the short spaces of [muddy bank]956-muddy bank where sedate alligators looked at [her]402-the girl with lazy unconcern , and , just as darkness was setting in , shot out into the broad junction of [the two main branches of [the river]170-the river]957-the two main branches of the river , where [the brig]288-the brig was already at anchor with sails furled , yards squared , and decks seemingly untenanted by [any human being]960-any human being . [Nina]73-nina had to cross [the river]170-the river and pass pretty close to [the brig]288-the brig in order to reach [home]243-home on the low promontory between [the two branches of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]964-the two branches of the pantai . Up both branches , in [the houses built on [the banks]966-the banks and over [the water]351-the water]965-the houses built on the banks and over the water , the lights twinkled already , reflected in the still waters below . The hum of voices , the occasional cry of [a child]968-a child , the rapid and abruptly interrupted roll of a wooden drum , together with some distant hailing in the darkness by [the returning fishermen]969-the returning fishermen , reached [her]73-nina over [the broad expanse of [the river]170-the river]970-the broad expanse of the river . [She]73-nina hesitated a little before crossing , the sight of such an unusual object as [an European - rigged vessel]972-an european - rigged vessel causing [her]73-nina some uneasiness , but [the river]170-the river in [its]170-the river wide expansion was dark enough to render [a small canoe]526-a small canoe invisible . [She]73-nina urged [[her]73-nina small craft]975-her small craft with swift strokes of [her]73-nina paddle , kneeling in the bottom and bending forward to catch any suspicious sound while [she]73-nina steered towards [the little jetty of [Lingard]77-lingard and [Co.]27-co.]976-the little jetty of lingard and co. , to which the strong light of the paraffin lamp shining on [the whitewashed verandah of [Almayer]72-almayer 's bungalow]977-the whitewashed verandah of almayer 's bungalow served as a convenient guide . [The jetty itself]978-the jetty itself , under the shadow of [the bank overgrown by drooping bushes]979-the bank overgrown by drooping bushes , was hidden in darkness . Before even [she]73-nina could see it [she]73-nina heard the hollow bumping of [a large boat]980-a large boat against [its]980-a large boat rotten posts , and heard also the murmur of whispered conversation in [that boat]981-that boat whose white paint and great dimensions , faintly visible on nearer approach , made [her]73-nina rightly guess that it belonged to the brig just anchored . Stopping [her]73-nina course by a rapid motion of [her]73-nina paddle , with another swift stroke [she]73-nina sent it whirling away from [the wharf]982-the wharf and steered for a little rivulet which gave access to [the back courtyard of [the house]169-the house]983-the back courtyard of the house . [She]73-nina landed at [the muddy head of [the creek]941-the creek]985-the muddy head of the creek and made [her]73-nina way towards [the house]169-the house over the trodden grass of [the courtyard]988-the courtyard . To the left , from [the cooking shed]380-the cooking shed , shone a red glare through [the banana plantation]990-the banana plantation [she]73-nina skirted , and the noise of feminine laughter reached [her]73-nina from there in the silent evening . [She]73-nina rightly judged [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother was not near , laughter and [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer not being [close neighbours]992-close neighbours . [She]993-she must be in [the house]169-the house , thought [Nina]73-nina , as [she]73-nina ran lightly up the inclined plane of shaky planks leading to the back door of [the narrow passage dividing [the house]169-the house]995-the narrow passage dividing the house in two . Outside the doorway , in the black shadow , stood [the faithful Ali]801-the faithful ali . " Who is [there]2669-there ? "[73-nina] asked [Nina]73-nina . " [A great Malay man]2705-a great malay man has come , "[95-ali] answered [Ali]95-ali , in a tone of suppressed excitement . " [He]2705-a great malay man is [a rich man]2706-a rich man . There are [six men with lances]2707-six men with lances . [Real Soldat]113-real soldat , [you]73-nina understand . And [his]2705-a great malay man dress is very brave . [I]73-nina have seen [his]2705-a great malay man dress . It shines ! What jewels ! Do n't go there , [Mem Nina]73-nina . [Tuan]112-reshid said not ; but [the old Mem]73-nina is gone . [Tuan]112-reshid will be angry . [Merciful Allah]110-allah ! what jewels [that man]826-that man has got ! "[73-nina] [Nina]73-nina slipped past the outstretched hand of [the slave]998-the slave into [the dark passage]999-the dark passage where , in the crimson glow of the hanging curtain , close by its other end , [she]73-nina could see a small dark form crouching near the wall . [[Her]73-nina mother]637-her mother was feasting [her]637-her mother eyes and ears with what was taking place on [the front verandah]1001-the front verandah , and [Nina]73-nina approached to take [her]73-nina share in the rare pleasure of some novelty . [She]73-nina was met by [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother 's extended arm and by a low murmured warning not to make a noise . " Have [you]637-her mother seen [them]2709-them , [mother]2710-mother ? "[73-nina] asked [Nina]73-nina , in a breathless whisper . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer turned [her]72-almayer face towards [the girl]402-the girl , and [her]72-almayer sunken eyes shone strangely in the red half - light of [the passage]1004-the passage . " [I]72-almayer saw [him]2711-him , "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer said , in an almost inaudible tone , pressing [[her]72-almayer daughter]1005-her daughter 's hand with [her]72-almayer bony fingers . " [A great [Rajah]78-the rajah]2712-a great rajah has come to [Sambir]87-sambir - [a Son of [Heaven]114-heaven]2713-a son of heaven , "[861-the old woman] muttered [the old woman]861-the old woman to [herself]861-the old woman . " Go away , [girl]2714-girl ! "[861-the old woman] [The two women]1007-the two women stood close to the curtain , [Nina]73-nina wishing to approach [the rent in the stuff]1008-the rent in the stuff , and [[her]1005-her daughter mother]637-her mother defending the position with angry obstinacy . On the other side there was a lull in the conversation , but the breathing of [several men]1010-several men , the occasional light tinkling of some ornaments , the clink of metal scabbards , or of brass siri - vessels passed from hand to hand , was audible during the short pause . [The women]376-the women struggled silently , when there was a shuffling noise and the shadow of [Almayer]72-almayer 's burly form fell on the curtain . [The women]376-the women ceased struggling and remained motionless . [Almayer]72-almayer had stood up to answer [[his]637-her mother guest]1013-his guest , turning [his]637-her mother back to the doorway , unaware of what was going on on the other side . [He]637-her mother spoke in a tone of regretful irritation . " [You]376-the women have come to [the wrong house]2715-the wrong house , [Tuan Maroola]46-tuan maroola , if [you]376-the women want to trade as [you]376-the women say . [I]1014-i was [a trader]2716-a trader once , not now , whatever [you]376-the women may have heard about [me]1014-i in [Macassar]75-macassar . And if [you]376-the women want anything , [you]376-the women will not find it [here]2634-here ; [I]1014-i have nothing to give , and want nothing [myself]1014-i . [You]376-the women should go to [the Rajah]656-the rajah here ; [you]376-the women can see in the daytime [[his]656-the rajah houses across [the river]170-the river]2719-his houses across the river , there , where those fires are burning on [the shore]2721-the shore . [He]656-the rajah will help [you]376-the women and trade with [you]376-the women . Or , better still , go to [the Arabs]503-the arabs over there , "[1014-i] [he]1014-i went on bitterly , pointing with [his]1014-i hand towards [the houses of [Sambir]87-sambir]1015-the houses of sambir . " [Abdulla]83-abdulla is [the man [you]376-the women want]2723-the man you want . There is nothing [he]83-abdulla would not buy , and there is nothing [he]83-abdulla would not sell ; believe [me]1014-i , [I]1014-i know [him]83-abdulla well . "[1014-i] [He]1014-i waited for an answer a short time , then added - " All that [I]1014-i have said is true , and there is nothing more . "[1014-i] [Nina]73-nina , held back by [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother , heard a soft voice reply with a calm evenness of intonation peculiar to [the better class Malays]1017-the better class malays - " Who would doubt [a white Tuan]2724-a white tuan 's words ? [A man]340-a man seeks [[his]340-a man friends]423-his friends where [his]340-a man heart tells [him]340-a man . Is this not true also ? [I]72-almayer have come , although so late , for [I]72-almayer have something to say which [you]376-the women may be glad to hear . To - morrow [I]72-almayer will go to [the Sultan]2727-the sultan ; [a trader]2716-a trader wants the friendship of [great men]2729-great men . Then [I]72-almayer shall return here to speak serious words , if [Tuan]112-reshid permits . [I]72-almayer shall not go to [the Arabs]503-the arabs ; [their]503-the arabs lies are very great ! What are [they]503-the arabs ? [Chelakka]115-chelakka ! "[72-almayer] [Almayer]72-almayer 's voice sounded a little more pleasantly in reply . " Well , as [you]376-the women like . [I]72-almayer can hear [you]376-the women to - morrow at any time if [you]376-the women have anything to say . Bah ! After [you]376-the women have seen [the Sultan Lakamba]85-lakamba [you]376-the women will not want to return here , [Inchi Dain]47-inchi dain . [You]376-the women will see . Only mind , [I]72-almayer will have nothing to do with [Lakamba]85-lakamba . [You]376-the women may tell [him]85-lakamba so . What is [your]376-the women business with [me]72-almayer , after all ? "[72-almayer] " To - morrow [we]2731-we talk , [Tuan]112-reshid , now [I]1018-the malay know [you]112-reshid , "[1018-the malay] answered [the Malay]1018-the malay . " [I]1018-the malay speak English a little , so [we]2731-we can talk and [nobody]163-nobody will understand , and then - "[1018-the malay] [He]1018-the malay interrupted [himself]1018-the malay suddenly , asking surprised , " What 's that noise , [Tuan]112-reshid ? "[1018-the malay] [Almayer]72-almayer had also heard the increasing noise of the scuffle recommenced on [the women]376-the women 's side of the curtain . Evidently [Nina]73-nina 's strong curiosity was on the point of overcoming [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's exalted sense of social proprieties . Hard breathing was distinctly audible , and the curtain shook during the contest , which was mainly physical , although [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's voice was heard in angry remonstrance with its usual want of strictly logical reasoning , but with the well - known richness of invective . " [[You]112-reshid shameless woman]2733-you shameless woman ! Are [you]112-reshid [a slave]310-a slave ? "[1020-the irate matron] shouted shrilly [the irate matron]1020-the irate matron . " Veil [your]112-reshid face , [abandoned wretch]2735-abandoned wretch ! [[You]112-reshid white snake]2736-you white snake , [I]1020-the irate matron will not let [you]112-reshid ! "[1020-the irate matron] [Almayer]72-almayer 's face expressed annoyance and also doubt as to the advisability of interfering between [mother]2710-mother and [daughter]2649-daughter . [He]1023-he glanced at [[his]1023-he Malay visitor]1024-his malay visitor , who was waiting silently for the end of the uproar in an attitude of amused expectation , and waving [his]1023-he hand contemptuously [he]1023-he murmured - " It is nothing . [Some women]2737-some women . "[1023-he] [The Malay]89-malay nodded [his]89-malay head gravely , and [his]89-malay face assumed an expression of serene indifference , as etiquette demanded after such an explanation . The contest was ended behind the curtain , and evidently [the younger will]1025-the younger will had its way , for the rapid shuffle and click of [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's high - heeled sandals died away in the distance . [The tranquillised master of [the house]169-the house]1026-the tranquillised master of the house was going to resume the conversation when , struck by an unexpected change in the expression of [[his]1026-the tranquillised master of the house guest]1013-his guest 's countenance , [he]1026-the tranquillised master of the house turned [his]1026-the tranquillised master of the house head and saw [Nina]73-nina standing in the doorway . After [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's retreat from [the field of battle]1029-the field of battle , [Nina]73-nina , with a contemptuous exclamation , " It 's only [a trader]2716-a trader , "[73-nina] had lifted the conquered curtain and now stood in full light , framed in the dark background on [the passage]1004-the passage , [her]73-nina lips slightly parted , [her]73-nina hair in disorder after the exertion , the angry gleam not yet faded out of [her]73-nina glorious and sparkling eyes . [She]73-nina took in at a glance [the group of white - clad lancemen]1031-the group of white - clad lancemen standing motionless in the shadow of the far - off end of [the verandah]156-the verandah , and [her]73-nina gaze rested curiously on [the chief of that imposing cortege]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege . [He]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege stood , almost facing [her]73-nina , a little on one side , and struck by the beauty of the unexpected apparition had bent low , elevating [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege joint hands above [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege head in a sign of respect accorded by [Malays]86-malays only to the great of [this earth]1034-this earth . The crude light of the lamp shone on the gold embroidery of [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege black silk jacket , broke in a thousand sparkling rays on the jewelled hilt of [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege kriss protruding from under the many folds of the red sarong gathered into a sash round [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege waist , and played on the precious stones of the many rings on [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege dark fingers . [He]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege straightened [himself]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege up quickly after the low bow , putting [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege hand with a graceful ease on the hilt of [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege heavy short sword ornamented with brilliantly dyed fringes of horsehair . [Nina]73-nina , hesitating on the threshold , saw [an erect lithe figure of medium height with a breadth of shoulder suggesting great power]1035-an erect lithe figure of medium height with a breadth of shoulder suggesting great power . Under the folds of a blue turban , whose fringed ends hung gracefully over the left shoulder , was a face full of determination and expressing a reckless good - humour , not devoid , however , of some dignity . The squareness of lower jaw , the full red lips , the mobile nostrils , and the proud carriage of the head gave the impression of a being half - savage , untamed , perhaps cruel , and corrected the liquid softness of the almost feminine eye , that general characteristic of the race . Now , the first surprise over , [Nina]73-nina saw those eyes fixed upon [her]73-nina with such an uncontrolled expression of admiration and desire that [she]73-nina felt a hitherto unknown feeling of shyness , mixed with alarm and some delight , enter and penetrate [her]73-nina whole being . Confused by those unusual sensations [she]73-nina stopped in the doorway and instinctively drew the lower part of the curtain across [her]73-nina face , leaving only half a rounded cheek , a stray tress , and one eye exposed , wherewith to contemplate the gorgeous and bold being so unlike in appearance to the rare specimens of traders [she]73-nina had seen before on [that same verandah]1036-that same verandah . [Dain Maroola]74-dain , dazzled by the unexpected vision , forgot [the confused Almayer]72-almayer , forgot [[his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege brig]1037-his brig , [[his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege escort]1038-his escort staring in open - mouthed admiration , the object of [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege visit and all things else , in [his]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege overpowering desire to prolong the contemplation of so much loveliness met so suddenly in such an unlikely place - as [he]1033-the chief of that imposing cortege thought . " It is [[my]72-almayer daughter]2594-my daughter , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , in an embarrassed manner . " It is of no consequence . [White women]2740-white women have [their]2740-white women customs , as [you]74-dain know [Tuan]112-reshid , having travelled much , as [you]74-dain say . However , it is late ; [we]2741-we will finish [our]2741-we talk to - morrow . "[72-almayer] [Dain]74-dain bent low trying to convey in a last glance towards [the girl]402-the girl the bold expression of [his]74-dain overwhelming admiration . The next minute [he]74-dain was shaking [Almayer]72-almayer 's hand with grave courtesy , [his]74-dain face wearing a look of stolid unconcern as to any feminine presence . [[His]74-dain men]1040-his men filed off , and [he]74-dain followed [them]1040-his men quickly , closely attended by [a thick - set , savage - looking Sumatrese [he]74-dain had introduced before as the commander of [[his]74-dain brig]1037-his brig]1041-a thick - set , savage - looking sumatrese he had introduced before as the commander of his brig . [Nina]73-nina walked to the balustrade of [the verandah]156-the verandah and saw the sheen of moonlight on the steel spear - heads and heard the rhythmic jingle of brass anklets as [the men]1044-the men moved in single file towards [the jetty]2614-the jetty . [The boat]336-the boat shoved off after a little while , looming large in the full light of the moon , a black shapeless mass in the slight haze hanging over the water . [Nina]73-nina fancied [she]73-nina could distinguish the graceful figure of [the trader standing erect in the stern sheets]1047-the trader standing erect in the stern sheets , but in a little while all the outlines got blurred , confused , and soon disappeared in the folds of white vapour shrouding the middle of [the river]170-the river . [Almayer]72-almayer had approached [[his]74-dain daughter]162-his daughter , and leaning with both arms over the rail , was looking moodily down on the heap of rubbish and broken bottles at the foot of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " What was all that noise just now ? "[74-dain] [he]74-dain growled peevishly , without looking up . " Confound [you]162-his daughter and [[your]162-his daughter mother]2742-your mother ! What did [she]2742-your mother want ? What did [you]162-his daughter come out for ? "[74-dain] " [She]2742-your mother did not want to let [me]73-nina come out , "[73-nina] said [Nina]73-nina . " [She]2742-your mother is angry . [She]2742-your mother says [the man just gone]2743-the man just gone is [some Rajah]2744-some rajah . [I]73-nina think [she]2742-your mother is right now . "[73-nina] " [I]72-almayer believe [all [you]162-his daughter women]2745-all you women are crazy , "[72-almayer] snarled [Almayer]72-almayer . " What 's that to [you]162-his daughter , to [her]2742-your mother , to [anybody]2746-anybody ? [The man]726-the man wants to collect trepang and birds ' nests on [the islands]217-the islands . [He]726-the man told [me]72-almayer so , [that Rajah of [yours]162-his daughter]2749-that rajah of yours . [He]726-the man will come to - morrow . [I]72-almayer want [you]162-his daughter both to keep away from [the house]169-the house , and let [me]72-almayer attend to [my]72-almayer business in peace . "[72-almayer] [Dain Maroola]74-dain came the next day and had a long conversation with [Almayer]72-almayer . This was the beginning of a close and friendly intercourse which , at first , was much remarked in [Sambir]20-sambir , till [the population]1051-the population got used to the frequent sight of many fires burning in [[Almayer]72-almayer 's campong]777-almayer 's campong , where [[Maroola]74-dain 's men]1053-maroola 's men were warming [themselves]1053-maroola 's men during the cold nights of the north- east monsoon , while [[their]1053-maroola 's men master]1054-their master had long conferences with [the Tuan Putih]116-tuan putih - as [they]1053-maroola 's men styled [Almayer]72-almayer amongst [themselves]1053-maroola 's men . Great was the curiosity in [Sambir]87-sambir on the subject of [the new trader]1055-the new trader . Had [he]1055-the new trader seen [the Sultan]2727-the sultan ? What did [the Sultan]2727-the sultan say ? Had [he]1055-the new trader given any presents ? What would [he]1055-the new trader sell ? What would [he]1055-the new trader buy ? Those were the questions broached eagerly by [the inhabitants of [bamboo houses built over [the river]170-the river]1059-bamboo houses built over the river]1058-the inhabitants of bamboo houses built over the river . Even in [more substantial buildings]1061-more substantial buildings , in [[Abdulla]83-abdulla 's house]1062-abdulla 's house , in [the residences of [principal traders]1064-principal traders]1063-the residences of principal traders , [Arab]96-arab , [Chinese]1065-chinese , and [Bugis]117-bugis , the excitement ran high , and lasted many days . With inborn suspicion [they]1066-they would not believe the simple account of [himself]1055-the new trader [the young trader]1067-the young trader was always ready to give . Yet it had all the appearance of truth . [He]1055-the new trader said [he]1055-the new trader was [a trader]2716-a trader , and sold rice . [He]1055-the new trader did not want to buy gutta - percha or beeswax , because [he]1055-the new trader intended to employ [[his]1055-the new trader numerous crew]1069-his numerous crew in collecting trepang on [the coral reefs outside [the river]170-the river]1070-the coral reefs outside the river , and also in seeking for bird 's nests on [the mainland]1072-the mainland . Those two articles [he]1055-the new trader professed [himself]1055-the new trader ready to buy if there were any to be obtained in that way . [He]1055-the new trader said [he]1055-the new trader was from [Bali]12-bali , and [a Brahmin]1073-a brahmin , which last statement [he]1055-the new trader made good by refusing all food during [his]1055-the new trader often repeated visits to [[Lakamba]85-lakamba 's and [Almayer]72-almayer 's houses]1074-lakamba 's and almayer 's houses . To [Lakamba]85-lakamba [he]1055-the new trader went generally at night and had long audiences . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , who was always [a third party at those meetings of potentate and trader]1075-a third party at those meetings of potentate and trader , knew how to resist all attempts on the part of [the curious to ascertain the subject of so many long talks]1076-the curious to ascertain the subject of so many long talks . When questioned with languid courtesy by [the grave Abdulla]83-abdulla [he]103-babalatchi sought refuge in a vacant stare of [his]103-babalatchi one eye , and in the affectation of extreme simplicity . " [I]103-babalatchi am only [[[my]103-babalatchi master]2751-my master 's slave]2752-my master 's slave , "[103-babalatchi] murmured [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , in a hesitating manner . Then as if making up [his]103-babalatchi mind suddenly for a reckless confidence [he]103-babalatchi would inform [Abdulla]83-abdulla of some transaction in rice , repeating the words , " A hundred big bags [the Sultan]2727-the sultan bought ; a hundred , [Tuan]103-babalatchi ! "[103-babalatchi] in a tone of mysterious solemnity . [Abdulla]83-abdulla , firmly persuaded of the existence of some more important dealings , received , however , the information with all the signs of respectful astonishment . And [the two]1077-the two would separate , [the Arab]1078-the arab cursing inwardly the wily dog , while [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi went on [his]103-babalatchi way walking on [the dusty path]1079-the dusty path , [his]103-babalatchi body swaying , [his]103-babalatchi chin with its few grey hairs pushed forward , resembling [an inquisitive goat bent on some unlawful expedition]1080-an inquisitive goat bent on some unlawful expedition . Attentive eyes watched [his]103-babalatchi movements . [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , descrying [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi far away , would shake off the stupor of [an habitual opium smoker]1081-an habitual opium smoker and , tottering on to the middle of [the road]1082-the road , would await the approach of [that important person]1083-that important person , ready with hospitable invitation . But [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's discretion was proof even against the combined assaults of good fellowship and of strong gin generously administered by [the open- hearted Chinaman]1084-the open- hearted chinaman . [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , owning [himself]118-jim - eng beaten , was left uninformed with the empty bottle , and gazed sadly after the departing form of [the statesman of [Sambir]87-sambir]1085-the statesman of sambir pursuing [his]1085-the statesman of sambir devious and unsteady way , which , as usual , led [him]1085-the statesman of sambir to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound . Ever since a reconciliation had been effected by [Dain Maroola]74-dain between [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir white friend]1087-his white friend and [the Rajah]656-the rajah , [the one - eyed diplomatist]1089-the one - eyed diplomatist had again become [a frequent guest in [[the Dutchman]1091-the dutchman 's house]1092-the dutchman 's house]1090-a frequent guest in the dutchman 's house . To [Almayer]72-almayer 's great disgust [he]103-babalatchi was to be seen [there]2669-there at all times , strolling about in an abstracted kind of way on [the verandah]156-the verandah , skulking in [the passages]1095-the passages , or else popping round unexpected corners , always willing to engage [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer in confidential conversation . [He]103-babalatchi was very shy of [the master]204-the master [himself]103-babalatchi , as if suspicious that the pent - up feelings of [the white man]512-the white man towards [[his]103-babalatchi person]1098-his person might find vent in a sudden kick . But [the cooking shed]380-the cooking shed was [[his]103-babalatchi favourite place]1100-his favourite place , and [he]103-babalatchi became [an habitual guest there]1101-an habitual guest there , squatting for hours amongst [the busy women]1102-the busy women , with [his]103-babalatchi chin resting on [his]103-babalatchi knees , [his]103-babalatchi lean arms clasped round [his]103-babalatchi legs , and [his]103-babalatchi one eye roving uneasily - the very picture of watchful ugliness . [Almayer]72-almayer wanted more than once to complain to [Lakamba]85-lakamba of [[his]103-babalatchi Prime Minister]1103-his prime minister 's intrusion , but [Dain]74-dain dissuaded [him]103-babalatchi . " [We]2754-we can not say a word here that [he]85-lakamba does not hear , "[72-almayer] growled [Almayer]72-almayer . " Then come and talk on board [the brig]288-the brig , "[74-dain] retorted [Dain]74-dain , with a quiet smile . " It is good to let [the man]726-the man come here . [Lakamba]85-lakamba thinks [he]85-lakamba knows much . Perhaps [the Sultan]2727-the sultan thinks [I]74-dain want to run away . Better let the one- eyed crocodile sun [himself]726-the man in [[your]72-almayer campong]2758-your campong , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . "[74-dain] And [Almayer]72-almayer assented unwillingly muttering vague threats of personal violence , while [he]103-babalatchi eyed malevolently [the aged statesman sitting with quiet obstinacy by [his]1104-the aged statesman sitting with quiet obstinacy by his domestic rice - pot domestic rice - pot]1104-the aged statesman sitting with quiet obstinacy by his domestic rice - pot . CHAPTER V. At last the excitement had died out in [Sambir]20-sambir . [The inhabitants]1105-the inhabitants got used to the sight of comings and goings between [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house and [the vessel]1107-the vessel , now moored to the opposite bank , and speculation as to the feverish activity displayed by [[Almayer]72-almayer 's boatmen]1108-almayer 's boatmen in [repairing old canoes]1109-repairing old canoes ceased to interfere with the due discharge of domestic duties by [the women of [the Settlement]523-the settlement]1110-the women of the settlement . Even [the baffled Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng left off troubling [his]118-jim - eng muddled brain with secrets of trade , and relapsed by the aid of [his]118-jim - eng opium pipe into a state of stupefied bliss , letting [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi pursue [his]103-babalatchi way past [[his]103-babalatchi house]372-his house uninvited and seemingly unnoticed . So on that warm afternoon , when [the deserted river]1113-the deserted river sparkled under the vertical sun , [the statesman of [Sambir]87-sambir]1085-the statesman of sambir could , without any hindrance from [friendly inquirers]1115-friendly inquirers , shove off [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir little canoe]1116-his little canoe from under the bushes , where it was usually hidden during [his]1085-the statesman of sambir visits to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound . Slowly and languidly [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi paddled , crouching low in [the boat]336-the boat , making [himself]103-babalatchi small under [his]103-babalatchi as enormous sun hat to escape the scorching heat reflected from the water . [He]103-babalatchi was not in a hurry ; [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master , [Lakamba]85-lakamba , was surely reposing at this time of the day . [He]103-babalatchi would have ample time to cross over and greet [him]1119-his master on [his]103-babalatchi waking with important news . Will [he]103-babalatchi be displeased ? Will [he]103-babalatchi strike [his]103-babalatchi ebony wood staff angrily on the floor , frightening [him]1119-his master by the incoherent violence of [his]103-babalatchi exclamations ; or will [he]103-babalatchi squat down with a good - humoured smile , and , rubbing [his]103-babalatchi hands gently over [his]103-babalatchi stomach with a familiar gesture , expectorate copiously into the brass siri - vessel , giving vent to a low , approbative murmur ? Such were [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's thoughts as [he]103-babalatchi skilfully handled [his]103-babalatchi paddle , crossing [the river]170-the river on [his]103-babalatchi way to [the [Rajah]78-the rajah 's campong]1121-the rajah 's campong , whose stockades showed from behind the dense foliage of [the bank]331-the bank just opposite to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's bungalow]1123-almayer 's bungalow . Indeed , [he]103-babalatchi had a report to make . Something certain at last to confirm the daily tale of suspicions , the daily hints of familiarity , of stolen glances [he]103-babalatchi had seen , of short and burning words [he]103-babalatchi had overheard exchanged between [Dain Maroola]74-dain and [[Almayer]72-almayer 's daughter]1124-almayer 's daughter . [Lakamba]85-lakamba had , till then , listened to it all , calmly and with evident distrust ; now [he]85-lakamba was going to be convinced , for [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi had the proof ; had it this very morning , when fishing at break of day in [the creek]941-the creek over which stood [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's house]1126-bulangi 's house . There from [his]103-babalatchi skiff [he]103-babalatchi saw [Nina]73-nina 's long canoe drift past , [the girl sitting in the stern]1127-the girl sitting in the stern bending over [Dain]74-dain , who was stretched in the bottom with [his]74-dain head resting on [the girl]402-the girl 's knees . [He]103-babalatchi saw it . [He]103-babalatchi followed [them]1129-them , but in a short time [they]1129-them took to the paddles and got away from under [his]103-babalatchi observant eye . A few minutes afterwards [he]103-babalatchi saw [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's slave - girl]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl paddling in [a small dug - out to [the town]1132-the town]1131-a small dug - out to the town with [her]402-the girl cakes for sale . [She]402-the girl also had seen [them]1129-them in the grey dawn . And [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi grinned confidentially to [himself]103-babalatchi at the recollection of [the slave - girl]1133-the slave - girl 's discomposed face , of the hard look in [her]1133-the slave - girl eyes , of the tremble in [her]1133-the slave - girl voice , when answering [his]103-babalatchi questions . That little [Taminah]119-taminah evidently admired [Dain Maroola]74-dain . That was good ! And [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi laughed aloud at the notion ; then becoming suddenly serious , [he]103-babalatchi began by some strange association of ideas to speculate upon the price for which [Bulangi]102-bulangi would , possibly , sell [the girl]402-the girl . [He]103-babalatchi shook [his]103-babalatchi head sadly at the thought that [Bulangi]102-bulangi was [a hard man]1135-a hard man , and had refused one hundred dollars for that same [Taminah]119-taminah only a few weeks ago ; then [he]103-babalatchi became suddenly aware that [the canoe]338-the canoe had drifted too far down during [his]103-babalatchi meditation . [He]103-babalatchi shook off the despondency caused by the certitude of [Bulangi]102-bulangi 's mercenary disposition , and , taking up [his]103-babalatchi paddle , in a few strokes sheered alongside the water- gate of [[the Rajah]78-the rajah 's house]1137-the rajah 's house . That afternoon [Almayer]72-almayer , as was [his]103-babalatchi wo nt lately , moved about on the water- side , overlooking the repairs to [[his]103-babalatchi boats]1138-his boats . [He]103-babalatchi had decided at last . Guided by the scraps of information contained in [old Lingard]79-lingard 's pocket- book , [he]103-babalatchi was going to seek for [the rich gold - mine]1139-the rich gold - mine , for [that place where [he]103-babalatchi had only to stoop to gather up an immense fortune and realise the dream of [his]103-babalatchi young days]1140-that place where he had only to stoop to gather up an immense fortune and realise the dream of his young days . To obtain the necessary help [he]103-babalatchi had shared [his]103-babalatchi knowledge with [Dain Maroola]74-dain , [he]103-babalatchi had consented to be reconciled with [Lakamba]85-lakamba , who gave [his]103-babalatchi support to the enterprise on condition of sharing the profits ; [he]103-babalatchi had sacrificed [his]103-babalatchi pride , [his]103-babalatchi honour , and [his]103-babalatchi loyalty in the face of the enormous risk of [his]103-babalatchi undertaking , dazzled by the greatness of the results to be achieved by this alliance so distasteful yet so necessary . The dangers were great , but [Maroola]74-dain was brave ; [[his]74-dain men]1040-his men seemed as reckless as [[their]1040-his men chief]1142-their chief , and with [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's aid success seemed assured . For the last fortnight [Almayer]72-almayer was absorbed in the preparations , walking amongst [[his]103-babalatchi workmen]1143-his workmen and [slaves]1144-slaves in a kind of waking trance , where practical details as to the fitting out of [the boats]693-the boats were mixed up with vivid dreams of untold wealth , where the present misery of burning sun , of [the muddy and malodorous river bank]1146-the muddy and malodorous river bank disappeared in a gorgeous vision of a splendid future existence for [himself]103-babalatchi and [Nina]73-nina . [He]103-babalatchi hardly saw [Nina]73-nina during these last days , although [the beloved daughter]1147-the beloved daughter was ever present in [his]103-babalatchi thoughts . [He]103-babalatchi hardly took notice of [Dain]74-dain , whose constant presence in [[his]103-babalatchi house]372-his house had become a matter of course to [him]103-babalatchi now [they]1149-they were connected by [a community of interests]1150-a community of interests . When meeting [the young chief]1151-the young chief [he]103-babalatchi gave [him]74-dain an absent greeting and passed on , seemingly wishing to avoid [him]74-dain , bent upon forgetting the hated reality of the present by absorbing [himself]103-babalatchi in [his]103-babalatchi work , or else by letting [his]103-babalatchi imagination soar far above the tree - tops into the great white clouds away to the westward , where [the paradise of [Europe]4-europe]1152-the paradise of europe was awaiting [the future Eastern millionaire]1153-the future eastern millionaire . And [Maroola]74-dain , now the bargain was struck and there was no more business to be talked over , evidently did not care for [the white man]512-the white man 's company . Yet [Dain]74-dain was always about [the house]169-the house , but [he]74-dain seldom stayed long by [the riverside]648-the riverside . On [his]74-dain daily visits to [the white man]512-the white man [the Malay chief]1158-the malay chief preferred to make [his]74-dain way quietly through [the central passage of [the house]169-the house]1159-the central passage of the house , and would come out into [the garden]1161-the garden at the back , where the fire was burning in [the cooking shed]380-the cooking shed , with the rice kettle swinging over it , under the watchful supervision of [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer . Avoiding [that shed]1163-that shed , with [its]1163-that shed black smoke and the warbling of soft , feminine voices , [Dain]74-dain would turn to the left . There , on the edge of [a banana plantation]1164-a banana plantation , a clump of palms and mango trees formed a shady spot , a few scattered bushes giving [it]1165-it a certain seclusion into which only [the serving women]1166-the serving women 's chatter or an occasional burst of laughter could penetrate . Once in , [he]74-dain was invisible ; and hidden there , leaning against the smooth trunk of a tall palm , [he]74-dain waited with gleaming eyes and an assured smile to hear the faint rustle of dried grass under the light footsteps of [Nina]73-nina .
