From the very first moment when [his]74-dain eyes beheld this - to [him]74-dain - perfection of loveliness [he]74-dain felt in [his]74-dain inmost heart the conviction that [she]73-nina would be [his]74-dain ; [he]74-dain felt the subtle breath of mutual understanding passing between [their]1167-their two savage natures , and [he]74-dain did not want [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's encouraging smiles to take every opportunity of approaching [the girl]402-the girl ; and every time [he]74-dain spoke to [her]73-nina , every time [he]74-dain looked into [her]73-nina eyes , [Nina]73-nina , although averting [her]73-nina face , felt as if [this bold - looking being who spoke burning words]1169-this bold - looking being who spoke burning words into [her]73-nina willing ear was the embodiment of [her]73-nina fate , [the creature of [her]73-nina dreams - reckless , ferocious , ready with flashing kriss for [[his]74-dain enemies]424-his enemies , and with passionate embrace for [[his]74-dain beloved]1172-his beloved]1170-the creature of her dreams - reckless , ferocious , ready with flashing kriss for his enemies , and with passionate embrace for his beloved - [the ideal Malay chief of [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother 's tradition]1173-the ideal malay chief of her mother 's tradition . [She]73-nina recognised with a thrill of delicious fear the mysterious consciousness of [her]73-nina identity with that being . Listening to [his]74-dain words , it seemed to [her]73-nina [she]73-nina was born only then to a knowledge of a new existence , that [her]73-nina life was complete only when near [him]74-dain , and [she]73-nina abandoned [herself]73-nina to a feeling of dreamy happiness , while with half - veiled face and in silence - as became [a Malay girl]305-a malay girl - [she]73-nina listened to [Dain]74-dain 's words giving up to [her]73-nina the whole treasure of love and passion [his]74-dain nature was capable of with all the unrestrained enthusiasm of [a man totally untrammelled by any influence of civilised self - discipline]1176-a man totally untrammelled by any influence of civilised self - discipline . And [they]1177-they used to pass many a delicious and fast fleeting hour under the mango trees behind the friendly curtain of bushes till [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's shrill voice gave the signal of unwilling separation . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer had undertaken the easy task of watching [[her]72-almayer husband]571-her husband lest [he]74-dain should interrupt the smooth course of [[her]72-almayer daughter]1005-her daughter 's love affair , in which [she]72-almayer took a great and benignant interest . [She]72-almayer was happy and proud to see [Dain]74-dain 's infatuation , believing [him]74-dain to be [a great and powerful chief]1180-a great and powerful chief , and [she]72-almayer found also a gratification of [her]72-almayer mercenary instincts in [Dain]74-dain 's open - handed generosity . On the eve of the day when [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's suspicions were confirmed by ocular demonstration , [Dain]74-dain and [Nina]73-nina had remained longer than usual in [their]1177-they shady retreat . Only [Almayer]72-almayer 's heavy step on [the verandah]156-the verandah and [his]74-dain querulous clamour for food decided [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer to lift a warning cry . [Maroola]74-dain leaped lightly over the low bamboo fence , and made [his]74-dain way stealthily through [the banana plantation]990-the banana plantation down to [the muddy shore of [the back creek]1184-the back creek]1183-the muddy shore of the back creek , while [Nina]73-nina walked slowly towards [the house]169-the house to minister to [[her]73-nina father]408-her father 's wants , as was [her]73-nina wo nt every evening . [Almayer]72-almayer felt happy enough that evening ; the preparations were nearly completed ; to - morrow [he]74-dain would launch [his]74-dain boats . In [his]74-dain mind 's eye [he]74-dain saw the rich prize in [his]74-dain grasp ; and , with tin spoon in [his]74-dain hand , [he]74-dain was forgetting the plateful of rice before [him]74-dain in the fanciful arrangement of some splendid banquet to take place on [his]74-dain arrival in [Amsterdam]10-amsterdam . [Nina]73-nina , reclining in the long chair , listened absently to the few disconnected words escaping from [[her]73-nina father]408-her father 's lips . Expedition ! Gold ! What did [she]73-nina care for all that ? But at the name of [Maroola]74-dain mentioned by [[her]73-nina father]408-her father [she]73-nina was all attention . [Dain]74-dain was going down [the river]170-the river with [his]74-dain brig to - morrow to remain away for a few days , said [Almayer]72-almayer . It was very annoying , this delay . As soon as [Dain]74-dain returned [they]1190-they would have to start without loss of time , for [the river]170-the river was rising . [He]74-dain would not be surprised if a great flood was coming . And [he]74-dain pushed away [his]74-dain plate with an impatient gesture on rising from the table . But now [Nina]73-nina heard [him]74-dain not . [Dain]74-dain going away ! That 's why [he]408-her father had ordered [her]73-nina , with that quiet masterfulness it was [her]73-nina delight to obey , to meet [him]74-dain at break of day in [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's creek]1192-bulangi 's creek . Was there a paddle in [her]73-nina canoe ? [she]73-nina thought . Was it ready ? [She]73-nina would have to start early - at four in the morning , in a very few hours . [She]73-nina rose from [her]73-nina chair , thinking [she]73-nina would require rest before the long pull in the early morning . The lamp was burning dimly , and [[her]73-nina father]408-her father , tired with the day 's labour , was already in [his]408-her father hammock . [Nina]73-nina put the lamp out and passed into [a large room [she]73-nina shared with [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother on the left of [the central passage]1196-the central passage]1194-a large room she shared with her mother on the left of the central passage . Entering , [she]73-nina saw that [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer had deserted the pile of mats serving [her]72-almayer as bed in [one corner of [the room]1198-the room]1197-one corner of the room , and was now bending over the opened lid of [her]72-almayer large wooden chest . Half a shell of cocoanut filled with oil , where a cotton rag floated for a wick , stood on the floor , surrounding [her]72-almayer with a ruddy halo of light shining through the black and odorous smoke . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's back was bent , and [her]72-almayer head and shoulders hidden in the deep box . [Her]72-almayer hands rummaged in the interior , where a soft clink as of silver money could be heard . [She]72-almayer did not notice at first [[her]72-almayer daughter]1005-her daughter 's approach , and [Nina]73-nina , standing silently by [her]72-almayer , looked down on many little canvas bags ranged in the bottom of the chest , wherefrom [[her]73-nina mother]637-her mother extracted handfuls of shining guilders and Mexican dollars , letting them stream slowly back again through [her]72-almayer claw - like fingers . The music of tinkling silver seemed to delight [her]72-almayer , and [her]72-almayer eyes sparkled with the reflected gleam of freshly- minted coins . [She]72-almayer was muttering to [herself]72-almayer : " And this , and this , and yet this ! Soon [he]2759-he will give more - as much more as [I]72-almayer ask . [He]2759-he is [a great Rajah]2712-a great rajah - [a Son of Heaven]2713-a son of heaven ! And [she]1005-her daughter will be [a Ranee]2762-a ranee - [he]2759-he gave all this for [her]1005-her daughter ! Who ever gave anything for [me]72-almayer ? [I]72-almayer am [a slave]310-a slave ! Am [I]72-almayer ? [I]72-almayer am [the mother of [a great Ranee]2765-a great ranee]2764-the mother of a great ranee ! "[72-almayer] [She]72-almayer became aware suddenly of [[her]72-almayer daughter]1005-her daughter 's presence , and ceased [her]72-almayer droning , shutting the lid down violently ; then , without rising from [her]72-almayer crouching position , [she]72-almayer looked up at [the girl standing by]1202-the girl standing by with a vague smile on [her]72-almayer dreamy face . " [You]1202-the girl standing by have seen . Have [you]1202-the girl standing by ? "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer shouted , shrilly . " That is all mine , and for [you]1202-the girl standing by . It is not enough ! [He]2765-a great ranee will have to give more before [he]2765-a great ranee takes [you]1202-the girl standing by away to [the southern island where [[his]2765-a great ranee father]177-his father is [king]2768-king]2766-the southern island where his father is king . [You]1202-the girl standing by hear [me]72-almayer ? [You]1202-the girl standing by are worth more , [granddaughter of [Rajahs]107-rajahs]2769-granddaughter of rajahs ! More ! More ! "[72-almayer] The sleepy voice of [Almayer]72-almayer was heard on [the verandah]156-the verandah recommending silence . [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer extinguished the light and crept into [her]72-almayer corner of [the room]1198-the room . [Nina]73-nina laid down on [her]73-nina back on a pile of soft mats , [her]73-nina hands entwined under [her]73-nina head , gazing through the shutterless hole , serving as a window at the stars twinkling on the black sky ; [she]73-nina was awaiting the time of start for [her]73-nina appointed meeting - place . With quiet happiness [she]73-nina thought of that meeting in [the great forest]2677-the great forest , far from all human eyes and sounds . [Her]73-nina soul , lapsing again into the savage mood , which the genius of civilisation working by the hand of [Mrs. Vinck]94-mrs. vinck could never destroy , experienced a feeling of pride and of some slight trouble at the high value [[her]73-nina worldly - wise mother]1206-her worldly - wise mother had put upon [[her]73-nina person]1207-her person ; but [she]73-nina remembered the expressive glances and words of [Dain]74-dain , and , tranquillised , [she]73-nina closed [her]73-nina eyes in a shiver of pleasant anticipation . There are some situations where [the barbarian]1208-the barbarian and [the , so - called , civilised man]1209-the , so - called , civilised man meet upon the same ground . It may be supposed that [Dain Maroola]74-dain was not exceptionally delighted with [[his]74-dain prospective mother - in- law]1210-his prospective mother - in- law , nor that [he]74-dain actually approved of [that worthy woman]1211-that worthy woman 's appetite for shining dollars . Yet on that foggy morning when [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , laying aside the cares of state , went to visit [his]103-babalatchi fish - baskets in [the Bulangi creek]1212-the bulangi creek , [Maroola]74-dain had no misgivings , experienced no feelings but those of impatience and longing , when paddling to [the east side of [the island]363-the island]1213-the east side of the island forming [the back - water in question]1215-the back - water in question . [He]74-dain hid [his]74-dain canoe in the bushes and strode rapidly across [the islet]1216-the islet , pushing with impatience through the twigs of heavy undergrowth intercrossed over [his]74-dain path . From motives of prudence [he]74-dain would not take [[his]74-dain canoe]1217-his canoe to [the meeting - place]1218-the meeting - place , as [Nina]73-nina had done . [He]74-dain had left it in [the main stream]947-the main stream till [his]74-dain return from [the other side of [the island]363-the island]1220-the other side of the island . The heavy warm fog was closing rapidly round [him]74-dain , but [he]74-dain managed to catch a fleeting glimpse of a light away to the left , proceeding from [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's house]1126-bulangi 's house . Then [he]74-dain could see nothing in the thickening vapour , and kept to [the path]1223-the path only by a sort of instinct , which also led [him]74-dain to [the very point on [the opposite shore]323-the opposite shore [he]74-dain wished to reach]1224-the very point on the opposite shore he wished to reach . A great log had stranded there , at right angles to [the bank]331-the bank , forming [a kind of jetty against which the swiftly flowing stream broke with a loud ripple]1227-a kind of jetty against which the swiftly flowing stream broke with a loud ripple . [He]74-dain stepped on it with a quick but steady motion , and in two strides found [himself]74-dain at the outer end , with the rush and swirl of the foaming water at [his]74-dain feet . Standing there alone , as if separated from [the world]190-the world ; the heavens , [earth]439-earth ; the very water roaring under [him]74-dain swallowed up in the thick veil of the morning fog , [he]74-dain breathed out the name of [Nina]73-nina before [him]74-dain into the apparently limitless space , sure of being heard , instinctively sure of the nearness of [the delightful creature]1230-the delightful creature ; certain of [her]73-nina being aware of [his]74-dain near presence as [he]74-dain was aware of [hers]73-nina . The bow of [[Nina]73-nina 's canoe]1231-nina 's canoe loomed up close to the log , canted high out of the water by the weight of [the sitter in the stern]1232-the sitter in the stern . [Maroola]74-dain laid [his]74-dain hand on the stem and leaped lightly in , giving it a vigorous shove off . [The light craft]1233-the light craft , obeying the new impulse , cleared the log by a hair 's breadth , and [the river]170-the river , with obedient complicity , swung it broadside to the current , and bore it off silently and rapidly between [the invisible banks]1235-the invisible banks . And once more [Dain]74-dain , at the feet of [Nina]73-nina , forgot [the world]190-the world , felt [himself]74-dain carried away helpless by a great wave of supreme emotion , by a rush of joy , pride , and desire ; understood once more with overpowering certitude that there was no life possible without that being [he]74-dain held clasped in [his]74-dain arms with passionate strength in a prolonged embrace . [Nina]73-nina disengaged [herself]73-nina gently with a low laugh . " [You]74-dain will overturn [the boat]336-the boat , [Dain]74-dain , "[73-nina] [she]73-nina whispered . [He]74-dain looked into [her]73-nina eyes eagerly for a minute and let [her]73-nina go with a sigh , then lying down in the canoe [he]74-dain put [his]74-dain head on [her]73-nina knees , gazing upwards and stretching [his]74-dain arms backwards till [his]74-dain hands met round [the girl]402-the girl 's waist . [She]73-nina bent over [him]74-dain , and , shaking [her]73-nina head , framed both [their]1238-their faces in the falling locks of [her]73-nina long black hair . And so [they]1238-their drifted on , [he]74-dain speaking with all the rude eloquence of a savage nature giving itself up without restraint to an overmastering passion , [she]73-nina bending low to catch the murmur of words sweeter to [her]73-nina than life itself . To [those two nothing]1239-those two nothing existed then outside the gunwales of the narrow and fragile craft . It was [[their]1238-their world]1240-their world , filled with [their]1238-their intense and all - absorbing love . [They]1238-their took no heed of thickening mist , or of the breeze dying away before sunrise ; [they]1238-their forgot the existence of [the great forests surrounding [them]1238-their]1241-the great forests surrounding them , of all the tropical nature awaiting the advent of the sun in a solemn and impressive silence . Over the low river - mist hiding [the boat]336-the boat with its freight of young passionate life and all - forgetful happiness , the stars paled , and a silvery - grey tint crept over the sky from the eastward . There was not a breath of wind , not a rustle of stirring leaf , not a splash of leaping fish to disturb the serene repose of all living things on [the banks of [the great river]712-the great river]1243-the banks of the great river . [Earth]49-earth , [river]410-river , and sky were wrapped up in a deep sleep , from which it seemed there would be no waking . All the seething life and movement of tropical nature seemed concentrated in the ardent eyes , in the tumultuously beating hearts of the two beings drifting in [the canoe]338-the canoe , under the white canopy of mist , over [the smooth surface of [the river]170-the river]1247-the smooth surface of the river . Suddenly a great sheaf of yellow rays shot upwards from behind the black curtain of trees lining [the banks of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]1249-the banks of the pantai . The stars went out ; the little black clouds at the zenith glowed for a moment with crimson tints , and the thick mist , stirred by the gentle breeze , the sigh of waking nature , whirled round and broke into fantastically torn pieces , disclosing the wrinkled surface of [the river]170-the river sparkling in the broad light of day . Great flocks of white birds wheeled screaming above the swaying tree - tops . The sun had risen on [the east coast]1251-the east coast . [Dain]74-dain was the first to return to the cares of everyday life . [He]74-dain rose and glanced rapidly up and down [the river]170-the river . [His]74-dain eye detected [[Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's boat astern]1253-babalatchi 's boat astern , and another small black speck on the glittering water , which was [[Taminah]119-taminah 's canoe]1254-taminah 's canoe . [He]74-dain moved cautiously forward , and , kneeling , took up a paddle ; [Nina]73-nina at the stern took [hers]73-nina . [They]1255-they bent [their]1255-they bodies to the work , throwing up the water at every stroke , and [the small craft]1256-the small craft went swiftly ahead , leaving a narrow wake fringed with a lace - like border of white and gleaming foam . Without turning [his]74-dain head , [Dain]74-dain spoke . " [Somebody]120-somebody behind [us]2771-us , [Nina]73-nina . [We]2771-us must not let [him]120-somebody gain . [I]74-dain think [he]120-somebody is too far to recognise [us]2771-us . "[74-dain] " Somebody before [us]2771-us also , "[73-nina] panted out [Nina]73-nina , without ceasing to paddle . " [I]74-dain think [I]74-dain know , "[74-dain] rejoined [Dain]74-dain . " The sun shines over there , but [I]74-dain fancy it is [the girl [Taminah]119-taminah]2772-the girl taminah . [She]2772-the girl taminah comes down every morning to [[my]74-dain brig]2773-my brig to sell cakes - stays often all day . It does not matter ; steer more into [the bank]331-the bank ; [we]2771-us must get under the bushes . [[My]74-dain canoe]2775-my canoe is hidden not far from here . "[74-dain] As [he]74-dain spoke [his]74-dain eyes watched the broad - leaved nipas which [they]1257-them were brushing in their swift and silent course . " Look out , [Nina]73-nina , "[74-dain] [he]74-dain said at last ; " there , where the water palms end and the twigs hang down under the leaning tree . Steer for the big green branch . "[74-dain] [He]74-dain stood up attentive , and [the boat]336-the boat drifted slowly in [shore]1259-shore , [Nina]73-nina guiding [it]336-the boat by a gentle and skilful movement of [her]73-nina paddle . When near enough [Dain]74-dain laid hold of the big branch , and leaning back shot [the canoe]338-the canoe under a low green archway of thickly matted creepers giving access to [a miniature bay formed by the caving in of [the bank]331-the bank during the last great flood]1261-a miniature bay formed by the caving in of the bank during the last great flood . [[His]74-dain own boat]1263-his own boat was there anchored by a stone , and [he]74-dain stepped into [it]1263-his own boat , keeping [his]74-dain hand on the gunwale of [[Nina]73-nina 's canoe]1231-nina 's canoe . In a moment the two little nutshells with [[their]1257-them occupants]1265-their occupants floated quietly side by side , reflected by the black water in the dim light struggling through a high canopy of dense foliage ; while above , away up in the broad day , flamed immense red blossoms sending down on [their]1257-them heads a shower of great dew - sparkling petals that descended rotating slowly in a continuous and perfumed stream ; and over [them]1257-them , under [them]1257-them , in [the sleeping water]1266-the sleeping water ; all around [them]1257-them in a ring of luxuriant vegetation bathed in the warm air charged with strong and harsh perfumes , the intense work of tropical nature went on : plants shooting upward , entwined , interlaced in inextricable confusion , climbing madly and brutally over each other in the terrible silence of a desperate struggle towards the life - giving sunshine above - as if struck with sudden horror at the seething mass of corruption below , at the death and decay from which [they]1257-them sprang . " [We]2776-we must part now , "[74-dain] said [Dain]74-dain , after a long silence . " [You]73-nina must return at once , [Nina]73-nina . [I]74-dain will wait till [the brig]288-the brig drifts down here , and shall get on board then . "[74-dain] " And will [you]74-dain be long away , [Dain]74-dain ? "[73-nina] asked [Nina]73-nina , in a low voice . " Long ! "[74-dain] exclaimed [Dain]74-dain . " Would [a man]340-a man willingly remain long in [a dark place]2779-a dark place ? When [I]74-dain am not near [you]73-nina , [Nina]73-nina , [I]74-dain am like [a man that is blind]2780-a man that is blind . What is life to [me]74-dain without light ? "[74-dain] [Nina]73-nina leaned over , and with a proud and happy smile took [Dain]74-dain 's face between [her]73-nina hands , looking into [his]74-dain eyes with a fond yet questioning gaze . Apparently [she]73-nina found there the confirmation of the words just said , for a feeling of grateful security lightened for [her]73-nina the weight of sorrow at the hour of parting . [She]73-nina believed that [he]74-dain , [the descendant of [many great Rajahs]1268-many great rajahs]1267-the descendant of many great rajahs , [the son of [a great chief]1270-a great chief]1269-the son of a great chief , [the master of life and death]1271-the master of life and death , knew the sunshine of life only in [her]73-nina presence . An immense wave of gratitude and love welled forth out of [her]73-nina heart towards [him]74-dain . How could [she]73-nina make an outward and visible sign of all [she]73-nina felt for [the man who had filled [her]73-nina heart with so much joy and so much pride]1272-the man who had filled her heart with so much joy and so much pride ? And in the great tumult of passion , like a flash of lightning came to [her]73-nina the reminiscence of that despised and almost forgotten civilisation [she]73-nina had only glanced at in [her]73-nina days of restraint , of sorrow , and of anger . In the cold ashes of that hateful and miserable past [she]73-nina would find the sign of love , the fitting expression of the boundless felicity of the present , the pledge of a bright and splendid future . [She]73-nina threw [her]73-nina arms around [Dain]74-dain 's neck and pressed [her]73-nina lips to [his]74-dain in a long and burning kiss . [He]74-dain closed [his]74-dain eyes , surprised and frightened at the storm raised in [his]74-dain breast by the strange and to [him]74-dain hitherto unknown contact , and long after [Nina]73-nina had pushed [her]73-nina canoe into [the river]170-the river [he]74-dain remained motionless , without daring to open [his]74-dain eyes , afraid to lose the sensation of intoxicating delight [he]74-dain had tasted for the first time . Now [he]74-dain wanted but immortality , [he]74-dain thought , to be [the equal of gods]1274-the equal of gods , and the creature that could open so the gates of paradise must be [his]74-dain - soon would be [his]74-dain for ever ! [He]74-dain opened [his]74-dain eyes in time to see through the archway of creepers the bows of [[his]74-dain brig]1037-his brig come slowly into view , as [the vessel]1107-the vessel drifted past on its way down [the river]170-the river . [He]74-dain must go on board now , [he]74-dain thought ; yet [he]74-dain was loth to leave the place where [he]74-dain had learned to know what happiness meant . " Time yet . Let [them]2781-them go , "[74-dain] [he]74-dain muttered to [himself]74-dain ; and [he]74-dain closed [his]74-dain eyes again under the red shower of scented petals , trying to recall the scene with all its delight and all its fear . [He]74-dain must have been able to join [[his]74-dain brig]1037-his brig in time , after all , and found much occupation outside , for it was in vain that [Almayer]72-almayer looked for [[his]74-dain friend]518-his friend 's speedy return . [The lower reach of [the river]170-the river where [he]74-dain so often and so impatiently directed [his]74-dain eyes]1280-the lower reach of the river where he so often and so impatiently directed his eyes remained deserted , save for the rapid flitting of [some fishing canoe]1282-some fishing canoe ; but down [the upper reaches]1283-the upper reaches came black clouds and heavy showers heralding the final setting in of the rainy season with its thunderstorms and great floods making [the river]170-the river almost impossible of ascent for [native canoes]1285-native canoes . [Almayer]72-almayer , strolling along [the muddy beach]1286-the muddy beach between [[his]74-dain houses]1287-his houses , watched uneasily [the river]170-the river rising inch by inch , creeping slowly nearer to [the boats]693-the boats , now ready and hauled up in a row under the cover of dripping Kajang - mats . [Fortune]121-fortune seemed to elude [his]74-dain grasp , and in [his]74-dain weary tramp backwards and forwards under the steady rain falling from the lowering sky , a sort of despairing indifference took possession of [him]74-dain . What did it matter ? It was just [his]74-dain luck ! [Those two infernal savages]1290-those two infernal savages , [Lakamba]85-lakamba and [Dain]74-dain , induced [him]74-dain , with [their]1290-those two infernal savages promises of help , to spend [his]74-dain last dollar in the fitting out of [boats]736-boats , and now one of [them]1290-those two infernal savages was gone somewhere , and the other shut up in [his]74-dain stockade would give no sign of life . No , not even [the scoundrelly Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , thought [Almayer]72-almayer , would show [his]103-babalatchi face near [him]74-dain , now [they]1290-those two infernal savages had sold [him]74-dain all the rice , brass gongs , and cloth necessary for [his]74-dain expedition . [They]1290-those two infernal savages had [his]74-dain very last coin , and did not care whether [he]74-dain went or stayed . And with a gesture of abandoned discouragement [Almayer]72-almayer would climb up slowly to the verandah of [[his]74-dain new house]673-his new house to get out of the rain , and leaning on the front rail with [his]74-dain head sunk between [his]74-dain shoulders [he]74-dain would abandon [himself]74-dain to the current of bitter thoughts , oblivious of the flight of time and the pangs of hunger , deaf to the shrill cries of [[his]74-dain wife]327-his wife calling [him]74-dain to the evening meal . When , roused from [his]74-dain sad meditations by the first roll of the evening thunderstorm , [he]74-dain stumbled slowly towards the glimmering light of [[his]74-dain old house]1294-his old house , [his]74-dain half - dead hope made [his]74-dain ears preternaturally acute to any sound on [the river]170-the river . Several nights in succession [he]74-dain had heard the splash of paddles and had seen the indistinct form of [a boat]2629-a boat , but when hailing [the shadowy apparition]1297-the shadowy apparition , [his]74-dain heart bounding with sudden hope of hearing [Dain]74-dain 's voice , [he]74-dain was disappointed each time by the sulky answer conveying to [him]74-dain the intelligence that [the Arabs]503-the arabs were on [the river]170-the river , bound on a visit to [the home - staying [Lakamba]85-lakamba]1300-the home - staying lakamba . This caused [him]74-dain many sleepless nights , spent in speculating upon the kind of villainy [those estimable personages]1301-those estimable personages were hatching now . At last , when all hope seemed dead , [he]74-dain was overjoyed on hearing [Dain]74-dain 's voice ; but [Dain]74-dain also appeared very anxious to see [Lakamba]85-lakamba , and [Almayer]72-almayer felt uneasy owing to a deep and ineradicable distrust as to [that ruler]1302-that ruler 's disposition towards [himself]74-dain . Still , [Dain]74-dain had returned at last . Evidently [he]74-dain meant to keep to [his]74-dain bargain . [Hope]122-hope revived , and that night [Almayer]72-almayer slept soundly , while [Nina]73-nina watched [the angry river]1303-the angry river under the lash of the thunderstorm sweeping onward towards [the sea]171-the sea . CHAPTER VI . [Dain]74-dain was not long in crossing [the river]170-the river after leaving [Almayer]72-almayer . [He]74-dain landed at the water - gate of the stockade enclosing [the group of houses which composed [the residence of [the Rajah of Sambir]123-the rajah]1307-the residence of the rajah of sambir]1306-the group of houses which composed the residence of the rajah of sambir . Evidently [somebody]1308-somebody was expected [there]2669-there , for the gate was open , and [men with torches]1310-men with torches were ready to precede [the visitor]1311-the visitor up the inclined plane of planks leading to [the largest house where [Lakamba]85-lakamba actually resided]1312-the largest house where lakamba actually resided , and where all the business of state was invariably transacted . [The other buildings within [the enclosure]1314-the enclosure]1313-the other buildings within the enclosure served only to accommodate [the numerous household]1315-the numerous household and [the wives of [the ruler]663-the ruler]1316-the wives of the ruler . [[Lakamba]85-lakamba 's own house]1318-lakamba 's own house was [a strong structure of solid planks , raised on high piles , with a verandah of split bamboos surrounding [it]1318-lakamba 's own house on all sides]1319-a strong structure of solid planks , raised on high piles , with a verandah of split bamboos surrounding it on all sides ; the whole was covered in by an immensely high - pitched roof of palm - leaves , resting on beams blackened by the smoke of many torches . [The building]725-the building stood parallel to [the river]170-the river , one of [its]725-the building long sides facing the water - gate of [the stockade]1322-the stockade . There was a door in the short side looking up [the river]170-the river , and the inclined plank - way led straight from the gate to that door . By the uncertain light of smoky torches , [Dain]74-dain noticed the vague outlines of [a group of [armed men in the dark shadows]1325-armed men in the dark shadows to [his]74-dain right]1324-a group of armed men in the dark shadows to his right . From that group [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stepped forward to open the door , and [Dain]74-dain entered [the audience chamber of [[the Rajah]656-the rajah 's residence]1328-the rajah 's residence]1326-the audience chamber of the rajah 's residence . About one- third of [the house]169-the house was curtained off , by heavy stuff of European manufacture , for that purpose ; close to the curtain there was a big arm- chair of some black wood , much carved , and before it a rough deal table . Otherwise [the room]1198-the room was only furnished with mats in great profusion . To the left of the entrance stood a rude arm - rack , with three rifles with fixed bayonets in it . By the wall , in the shadow , [the body - guard of [Lakamba]85-lakamba - [all friends]1332-all friends or [relations]1333-relations]1331-the body - guard of lakamba - all friends or relations - slept in a confused heap of brown arms , legs , and multi - coloured garments , from whence issued an occasional snore or a subdued groan of some uneasy sleeper . An European lamp with a green shade standing on the table made all this indistinctly visible to [Dain]74-dain . " [You]74-dain are welcome to [your]74-dain rest here , "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , looking at [Dain]74-dain interrogatively . " [I]74-dain must speak to [the Rajah]123-the rajah at once , "[74-dain] answered [Dain]74-dain . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi made a gesture of assent , and , turning to the brass gong suspended under the arm - rack , struck two sharp blows . The ear - splitting din woke up [the guard]1334-the guard . The snores ceased ; outstretched legs were drawn in ; the whole heap moved , and slowly resolved itself into individual forms , with much yawning and rubbing of sleepy eyes ; behind the curtains there was a burst of feminine chatter ; then the bass voice of [Lakamba]85-lakamba was heard . " Is that [the Arab trader]2782-the arab trader ? "[85-lakamba] " No , [Tuan]103-babalatchi , "[103-babalatchi] answered [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ; " [Dain]74-dain has returned at last . [He]74-dain is here for an important talk , bitcharra - if [you]103-babalatchi mercifully consent . "[103-babalatchi] Evidently [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's mercy went so far - for in a short while [he]85-lakamba came out from behind the curtain - but it did not go to the length of inducing [him]85-lakamba to make an extensive toilet . A short red sarong tightened hastily round [his]85-lakamba hips was [his]85-lakamba only garment . [The merciful ruler of [Sambir]123-the rajah]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir looked sleepy and rather sulky . [He]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir sat in the arm - chair , [his]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir knees well apart , [his]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir elbows on the arm - rests , [his]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir chin on [his]1335-the merciful ruler of sambir breast , breathing heavily and waiting malevolently for [Dain]74-dain to open the important talk . But [Dain]74-dain did not seem anxious to begin . [He]74-dain directed [his]74-dain gaze towards [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , squatting comfortably at the feet of [[his]74-dain master]1119-his master , and remained silent with a slightly bent head as if in attentive expectation of coming words of wisdom . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi coughed discreetly , and , leaning forward , pushed over a few mats for [Dain]74-dain to sit upon , then lifting up [his]103-babalatchi squeaky voice [he]103-babalatchi assured [him]74-dain with eager volubility of [everybody]1337-everybody 's delight at this long - looked - for return . [His]103-babalatchi heart had hungered for the sight of [Dain]74-dain 's face , and [his]103-babalatchi ears were withering for the want of the refreshing sound of [his]103-babalatchi voice . [Everybody]1337-everybody 's hearts and ears were in the same sad predicament , according to [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , as [he]103-babalatchi indicated with a sweeping gesture [the other bank of [the river]170-the river]1339-the other bank of the river where [the settlement]523-the settlement slumbered peacefully , unconscious of the great joy awaiting it on the morrow when [Dain]74-dain 's presence amongst [them]523-the settlement would be disclosed . " For "[103-babalatchi] - went on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi - " what is the joy of [a poor man]2783-a poor man if not the open hand of [a generous trader or of a great]2784-a generous trader or of a great - "[103-babalatchi] Here [he]103-babalatchi checked [himself]103-babalatchi abruptly with a calculated embarrassment of manner , and [his]103-babalatchi roving eye sought the floor , while an apologetic smile dwelt for a moment on [his]103-babalatchi misshapen lips . Once or twice during this opening speech an amused expression flitted across [Dain]74-dain 's face , soon to give way , however , to an appearance of grave concern . On [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's brow a heavy frown had settled , and [his]85-lakamba lips moved angrily as [he]85-lakamba listened to [[his]85-lakamba Prime Minister]1103-his prime minister 's oratory . In the silence that fell upon [the room]1198-the room when [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ceased speaking arose a chorus of varied snores from the corner where [the body - guard]1344-the body - guard had resumed [their]1344-the body - guard interrupted slumbers , but the distant rumble of thunder filling then [Nina]73-nina 's heart with apprehension for the safety of [[her]73-nina lover]1345-her lover passed unheeded by [those three men intent each on [their]1346-those three men intent each on their own purposes , for life or death own purposes , for life or death]1346-those three men intent each on their own purposes , for life or death . After a short silence , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , discarding now the flowers of polite eloquence , spoke again , but in short and hurried sentences and in a low voice . [They]1347-they had been very uneasy . Why did [Dain]74-dain remain so long absent ? [The men dwelling on [the lower reaches of [the river]170-the river]1349-the lower reaches of the river]1348-the men dwelling on the lower reaches of the river heard the reports of big guns and saw [a fire - ship of [the Dutch]124-the dutch amongst [the islands of [the estuary]741-the estuary]1352-the islands of the estuary]1351-a fire - ship of the dutch amongst the islands of the estuary . So [they]1347-they were anxious . Rumours of a disaster had reached [Abdulla]83-abdulla a few days ago , and since then [they]1347-they had been waiting for [Dain]74-dain 's return under the apprehension of some misfortune . For days [they]1347-they had closed [their]1347-they eyes in fear , and woke up alarmed , and walked abroad trembling , like [men]304-men before [an enemy]1355-an enemy . And all on account of [Dain]74-dain . Would [he]74-dain not allay [their]1347-they fears for [his]74-dain safety , not for [themselves]1347-they ? [They]1347-they were quiet and faithful , and devoted to [the great Rajah in [Batavia]21-batavia]1356-the great rajah in batavia - may [his]74-dain fate lead [him]74-dain ever to victory for the joy and profit of [[his]74-dain servants]1357-his servants ! " And here , "[103-babalatchi] went on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , " [Lakamba]85-lakamba [[my]103-babalatchi master]2751-my master was getting thin in [his]2751-my master anxiety for [the trader [he]2751-my master had taken under [his]2751-my master protection]2786-the trader he had taken under his protection ; and so was [Abdulla]83-abdulla , for what would [wicked men]2787-wicked men not say if perchance - "[103-babalatchi] " Be silent , [fool]2788-fool ! "[85-lakamba] growled [Lakamba]85-lakamba , angrily . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi subsided into silence with a satisfied smile , while [Dain]74-dain , who had been watching [him]103-babalatchi as if fascinated , turned with a sigh of relief towards [the ruler of [Sambir]20-sambir]1358-the ruler of sambir . [Lakamba]85-lakamba did not move , and , without raising [his]85-lakamba head , looked at [Dain]74-dain from under [his]85-lakamba eyebrows , breathing audibly , with pouted lips , in an air of general discontent . " Speak ! O [Dain]74-dain ! "[85-lakamba] [he]85-lakamba said at last . " [We]2789-we have heard many rumours . Many nights in succession has [[my]85-lakamba friend]2646-my friend [Reshid]119-taminah come here with bad tidings . News travels fast along [the coast]810-the coast . But they may be untrue ; there are more lies in [men]304-men 's mouths in these days than when [I]85-lakamba was young , but [I]85-lakamba am not easier to deceive now . "[85-lakamba] " All [my]74-dain words are true , "[74-dain] said [Dain]74-dain , carelessly . " If [you]74-dain want to know what befell [[my]85-lakamba brig]2773-my brig , then learn that it is in the hands of [the Dutch]124-the dutch . Believe [me]85-lakamba , [Rajah]123-the rajah , "[85-lakamba] [he]85-lakamba went on , with sudden energy , " [the Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda have [good friends]2794-good friends in [Sambir]20-sambir , or else how did [they]2794-good friends know [I]85-lakamba was coming thence ? "[85-lakamba] [Lakamba]85-lakamba gave [Dain]74-dain a short and hostile glance . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi rose quietly , and , going to the arm - rack , struck the gong violently . Outside the door there was a shuffle of bare feet ; inside , [the guard]1334-the guard woke up and sat staring in sleepy surprise . " Yes , [[you]74-dain faithful friend of [the white Rajah]2796-the white rajah]2795-you faithful friend of the white rajah , "[74-dain] went on [Dain]74-dain , scornfully , turning to [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , who had returned to [his]85-lakamba place , " [I]103-babalatchi have escaped , and [I]103-babalatchi am here to gladden [your]74-dain heart . When [I]103-babalatchi saw [the Dutch ship]2797-the dutch ship [I]103-babalatchi ran [the brig]288-the brig inside [the reefs]2799-the reefs and put [her]2797-the dutch ship ashore . [They]2800-they did not dare to follow with [the ship]295-the ship , so [they]2800-they sent [the boats]693-the boats . [We]2803-we took to [ours]2803-we and tried to get away , but [the ship]295-the ship dropped fireballs at [us]2803-we , and killed [many of [[my]103-babalatchi men]2806-my men]2805-many of my men . But [I]103-babalatchi am left , [O Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ! [The Dutch]124-the dutch are coming here . [They]2800-they are seeking for [me]103-babalatchi . [They]2800-they are coming to ask [[their]2800-they faithful friend]2807-their faithful friend [Lakamba]85-lakamba and [[his]85-lakamba slave]473-his slave [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . Rejoice ! "[103-babalatchi] But [neither of [his]1361-his hearers]1360-neither of his hearers appeared to be in a joyful mood . [Lakamba]85-lakamba had put one leg over [his]85-lakamba knee , and went on gently scratching it with a meditative air , while [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , sitting cross - legged , seemed suddenly to become smaller and very limp , staring straight before [him]85-lakamba vacantly . [The guard]1334-the guard evinced some interest in the proceedings , stretching [themselves]1334-the guard full length on the mats to be nearer [the speaker]1363-the speaker . [One of [them]1334-the guard]1364-one of them got up and now stood leaning against the arm - rack , playing absently with the fringes of [his]1364-one of them sword - hilt . [Dain]74-dain waited till the crash of thunder had died away in distant mutterings before [he]74-dain spoke again . " Are [you]74-dain dumb , [O ruler of [Sambir]20-sambir]2809-o ruler of sambir , or is [the son of [a great Rajah]2712-a great rajah unworthy of [your]74-dain notice]2810-the son of a great rajah unworthy of your notice ? [I]74-dain am come here to seek refuge and to warn [you]74-dain , and want to know what [you]74-dain intend doing . "[74-dain] " [You]74-dain came here because of [[the white man]512-the white man 's daughter]2813-the white man 's daughter , "[85-lakamba] retorted [Lakamba]85-lakamba , quickly . " [Your]74-dain refuge was with [[your]74-dain father]2814-your father , [the Rajah of [Bali]12-bali]2815-the rajah of bali , [the Son of Heaven]2816-the son of heaven , [the ' Anak Agong ']2817-the ' anak agong ' [himself]2817-the ' anak agong ' . What am [I]85-lakamba to protect [great princes]2818-great princes ? Only yesterday [I]85-lakamba planted rice in [a burnt clearing]2819-a burnt clearing ; to - day [you]74-dain say [I]85-lakamba hold [your]74-dain life in [my]85-lakamba hand . "[85-lakamba] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi glanced at [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master . " [No man]2820-no man can escape [his]2820-no man fate , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi murmured piously . " When love enters [a man]340-a man 's heart [he]340-a man is like [a child]968-a child - without any understanding . Be merciful , [Lakamba]85-lakamba , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi added , twitching the corner of the [Rajah]123-the rajah 's sarong warningly . [Lakamba]85-lakamba snatched away the skirt of the sarong angrily . Under the dawning comprehension of intolerable embarrassments caused by [Dain]74-dain 's return to [Sambir]20-sambir [he]74-dain began to lose such composure as [he]74-dain had been , till then , able to maintain ; and now [he]74-dain raised [his]74-dain voice loudly above the whistling of the wind and the patter of rain on the roof in the hard squall passing over [the house]169-the house . " [You]74-dain came [here]2634-here first as [a trader with sweet words and great promises]2824-a trader with sweet words and great promises , asking [me]74-dain to look the other way while [you]74-dain worked [your]74-dain will on [the white man there]2825-the white man there . And [I]74-dain did . What do [you]74-dain want now ? When [I]74-dain was young [I]74-dain fought . Now [I]74-dain am old , and want peace . It is easier for [me]74-dain to have [you]74-dain killed than to fight [the Dutch]124-the dutch . It is better for [me]74-dain . "[74-dain] The squall had now passed , and , in the short stillness of the lull in the storm , [Lakamba]85-lakamba repeated softly , as if to [himself]85-lakamba , " Much easier . Much better . "[85-lakamba] [Dain]74-dain did not seem greatly discomposed by [the Rajah]123-the rajah 's threatening words . While [Lakamba]85-lakamba was speaking [he]85-lakamba had glanced once rapidly over [his]85-lakamba shoulder , just to make sure that there was [nobody]163-nobody behind [him]85-lakamba , and , tranquillised in that respect , [he]85-lakamba had extracted a siri - box out of the folds of [his]85-lakamba waist- cloth , and was wrapping carefully the little bit of betel - nut and a small pinch of lime in the green leaf tendered [him]85-lakamba politely by [the watchful Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . [He]74-dain accepted this as a peace - offering from [the silent statesman]1368-the silent statesman - a kind of mute protest against [[his]74-dain master]1119-his master 's undiplomatic violence , and as an omen of a possible understanding to be arrived at yet . Otherwise [Dain]74-dain was not uneasy . Although recognising the justice of [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's surmise that [he]85-lakamba had come back to [Sambir]20-sambir only for the sake of [[the white man]512-the white man 's daughter]2813-the white man 's daughter , yet [he]85-lakamba was not conscious of any childish lack of understanding , as suggested by [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . In fact , [Dain]74-dain knew very well that [Lakamba]85-lakamba was too deeply implicated in the gunpowder smuggling to care for an investigation [the Dutch authorities]576-the dutch authorities into that matter . When sent off by [[his]74-dain father]177-his father , [the independent Rajah of [Bali]12-bali]1374-the independent rajah of bali , at the time when the hostilities between [Dutch and Malays]1375-dutch and malays threatened to spread from [Sumatra]51-sumatra over [the whole archipelago]1376-the whole archipelago , [Dain]74-dain had found all [the big traders]1377-the big traders deaf to [his]74-dain guarded proposals , and above the temptation of the great prices [he]74-dain was ready to give for gunpowder . [He]74-dain went to [Sambir]20-sambir as a last and almost hopeless resort , having heard in [Macassar]75-macassar of [the white man there]2825-the white man there , and of [the regular steamer]1379-the regular steamer trading from [Singapore]24-singapore - allured also by the fact that there was [no Dutch resident]1380-no dutch resident on [the river]170-the river , which would make things easier , no doubt . [His]74-dain hopes got nearly wrecked against the stubborn loyalty of [Lakamba]85-lakamba arising from well - understood self - interest ; but at last [the young man]181-the young man 's generosity , [his]181-the young man persuasive enthusiasm , the prestige of [[his]181-the young man father]177-his father 's great name , overpowered the prudent hesitation of [the ruler of [Sambir]20-sambir]1358-the ruler of sambir . [Lakamba]85-lakamba would have nothing to do [himself]85-lakamba with any illegal traffic . [He]85-lakamba also objected to [the Arabs]82-the arabs being made use of in that matter ; but [he]85-lakamba suggested [Almayer]72-almayer , saying that [he]85-lakamba was [a weak man]1385-a weak man easily persuaded , and that [[his]85-lakamba friend]518-his friend , [the English captain of [the steamer]610-the steamer]1387-the english captain of the steamer , could be made very useful - very likely even would join in the business , smuggling the powder in [the steamer]610-the steamer without [Abdulla]83-abdulla 's knowledge . There again [Dain]74-dain met in [Almayer]72-almayer with unexpected resistance ; [Lakamba]85-lakamba had to send [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi over with the solemn promise that [his]85-lakamba eyes would be shut in friendship for [the white man]512-the white man , [Dain]74-dain paying for the promise and the friendship in good silver guilders of [the hated Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda . [Almayer]72-almayer , at last consenting , said the powder would be obtained , but [Dain]74-dain must trust [him]85-lakamba with dollars to send to [Singapore]24-singapore in payment for it . [He]74-dain would induce [Ford]99-ford to buy and smuggle it in [the steamer]610-the steamer on board [the brig]288-the brig . [He]74-dain did not want any money for [himself]74-dain out of the transaction , but [Dain]74-dain must help [him]74-dain in [his]74-dain great enterprise after sending off [the brig]288-the brig . [Almayer]72-almayer had explained to [Dain]74-dain that [he]85-lakamba could not trust [Lakamba]85-lakamba alone in that matter ; [he]85-lakamba would be afraid of losing [his]85-lakamba treasure and [his]85-lakamba life through the cupidity of [the Rajah]656-the rajah ; yet [the Rajah]656-the rajah had to be told , and insisted on taking a share in that operation , or else [his]656-the rajah eyes would remain shut no longer . To this [Almayer]72-almayer had to submit . Had [Dain]74-dain not seen [Nina]73-nina [he]74-dain would have probably refused to engage [himself]74-dain and [[his]74-dain men]1040-his men in the projected expedition to [Gunong Mas]52-gunong mas - [the mountain of gold]1397-the mountain of gold . As it was [he]74-dain intended to return with [half of [[his]74-dain men]1040-his men]1398-half of his men as soon as [the brig]288-the brig was clear of [the reefs]2799-the reefs , but the persistent chase given [him]74-dain by [the Dutch frigate]1402-the dutch frigate had forced [him]74-dain to run south and ultimately to wreck and destroy [[his]74-dain vessel]1403-his vessel in order to preserve [his]74-dain liberty or perhaps even [his]74-dain life . Yes , [he]74-dain had come back to [Sambir]20-sambir for [Nina]73-nina , although aware that [the Dutch]124-the dutch would look for [him]74-dain there , but [he]74-dain had also calculated [his]74-dain chances of safety in [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's hands . For all [his]74-dain ferocious talk , [the merciful ruler]1404-the merciful ruler would not kill [him]74-dain , for [he]1404-the merciful ruler had long ago been impressed with the notion that [Dain]74-dain possessed the secret of [the white man]512-the white man 's treasure ; neither would [he]74-dain give [him]74-dain up to [the Dutch]124-the dutch , for fear of some fatal disclosure of complicity in the treasonable trade . So [Dain]74-dain felt tolerably secure as [he]74-dain sat meditating quietly [his]74-dain answer to [the Rajah]123-the rajah 's bloodthirsty speech . Yes , [he]74-dain would point out to [him]74-dain the aspect of [his]74-dain position should [he]74-dain - [Dain]74-dain - fall into the hands of [the Dutch]124-the dutch and should [he]74-dain speak the truth . [He]74-dain would have nothing more to lose then , and [he]74-dain would speak the truth . And if [he]74-dain did return to [Sambir]20-sambir , disturbing thereby [Lakamba]85-lakamba 's peace of mind , what then ? [He]74-dain came to look after [[his]74-dain property]1406-his property . Did [he]74-dain not pour a stream of silver into [[Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's greedy lap]1407-mrs. almayer 's greedy lap ? [He]74-dain had paid , for [the girl]402-the girl , a price worthy of [a great prince]1409-a great prince , although unworthy of that delightfully maddening creature for whom [his]74-dain untamed soul longed in an intensity of desire far more tormenting than the sharpest pain . [He]74-dain wanted [his]74-dain happiness . [He]74-dain had the right to be in [Sambir]20-sambir . [He]74-dain rose , and , approaching the table , leaned both [his]74-dain elbows on it ; [Lakamba]85-lakamba responsively edged [his]85-lakamba seat a little closer , while [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi scrambled to [his]103-babalatchi feet and thrust [his]103-babalatchi inquisitive head between [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master 's and [Dain]74-dain 's . [They]1411-they interchanged [their]1411-they ideas rapidly , speaking in whispers into [each other]1412-each other 's faces , very close now , [Dain]74-dain suggesting , [Lakamba]85-lakamba contradicting , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi conciliating and anxious in [his]103-babalatchi vivid apprehension of coming difficulties . [He]74-dain spoke most , whispering earnestly , turning [his]74-dain head slowly from side to side so as to bring [his]74-dain solitary eye to bear upon each of [[his]74-dain interlocutors]1413-his interlocutors in turn . Why should there be strife ? said [he]74-dain . Let [Tuan Dain]126-dain , whom [he]126-dain loved only less than [[his]126-dain master]1119-his master , go trustfully into hiding . There were many places for that . [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's house]1126-bulangi 's house away in [the clearing]1416-the clearing was best . [Bulangi]102-bulangi was [a safe man]1417-a safe man . In [the network of crooked channels]1418-the network of crooked channels [no white man]1419-no white man could find [his]102-bulangi way . [White men]471-white men were strong , but very foolish . It was undesirable to fight [them]471-white men , but deception was easy . [They]471-white men were like [silly women]1421-silly women - [they]471-white men did not know the use of reason , and [he]1422-he was a match for [any of [them]471-white men]1423-any of them - went on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , with all the confidence of deficient experience . Probably [the Dutch]124-the dutch would seek [Almayer]72-almayer . Maybe [they]471-white men would take away [[their]471-white men countryman]1424-their countryman if [they]471-white men were suspicious of [him]1424-their countryman . That would be good . After [the Dutch]124-the dutch went away [Lakamba]85-lakamba and [Dain]126-dain would get the treasure without any trouble , and there would be [one person less to share it]1425-one person less to share it . Did [he]1424-their countryman not speak wisdom ? Will [Tuan Dain]126-dain go to [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's house]1126-bulangi 's house till the danger is over , go at once ? [Dain]126-dain accepted this suggestion of going into hiding with a certain sense of conferring a favour upon [Lakamba]85-lakamba and [the anxious statesman]1427-the anxious statesman , but [he]126-dain met the proposal of going at once with a decided no , looking [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi meaningly in the eye . [The statesman]1428-the statesman sighed as [a man accepting the inevitable]1429-a man accepting the inevitable would do , and pointed silently towards [the other bank of [the river]170-the river]1339-the other bank of the river . [Dain]126-dain bent [his]126-dain head slowly . " Yes , [I]126-dain am going there , "[126-dain] [he]126-dain said . " Before the day comes ? "[103-babalatchi] asked [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . " [I]126-dain am going [there]2669-there now , "[126-dain] answered [Dain]126-dain , decisively . " [The Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda will not be here before to - morrow night , perhaps , and [I]126-dain must tell [Almayer]72-almayer of [our]2827-our arrangements . "[126-dain] " No , [Tuan]126-dain . No ; say nothing , "[103-babalatchi] protested [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . " [I]103-babalatchi will go over [myself]103-babalatchi at sunrise and let [him]126-dain know . "[103-babalatchi] " [I]126-dain will see , "[126-dain] said [Dain]126-dain , preparing to go . The thunderstorm was recommencing outside , the heavy clouds hanging low overhead now . There was a constant rumble of distant thunder punctuated by the nearer sharp crashes , and in the continuous play of blue lightning [the woods]390-the woods and [the river]170-the river showed fitfully , with all the elusive distinctness of detail characteristic of such a scene . Outside the door of [the Rajah 's house]1137-the rajah 's house [Dain]126-dain and [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stood on [the shaking verandah]1435-the shaking verandah as if dazed and stunned by the violence of the storm . [They]1436-they stood there amongst the cowering forms of [[the Rajah]656-the rajah 's slaves]1438-the rajah 's slaves and [retainers]1439-retainers seeking shelter from the rain , and [Dain]126-dain called aloud to [[his]126-dain boatmen]1440-his boatmen , who responded with an unanimous " [Ada]127-ada ! [Tuan]84-tuan almayer ! "[126-dain] while [they]1440-his boatmen looked uneasily at [the river]170-the river . " This is a great flood ! "[103-babalatchi] shouted [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi into [Dain]126-dain 's ear . " [The river]170-the river is very angry . Look ! Look at the drifting logs ! Can [you]84-tuan almayer go ? "[103-babalatchi] [Dain]126-dain glanced doubtfully on the livid expanse of seething water bounded far away on the other side by [the narrow black line of [the forests]705-the forests]1442-the narrow black line of the forests . Suddenly , in a vivid white flash , the low point of land with the bending trees on it and [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house , leaped into view , flickered and disappeared . [Dain]126-dain pushed [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi aside and ran down to the water - gate followed by [[his]126-dain shivering boatmen]1445-his shivering boatmen . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi backed slowly in and closed the door , then turned round and looked silently upon [Lakamba]85-lakamba . [The Rajah]656-the rajah sat still , glaring stonily upon the table , and [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi gazed curiously at the perplexed mood of [the man [he]103-babalatchi had served so many years through good and evil fortune]1447-the man he had served so many years through good and evil fortune . No doubt [the one - eyed statesman]1448-the one - eyed statesman felt within [his]103-babalatchi savage and much sophisticated breast the unwonted feelings of sympathy with , and perhaps even pity for , [the man [he]103-babalatchi called [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master]1449-the man he called his master . From the safe position of [a confidential adviser]1451-a confidential adviser , [he]103-babalatchi could , in the dim vista of past years , see [himself]103-babalatchi - a casual cut - throat - finding shelter under [that man]826-that man 's roof in [the modest rice - clearing of early beginnings]1453-the modest rice - clearing of early beginnings . Then came a long period of unbroken success , of wise counsels , and deep plottings resolutely carried out by [the fearless Lakamba]1454-the fearless lakamba , till [the whole east coast]1455-the whole east coast from [Poulo Laut]54-poulo laut to [Tanjong Batu]128-tanjong batu listened to [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's wisdom speaking through the mouth of [the ruler of [Sambir]20-sambir]1358-the ruler of sambir . In those long years how many dangers escaped , how many [enemies]1457-enemies bravely faced , how many [white men]471-white men successfully circumvented ! And now [he]103-babalatchi looked upon the result of so many years of patient toil : [the fearless Lakamba]1454-the fearless lakamba cowed by the shadow of an impending trouble . [The ruler]663-the ruler was growing old , and [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , aware of an uneasy feeling at the pit of [his]103-babalatchi stomach , put both [his]103-babalatchi hands there with a suddenly vivid and sad perception of the fact that [he]103-babalatchi [himself]103-babalatchi was growing old too ; that the time of reckless daring was past for both of [them]1461-they , and that [they]1461-they had to seek refuge in prudent cunning . [They]1461-they wanted peace ; [they]1461-they were disposed to reform ; [they]1461-they were ready even to retrench , so as to have the wherewithal to bribe the evil days away , if bribed away [they]1461-they could be . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi sighed for the second time that night as [he]103-babalatchi squatted again at [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master 's feet and tendered [him]1119-his master [his]103-babalatchi betel - nut box in mute sympathy . And [they]1461-they sat there in close yet silent communion of [betel - nut chewers]1463-betel - nut chewers , moving [their]1461-they jaws slowly , expectorating decorously into the wide- mouthed brass vessel [they]1461-they passed to [one another]1464-one another , and listening to the awful din of [the battling elements outside]1465-the battling elements outside . " There is a very great flood , "[103-babalatchi] remarked [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , sadly . " Yes , "[85-lakamba] said [Lakamba]85-lakamba . " Did [Dain]126-dain go ? "[85-lakamba] " [He]126-dain went , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . [He]126-dain ran down to [the river]170-the river like [a man possessed of the Sheitan [himself]126-dain]2830-a man possessed of the sheitan himself . "[85-lakamba] There was another long pause . " [He]126-dain may get drowned , "[85-lakamba] suggested [Lakamba]85-lakamba at last , with some show of interest . " The floating logs are many , "[103-babalatchi] answered [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , " but [he]126-dain is [a good swimmer]2831-a good swimmer , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi added languidly . " [He]126-dain ought to live , "[85-lakamba] said [Lakamba]85-lakamba ; " [he]126-dain knows where the treasure is . "[103-babalatchi] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi assented with an ill - humoured grunt . [His]103-babalatchi want of success in penetrating [the white man]512-the white man 's secret as to [the locality where the gold was to be found]1467-the locality where the gold was to be found was a sore point with the statesman of [Sambir]123-the rajah , as the only conspicuous failure in an otherwise brilliant career . A great peace had now succeeded the turmoil of the storm . Only the little belated clouds , which hurried past overhead to catch up [the main body flashing silently in the distance]1468-the main body flashing silently in the distance , sent down short showers that pattered softly with a soothing hiss over the palm - leaf roof . [Lakamba]85-lakamba roused [himself]85-lakamba from [his]85-lakamba apathy with an appearance of having grasped the situation at last . " [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , "[85-lakamba] [he]85-lakamba called briskly , giving [him]103-babalatchi a slight kick . " [Ada Tuan]127-ada ! [I]85-lakamba am listening . "[85-lakamba] " If [the Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda come here , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , and take [Almayer]72-almayer to [Batavia]21-batavia to punish [him]126-dain for smuggling gunpowder , what will [he]126-dain do , [you]85-lakamba think ? "[85-lakamba] " [I]85-lakamba do not know , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . "[85-lakamba] " [You]85-lakamba are [a fool]2832-a fool , "[85-lakamba] commented [Lakamba]85-lakamba , exultingly . " [He]126-dain will tell [them]2833-them where the treasure is , so as to find mercy . [He]126-dain will . "[85-lakamba] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi looked up at [[his]103-babalatchi master]1119-his master and nodded [his]103-babalatchi head with by no means a joyful surprise . [He]85-lakamba had not thought of this ; there was a new complication . " [Almayer]72-almayer must die , "[85-lakamba] said [Lakamba]85-lakamba , decisively , " to make [our]2834-our secret safe . [He]126-dain must die quietly , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . [You]103-babalatchi must do it . "[85-lakamba] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi assented , and rose wearily to [his]103-babalatchi feet . " To - morrow ? "[1119-his master] [he]1119-his master asked . " Yes ; before [the Dutch]124-the dutch come . [He]126-dain drinks much coffee , "[85-lakamba] answered [Lakamba]85-lakamba , with seeming irrelevancy . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stretched [himself]103-babalatchi yawning , but [Lakamba]85-lakamba , in the flattering consciousness of a knotty problem solved by [his]85-lakamba own unaided intellectual efforts , grew suddenly very wakeful . " [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , "[85-lakamba] [he]85-lakamba said to [the exhausted statesman]1470-the exhausted statesman , " fetch the box of music [the white captain]2835-the white captain gave [me]85-lakamba . [I]85-lakamba can not sleep . "[85-lakamba] At this order a deep shade of melancholy settled upon [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's features . [He]103-babalatchi went reluctantly behind the curtain and soon reappeared carrying in [his]103-babalatchi arms a small hand - organ , which [he]103-babalatchi put down on the table with an air of deep dejection . [Lakamba]85-lakamba settled [himself]85-lakamba comfortably in [his]85-lakamba arm - chair . " Turn , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , turn , "[85-lakamba] [he]85-lakamba murmured , with closed eyes . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's hand grasped the handle with the energy of despair , and as [he]103-babalatchi turned , the deep gloom on [his]103-babalatchi countenance changed into an expression of hopeless resignation . Through the open shutter the notes of [Verdi]129-verdi 's music floated out on the great silence over [the river]170-the river and [forest]1472-forest . [Lakamba]85-lakamba listened with closed eyes and a delighted smile ; [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi turned , at times dozing off and swaying over , then catching [himself]103-babalatchi up in a great fright with a few quick turns of the handle . [Nature]130-nature slept in an exhausted repose after the fierce turmoil , while under the unsteady hand of [the statesman of [Sambir the Trovatore]131-sambir the trovatore]1473-the statesman of sambir the trovatore fitfully wept , wailed , and bade good - bye to [[his]131-sambir the trovatore Leonore]1474-his leonore again and again in a mournful round of tearful and endless iteration . CHAPTER VII . The bright sunshine of the clear mistless morning , after the stormy night , flooded the main path of [the settlement]523-the settlement leading from [the low shore of [the [Pantai]3-the pantai branch of [the river]170-the river]1477-the pantai branch of the river]1476-the low shore of the pantai branch of the river to [the gate of [[Abdulla]83-abdulla 's compound]867-abdulla 's compound]1479-the gate of abdulla 's compound . [The path]1223-the path was deserted this morning ; [it]1223-the path stretched [its]1223-the path dark yellow surface , hard beaten by the tramp of many bare feet , between the clusters of palm trees , whose tall trunks barred [it]1223-the path with strong black lines at irregular intervals , while the newly risen sun threw the shadows of their leafy heads far away over the roofs of [the buildings lining [the river]170-the river]1482-the buildings lining the river , even over [the river]170-the river itself as it flowed swiftly and silently past [the deserted houses]1485-the deserted houses . For [the houses]757-the houses were deserted too . On the narrow strip of trodden grass intervening between [their]757-the houses open doors and [the road]1082-the road , the morning fires smouldered untended , sending thin fluted columns of smoke into the cool air , and spreading the thinnest veil of mysterious blue haze over the sunlit solitude of [the settlement]523-the settlement . [Almayer]72-almayer , just out of [his]1489-his hammock , gazed sleepily at the unwonted appearance of [Sambir]131-sambir the trovatore , wondering vaguely at the absence of life . [[His]1489-his own house]1490-his own house was very quiet ; [he]1489-his could not hear [[his]1489-his wife]327-his wife 's voice , nor the sound of [Nina]73-nina 's footsteps in [the big room]1492-the big room , opening on [the verandah]156-the verandah , which [he]1489-his called [[his]1489-his sitting - room]1494-his sitting - room , whenever , in the company of [white men]471-white men , [he]1489-his wished to assert [his]1489-his claims to the commonplace decencies of civilisation . [Nobody]163-nobody ever sat [there]2669-there ; there was nothing there to sit upon , for [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer in [her]72-almayer savage moods , when excited by the reminiscences of the piratical period of [her]72-almayer life , had torn off the curtains to make sarongs for [the slave - girls]1498-the slave - girls , and had burnt the showy furniture piecemeal to cook the family rice . But [Almayer]72-almayer was not thinking of [his]1489-his furniture now . [He]1489-his was thinking of [Dain]126-dain 's return , of [Dain]126-dain 's nocturnal interview with [Lakamba]85-lakamba , of its possible influence on [his]1489-his long - matured plans , now nearing the period of [their]1499-their execution . [He]1489-his was also uneasy at the non - appearance of [Dain]126-dain who had promised [him]1489-his an early visit . " [The fellow]2836-the fellow had plenty of time to cross [the river]170-the river , "[1489-his] [he]1489-his mused , " and there was so much to be done to - day . The settling of details for the early start on the morrow ; the launching of [the boats]693-the boats ; the thousand and one finishing touches . For the expedition must start complete , nothing should be forgotten , nothing should - "[1489-his] The sense of the unwonted solitude grew upon [him]1489-his suddenly , and in the unusual silence [he]1489-his caught [himself]1489-his longing even for the usually unwelcome sound of [[his]1489-his wife]327-his wife 's voice to break the oppressive stillness which seemed , to [his]1489-his frightened fancy , to portend the advent of some new misfortune . " What has happened ? "[1489-his] [he]1489-his muttered half aloud , as [he]1489-his shuffled in [his]1489-his imperfectly adjusted slippers towards the balustrade of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " Is everybody asleep or dead ? "[1489-his] [The settlement]523-the settlement was alive and very much awake . [It]523-the settlement was awake ever since the early break of day , when [Mahmat Banjer]132-mahmat , in a fit of unheard - of energy , arose and , taking up [his]1489-his hatchet , stepped over the sleeping forms of [[his]1489-his two wives]1503-his two wives and walked shivering to [the water 's edge]1504-the water 's edge to make sure that [the new house]1505-the new house [he]1489-his was building had not floated away during the night . [The house]169-the house was being built by [the enterprising Mahmat]132-mahmat on [a large raft]1507-a large raft , and [he]1489-his had securely moored it just inside [the muddy point of land]1508-the muddy point of land at the junction of [the two branches of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]964-the two branches of the pantai so as to be out of the way of drifting logs that would no doubt strand on the point during the freshet . [Mahmat]132-mahmat walked through the wet grass saying bourrouh , and cursing softly to [himself]132-mahmat the hard necessities of active life that drove [him]132-mahmat from [his]132-mahmat warm couch into the cold of the morning . A glance showed [him]132-mahmat that [[his]1489-his house]372-his house was still there , and [he]132-mahmat congratulated [himself]132-mahmat on [his]132-mahmat foresight in hauling [it]372-his house out of harm 's way , for the increasing light showed [him]132-mahmat a confused wrack of drift - logs , half - stranded on [the muddy flat]1511-the muddy flat , interlocked into a shapeless raft by their branches , tossing to and fro and grinding together in the eddy caused by the meeting currents of [the two branches of [the river]170-the river]1512-the two branches of the river . [Mahmat]132-mahmat walked down to [the water 's edge]1504-the water 's edge to examine the rattan moorings of [[his]132-mahmat house]372-his house just as the sun cleared the trees of [the forest]915-the forest on [the opposite shore]323-the opposite shore . As [he]132-mahmat bent over the fastenings [he]132-mahmat glanced again carelessly at the unquiet jumble of logs and saw there something that caused [him]132-mahmat to drop [his]132-mahmat hatchet and stand up , shading [his]132-mahmat eyes with [his]132-mahmat hand from the rays of the rising sun . It was something red , and the logs rolled over it , at times closing round it , sometimes hiding it . It looked to [him]132-mahmat at first like a strip of red cloth . The next moment [Mahmat]132-mahmat had made it out and raised a great shout . " Ah ya ! There ! "[132-mahmat] yelled [Mahmat]132-mahmat . " There 's [a man amongst the logs]2839-a man amongst the logs . "[132-mahmat] [He]132-mahmat put the palms of [his]132-mahmat hand to [his]132-mahmat lips and shouted , enunciating distinctly , [his]132-mahmat face turned towards [the settlement]523-the settlement : " There 's [a body of [a man]340-a man in [the river]170-the river]2840-a body of a man in the river ! Come and see ! [A dead - stranger]2843-a dead - stranger ! "[132-mahmat] [The women of the nearest house]1519-the women of the nearest house were already outside kindling the fires and husking the morning rice . [They]1519-the women of the nearest house took up the cry shrilly , and it travelled so from [house]486-house to [house]486-house , dying away in the distance . [The men]1044-the men rushed out excited but silent , and ran towards [the muddy point]1523-the muddy point where the unconscious logs tossed and ground and bumped and rolled over [the dead stranger]1524-the dead stranger with the stupid persistency of inanimate things . [The women]376-the women followed , neglecting [their]376-the women domestic duties and disregarding the possibilities of domestic discontent , while [groups of [children]1527-children]1526-groups of children brought up the rear , warbling joyously , in the delight of unexpected excitement . [Almayer]72-almayer called aloud for [[his]132-mahmat wife]327-his wife and [daughter]2649-daughter , but receiving no response , stood listening intently . The murmur of [the crowd]1530-the crowd reached [him]132-mahmat faintly , bringing with it the assurance of some unusual event . [He]132-mahmat glanced at [the river]170-the river just as [he]132-mahmat was going to leave [the verandah]156-the verandah and checked [himself]132-mahmat at the sight of [a small canoe]526-a small canoe crossing over from [[the Rajah]123-the rajah 's landing - place]1534-the rajah 's landing - place . [The solitary occupant in whom [Almayer]72-almayer]1535-the solitary occupant in whom almayer soon recognised [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi effected the crossing a little below [the house]169-the house and paddled up to [the Lingard jetty]730-the lingard jetty in [the dead water under the bank]1538-the dead water under the bank . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi clambered out slowly and went on fastening [his]103-babalatchi canoe with fastidious care , as if not in a hurry to meet [Almayer]72-almayer , whom [he]103-babalatchi saw looking at [him]103-babalatchi from [the verandah]156-the verandah . This delay gave [Almayer]72-almayer time to notice and greatly wonder at [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's official get - up . [The statesman of [Sambir]123-the rajah]1085-the statesman of sambir was clad in a costume befitting [his]1085-the statesman of sambir high rank . A loudly checkered sarong encircled [his]1085-the statesman of sambir waist , and from its many folds peeped out the silver hilt of the kriss that saw the light only on great festivals or during official receptions . Over the left shoulder and across the otherwise unclad breast of [the aged diplomatist]1541-the aged diplomatist glistened a patent leather belt bearing a brass plate with the arms of [Netherlands]133-netherlands under the inscription , " [Sultan of Sambir]134-sultan of sambir . "[133-netherlands] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's head was covered by a red turban , whose fringed ends falling over the left cheek and shoulder gave to [his]1085-the statesman of sambir aged face a ludicrous expression of joyous recklessness . When the canoe was at last fastened to [his]1085-the statesman of sambir satisfaction [he]1085-the statesman of sambir straightened [himself]1085-the statesman of sambir up , shaking down the folds of [his]1085-the statesman of sambir sarong , and moved with long strides towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house , swinging regularly [his]1085-the statesman of sambir long ebony staff , whose gold head ornamented with precious stones flashed in the morning sun . [Almayer]72-almayer waved [his]1085-the statesman of sambir hand to the right towards [the point of land]1543-the point of land , to [him]1085-the statesman of sambir invisible , but in full view from [the jetty]2614-the jetty . " Oh , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ! oh ! "[1085-the statesman of sambir] [he]1085-the statesman of sambir called out ; " what is the matter there ? can [you]103-babalatchi see ? "[1085-the statesman of sambir] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stopped and gazed intently at [the crowd on [the river bank]591-the river bank]1545-the crowd on the river bank , and after a little while [the astonished Almayer]72-almayer saw [him]103-babalatchi leave [the path]1223-the path , gather up [his]103-babalatchi sarong in one hand , and break into a trot through the grass towards [the muddy point]1523-the muddy point . [Almayer]72-almayer , now greatly interested , ran down the steps of [the verandah]156-the verandah . The murmur of [men]304-men 's voices and the shrill cries of [women]631-women reached [him]1085-the statesman of sambir quite distinctly now , and as soon as [he]1085-the statesman of sambir turned the corner of [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir house]372-his house [he]1085-the statesman of sambir could see [the crowd]1530-the crowd on [the low promontory]1554-the low promontory swaying and pushing round some object of interest . [He]1085-the statesman of sambir could indistinctly hear [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's voice , then the crowd opened before [the aged statesman]1555-the aged statesman and closed after [him]1555-the aged statesman with an excited hum , ending in a loud shout . As [Almayer]72-almayer approached [the throng]1556-the throng [a man]340-a man ran out and rushed past [him]1085-the statesman of sambir towards [the settlement]523-the settlement , unheeding [his]1085-the statesman of sambir call to stop and explain the cause of this excitement . On [the very outskirts of [the crowd]1530-the crowd]1559-the very outskirts of the crowd [Almayer]72-almayer found [himself]72-almayer arrested by [an unyielding mass of humanity]1561-an unyielding mass of humanity , regardless of [his]1085-the statesman of sambir entreaties for a passage , insensible to [his]1085-the statesman of sambir gentle pushes as [he]1085-the statesman of sambir tried to work [his]1085-the statesman of sambir way through it towards [the riverside]648-the riverside . In the midst of [his]1085-the statesman of sambir gentle and slow progress [he]1085-the statesman of sambir fancied suddenly [he]1085-the statesman of sambir had heard [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir wife]327-his wife 's voice in the thickest of [the throng]1556-the throng .
