[He]1085-the statesman of sambir could not mistake very well [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's high - pitched tones , yet the words were too indistinct for [him]1085-the statesman of sambir to understand their purport . [He]1085-the statesman of sambir paused in [his]1085-the statesman of sambir endeavours to make a passage for [himself]1085-the statesman of sambir , intending to get some intelligence from [those around [him]1085-the statesman of sambir]1565-those around him , when a long and piercing shriek rent the air , silencing the murmurs of [the crowd]1530-the crowd and the voices of [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir informants]1567-his informants . For a moment [Almayer]72-almayer remained as if turned into stone with astonishment and horror , for [he]1085-the statesman of sambir was certain now that [he]1085-the statesman of sambir had heard [[his]1085-the statesman of sambir wife]327-his wife wailing for the dead . [He]1085-the statesman of sambir remembered [Nina]73-nina 's unusual absence , and maddened by [his]1085-the statesman of sambir apprehensions as to [her]73-nina safety , [he]1085-the statesman of sambir pushed blindly and violently forward , [the crowd falling back with cries of surprise and pain]1569-the crowd falling back with cries of surprise and pain before [his]1085-the statesman of sambir frantic advance . On [the point of land]1543-the point of land in a little clear space lay the body of [the stranger just hauled out from amongst the logs]1571-the stranger just hauled out from amongst the logs . On one side stood [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , [his]103-babalatchi chin resting on the head of [his]103-babalatchi staff and [his]103-babalatchi one eye gazing steadily at the shapeless mass of broken limbs , torn flesh , and bloodstained rags . As [Almayer]72-almayer burst through the ring of [horrified spectators]1572-horrified spectators , [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer threw [her]72-almayer own head - veil over the upturned face of [the drowned man]1573-the drowned man , and , squatting by it , with another mournful howl , sent a shiver through [the now silent crowd]1574-the now silent crowd . [Mahmat]132-mahmat , dripping wet , turned to [Almayer]72-almayer , eager to tell [his]132-mahmat tale . In the first moment of reaction from the anguish of [his]132-mahmat fear the sunshine seemed to waver before [Almayer]72-almayer 's eyes , and [he]1085-the statesman of sambir listened to words spoken around [him]1085-the statesman of sambir without comprehending their meaning . When , by a strong effort of will , [he]1085-the statesman of sambir regained the possession of [his]1085-the statesman of sambir senses , [Mahmat]132-mahmat was saying - " That is the way , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . [His]1085-the statesman of sambir sarong was caught in the broken branch , and [he]1085-the statesman of sambir hung with [his]1085-the statesman of sambir head under water . When [I]132-mahmat saw what it was [I]132-mahmat did not want it [here]2634-here . [I]132-mahmat wanted it to get clear and drift away . Why should [we]2845-we bury [a stranger]2846-a stranger in the midst of [[our]2845-we houses]2847-our houses for [his]2846-a stranger ghost to frighten [[our]2845-we women]2848-our women and [children]1527-children ? Have [we]2845-we not enough ghosts about [this place]2648-this place ? "[132-mahmat] A murmur of approval interrupted [him]1085-the statesman of sambir here . [Mahmat]132-mahmat looked reproachfully at [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . " But [the Tuan Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ordered [me]132-mahmat to drag the body ashore "[132-mahmat] - [he]132-mahmat went on looking round at [[his]132-mahmat audience]1575-his audience , but addressing [himself]132-mahmat only to [Almayer]72-almayer - " and [I]132-mahmat dragged [him]2846-a stranger by the feet ; in through the mud [I]132-mahmat have dragged [him]2846-a stranger , although [my]132-mahmat heart longed to see [him]2846-a stranger float down [the river]170-the river to strand perchance on [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's clearing]2852-bulangi 's clearing - may [[his]2846-a stranger father]177-his father 's grave be defiled ! "[132-mahmat] There was subdued laughter at this , for the enmity of [Mahmat]132-mahmat and [Bulangi]102-bulangi was a matter of common notoriety and of undying interest to [the inhabitants of [Sambir]20-sambir]1576-the inhabitants of sambir . In the midst of that mirth [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer wailed suddenly again . " [Allah]110-allah ! What ails [the woman]2854-the woman ! "[132-mahmat] exclaimed [Mahmat]132-mahmat , angrily . " Here , [I]132-mahmat have touched this carcass which came from [nobody]163-nobody knows where , and have most likely defiled [myself]132-mahmat before eating rice . By orders of [Tuan Babalatchi]103-babalatchi [I]132-mahmat did this thing to please [the white man]512-the white man . Are [you]72-almayer pleased , [O Tuan Almayer]84-tuan almayer ? And what will be [my]132-mahmat recompense ? [Tuan Babalatchi]103-babalatchi said a recompense there will be , and from [you]72-almayer . Now consider . [I]132-mahmat have been defiled , and if not defiled [I]132-mahmat may be under the spell . Look at [his]512-the white man anklets ! Who ever heard of a corpse appearing during the night amongst the logs with gold anklets on its legs ? There is witchcraft there . However , "[132-mahmat] added [Mahmat]132-mahmat , after a reflective pause , " [I]132-mahmat will have the anklet if there is permission , for [I]132-mahmat have a charm against the ghosts and am not afraid . [God]135-god is great ! "[132-mahmat] A fresh outburst of noisy grief from [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer checked the flow of [Mahmat]132-mahmat 's eloquence . [Almayer]72-almayer , bewildered , looked in turn at [[his]132-mahmat wife]327-his wife , at [Mahmat]132-mahmat , at [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , and at last arrested [his]132-mahmat fascinated gaze on the body lying on the mud with covered face in a grotesquely unnatural contortion of mangled and broken limbs , one twisted and lacerated arm , with white bones protruding in many places through the torn flesh , stretched out ; the hand with outspread fingers nearly touching [his]103-babalatchi foot . " Do [you]103-babalatchi know who this is ? "[132-mahmat] [he]132-mahmat asked of [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , in a low voice . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , staring straight before [him]132-mahmat , hardly moved [his]103-babalatchi lips , while [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's persistent lamentations drowned the whisper of [his]103-babalatchi murmured reply intended only for [Almayer]72-almayer 's ear . " It was fate . Look at [your]103-babalatchi feet , [white man]813-white man . [I]103-babalatchi can see a ring on those torn fingers which [I]103-babalatchi know well . "[103-babalatchi] Saying this , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stepped carelessly forward , putting [his]103-babalatchi foot as if accidentally on the hand of the corpse and pressing it into the soft mud . [He]103-babalatchi swung [his]103-babalatchi staff menacingly towards [the crowd , which fell back a little]1578-the crowd , which fell back a little . " Go away , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi said sternly , " and send [[your]103-babalatchi women]2858-your women to [their]2858-your women cooking fires , which [they]2858-your women ought not to have left to run after [a dead stranger]2859-a dead stranger . This is [men]304-men 's work here . [I]103-babalatchi take [him]2859-a dead stranger now in the name of [the Rajah]656-the rajah . Let [no man]2820-no man remain here but [[Tuan Almayer]84-tuan almayer 's slaves]2863-tuan almayer 's slaves . Now go ! "[103-babalatchi] [The crowd]1530-the crowd reluctantly began to disperse . [The women]376-the women went first , dragging away [the children that hung back with all [their]1581-the children that hung back with all their weight on the maternal hand weight on the maternal hand]1581-the children that hung back with all their weight on the maternal hand . [The men]1044-the men strolled slowly after [them]376-the women in ever forming and changing groups that gradually dissolved as [they]1044-the men neared [the settlement]523-the settlement and [every man]1584-every man regained [[his]1584-every man own house]1490-his own house with steps quickened by the hungry anticipation of the morning rice . Only on the slight elevation where [the land]1586-the land sloped down towards [the muddy point]1523-the muddy point [a few men]1588-a few men , either friends or [enemies of [Mahmat]132-mahmat]1589-enemies of mahmat , remained gazing curiously for some time longer at [the small group standing around the body on [the river bank]591-the river bank]1590-the small group standing around the body on the river bank . " [I]72-almayer do not understand what [you]132-mahmat mean , [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer . " What is the ring [you]132-mahmat are talking about ? Whoever [he]1592-he is , [you]132-mahmat have trodden [the poor fellow]2864-the poor fellow 's hand right into the mud . Uncover [his]1592-he face , "[1592-he] [he]1592-he went on , addressing [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer , who , squatting by the head of the corpse , rocked [herself]72-almayer to and fro , shaking from time to time [her]72-almayer dishevelled grey locks , and muttering mournfully . " Hai ! "[132-mahmat] exclaimed [Mahmat]132-mahmat , who had lingered close by . " Look , [Tuan]103-babalatchi ; the logs came together so , "[1592-he] and here [he]1592-he pressed the palms of [his]1592-he hands together , " and [his]1592-he head must have been between them , and now there is no face for [you]132-mahmat to look at . There are [his]1592-he flesh and [his]1592-he bones , the nose , and the lips , and maybe [his]1592-he eyes , but [nobody]163-nobody could tell the one from the other . It was written the day [he]1592-he was born that [no man]2820-no man could look at [him]1592-he in death and be able to say , ' This is [[my]1592-he friend]2646-my friend 's face . ' "[1592-he] " Silence , [Mahmat]132-mahmat ; enough ! "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , " and take [thy]103-babalatchi eyes off [his]1592-he anklet , [thou]103-babalatchi eater of pigs flesh . [Tuan Almayer]84-tuan almayer , "[1592-he] [he]1592-he went on , lowering [his]1592-he voice , " have [you]84-tuan almayer seen [Dain]126-dain this morning ? "[1592-he] [Almayer]72-almayer opened [his]1593-his eyes wide and looked alarmed . " No , "[1593-his] [he]1593-his said quickly ; " have n't [you]84-tuan almayer seen [him]1592-he ? Is [he]1592-he not with [the Rajah]123-the rajah ? [I]1593-his am waiting ; why does [he]1592-he not come ? "[1593-his] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi nodded [his]103-babalatchi head sadly . " [He]1592-he is come , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . [He]1592-he left last night when the storm was great and [the river]170-the river spoke angrily . The night was very black , but [he]1592-he had within [him]1592-he a light that showed the way to [[your]103-babalatchi house]2623-your house as smooth as a narrow backwater , and the many logs no bigger than wisps of dried grass . Therefore [he]1592-he went ; and now [he]1592-he lies here . "[103-babalatchi] And [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi nodded [his]103-babalatchi head towards the body . " How can [you]103-babalatchi tell ? "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , excitedly , pushing [[his]103-babalatchi wife]327-his wife aside . [He]103-babalatchi snatched the cover off and looked at the formless mass of flesh , hair , and drying mud , where the face of [the drowned man]1573-the drowned man should have been . " [Nobody]163-nobody can tell , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi added , turning away with a shudder . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi was on [his]103-babalatchi knees wiping the mud from the stiffened fingers of the outstretched hand . [He]103-babalatchi rose to [his]103-babalatchi feet and flashed before [Almayer]72-almayer 's eyes a gold ring set with a large green stone . " [You]72-almayer know this well , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi said . " This never left [Dain]126-dain 's hand . [I]103-babalatchi had to tear the flesh now to get it off . Do [you]72-almayer believe now ? "[103-babalatchi] [Almayer]72-almayer raised [his]103-babalatchi hands to [his]103-babalatchi head and let them fall listlessly by [his]103-babalatchi side in the utter abandonment of despair . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , looking at [him]103-babalatchi curiously , was astonished to see [him]103-babalatchi smile . A strange fancy had taken possession of [Almayer]72-almayer 's brain , distracted by this new misfortune . It seemed to [him]103-babalatchi that for many years [he]103-babalatchi had been falling into a deep precipice . Day after day , month after month , year after year , [he]103-babalatchi had been falling , falling , falling ; it was a smooth , round , black thing , and the black walls had been rushing upwards with wearisome rapidity . A great rush , the noise of which [he]103-babalatchi fancied [he]103-babalatchi could hear yet ; and now , with an awful shock , [he]103-babalatchi had reached the bottom , and behold ! [he]103-babalatchi was alive and whole , and [Dain]126-dain was dead with all [his]126-dain bones broken . It struck [him]103-babalatchi as funny . [A dead Malay]1596-a dead malay ; [he]103-babalatchi had seen [many dead Malays]1597-many dead malays without any emotion ; and now [he]103-babalatchi felt inclined to weep , but it was over the fate of [a white man]242-a white man [he]103-babalatchi knew ; [a man that fell over a deep precipice and did not die]1599-a man that fell over a deep precipice and did not die . [He]242-a white man seemed somehow to [himself]242-a white man to be standing on one side , a little way off , looking at [a certain Almayer who was in great trouble]1600-a certain almayer who was in great trouble . [Poor , poor fellow]1601-poor , poor fellow ! Why does n't [he]242-a white man cut [his]242-a white man throat ? [He]103-babalatchi wished to encourage [him]242-a white man ; [he]103-babalatchi was very anxious to see [him]242-a white man lying dead over that other corpse . Why does [he]242-a white man not die and end this suffering ? [He]103-babalatchi groaned aloud unconsciously and started with affright at the sound of [his]103-babalatchi own voice . Was [he]103-babalatchi going mad ? Terrified by the thought [he]103-babalatchi turned away and ran towards [[his]103-babalatchi house]372-his house repeating to [himself]103-babalatchi , [I]0-i am not going mad ; of course not , no , no , no ! [He]103-babalatchi tried to keep a firm hold of the idea . Not mad , not mad . [He]103-babalatchi stumbled as [he]103-babalatchi ran blindly up the steps repeating fast and ever faster those words wherein seemed to lie [his]103-babalatchi salvation . [He]103-babalatchi saw [Nina]73-nina standing there , and wished to say something to [her]73-nina , but could not remember what , in [his]103-babalatchi extreme anxiety not to forget that [he]103-babalatchi was not going mad , which [he]103-babalatchi still kept repeating mentally as [he]103-babalatchi ran round the table , till [he]103-babalatchi stumbled against one of the arm - chairs and dropped into it exhausted . [He]103-babalatchi sat staring wildly at [Nina]73-nina , still assuring [himself]103-babalatchi mentally of [his]103-babalatchi own sanity and wondering why [the girl]402-the girl shrank from [him]103-babalatchi in open - eyed alarm . What was the matter with [her]73-nina ? This was foolish . [He]103-babalatchi struck the table violently with [his]103-babalatchi clenched fist and shouted hoarsely , " Give [me]103-babalatchi some gin ! Run ! "[103-babalatchi] Then , while [Nina]73-nina ran off , [he]103-babalatchi remained in the chair , very still and quiet , astonished at the noise [he]103-babalatchi had made . [Nina]73-nina returned with a tumbler half filled with gin , and found [[her]73-nina father]408-her father staring absently before [him]103-babalatchi . [Almayer]72-almayer felt very tired now , as if [he]103-babalatchi had come from a long journey . [He]103-babalatchi felt as if [he]103-babalatchi had walked miles and miles that morning and now wanted to rest very much . [He]103-babalatchi took the tumbler with a shaking hand , and as [he]103-babalatchi drank [his]103-babalatchi teeth chattered against the glass which [he]103-babalatchi drained and set down heavily on the table . [He]103-babalatchi turned [his]103-babalatchi eyes slowly towards [Nina]73-nina standing beside [him]103-babalatchi , and said steadily - " Now all is over , [Nina]73-nina . [He]408-her father is dead , and [I]103-babalatchi may as well burn all [my]103-babalatchi boats . "[103-babalatchi] [He]103-babalatchi felt very proud of being able to speak so calmly . Decidedly [he]103-babalatchi was not going mad . This certitude was very comforting , and [he]103-babalatchi went on talking about the finding of the body , listening to [his]103-babalatchi own voice complacently . [Nina]73-nina stood quietly , [her]73-nina hand resting lightly on [[her]73-nina father]408-her father 's shoulder , [her]73-nina face unmoved , but every line of [her]73-nina features , the attitude of [her]73-nina whole body expressing the most keen and anxious attention . " And so [Dain]126-dain is dead , "[73-nina] [she]73-nina said coldly , when [[her]73-nina father]408-her father ceased speaking . [Almayer]72-almayer 's elaborately calm demeanour gave way in a moment to an outburst of violent indignation . " [You]73-nina stand there as if [you]73-nina were only half alive , and talk to [me]103-babalatchi , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi exclaimed angrily , " as if it was a matter of no importance . Yes , [he]126-dain is dead ! Do [you]73-nina understand ? Dead ! What do [you]73-nina care ? [You]73-nina never cared ; [you]73-nina saw [me]103-babalatchi struggle , and work , and strive , unmoved ; and [my]103-babalatchi suffering [you]73-nina could never see . No , never . [You]73-nina have no heart , and [you]73-nina have no mind , or [you]73-nina would have understood that it was for [you]73-nina , for [your]73-nina happiness [I]103-babalatchi was working . [I]103-babalatchi wanted to be rich ; [I]103-babalatchi wanted to get away from here . [I]103-babalatchi wanted to see [white men]471-white men bowing low before the power of [your]73-nina beauty and [your]73-nina wealth . Old as [I]103-babalatchi am [I]103-babalatchi wished to seek [a strange land]2872-a strange land , a civilisation to which [I]103-babalatchi am [a stranger]2846-a stranger , so as to find a new life in the contemplation of [your]73-nina high fortunes , of [your]73-nina triumphs , of [your]73-nina happiness . For that [I]103-babalatchi bore patiently the burden of work , of disappointment , of humiliation amongst [these savages here]2874-these savages here , and [I]103-babalatchi had it all nearly in [my]103-babalatchi grasp . "[103-babalatchi] [He]1607-his looked at [[his]1607-his daughter]162-his daughter 's attentive face and jumped to [his]1607-his feet upsetting the chair . " Do [you]73-nina hear ? [I]1607-his had it all there ; so ; within reach of [my]1607-his hand . "[1607-his] [He]1607-his paused , trying to keep down [his]1607-his rising anger , and failed . " Have [you]73-nina no feeling ? "[1607-his] [he]1607-his went on . " Have [you]73-nina lived without hope ? "[1607-his] [Nina]73-nina 's silence exasperated [him]1607-his ; [his]1607-his voice rose , although [he]1607-his tried to master [his]1607-his feelings . " Are [you]73-nina content to live in this misery and die in this wretched hole ? Say something , [Nina]73-nina ; have [you]73-nina no sympathy ? Have [you]73-nina no word of comfort for [me]1607-his ? [I]1607-his that loved [you]73-nina so . "[1607-his] [He]1607-his waited for a while for an answer , and receiving none shook [his]1607-his fist in [[his]1607-his daughter]162-his daughter 's face . " [I]1607-his believe [you]73-nina are [an idiot]2875-an idiot ! "[1607-his] [he]1607-his yelled . [He]1607-his looked round for the chair , picked it up and sat down stiffly . [His]1607-his anger was dead within [him]1607-his , and [he]1607-his felt ashamed of [his]1607-his outburst , yet relieved to think that now [he]1607-his had laid clear before [[his]1607-his daughter]162-his daughter the inner meaning of [his]1607-his life . [He]1607-his thought so in perfect good faith , deceived by the emotional estimate of [his]1607-his motives , unable to see the crookedness of [his]1607-his ways , the unreality of [his]1607-his aims , the futility of [his]1607-his regrets . And now [his]1607-his heart was filled only with a great tenderness and love for [[his]1607-his daughter]162-his daughter . [He]1607-his wanted to see [her]162-his daughter miserable , and to share with [her]162-his daughter [his]1607-his despair ; but [he]1607-his wanted it only as all weak natures long for a companionship in misfortune with [beings innocent of its cause]1612-beings innocent of its cause . If [she]162-his daughter suffered [herself]162-his daughter [she]162-his daughter would understand and pity [him]1607-his ; but now [she]162-his daughter would not , or could not , find one word of comfort or love for [him]1607-his in [his]1607-his dire extremity . The sense of [his]1607-his absolute loneliness came home to [his]1607-his heart with a force that made [him]1607-his shudder . [He]1607-his swayed and fell forward with [his]1607-his face on the table , [his]1607-his arms stretched straight out , extended and rigid . [Nina]73-nina made a quick movement towards [[her]73-nina father]408-her father and stood looking at the grey head , on the broad shoulders shaken convulsively by the violence of feelings that found relief at last in sobs and tears . [Nina]73-nina sighed deeply and moved away from the table . [Her]73-nina features lost the appearance of stony indifference that had exasperated [[her]73-nina father]408-her father into [his]408-her father outburst of anger and sorrow . The expression of [her]73-nina face , now unseen by [[her]73-nina father]408-her father , underwent a rapid change . [She]73-nina had listened to [Almayer]72-almayer 's appeal for sympathy , for one word of comfort , apparently indifferent , yet with [her]73-nina breast torn by conflicting impulses raised unexpectedly by events [she]73-nina had not foreseen , or at least did not expect to happen so soon . With [her]73-nina heart deeply moved by the sight of [Almayer]72-almayer 's misery , knowing it in [her]73-nina power to end it with a word , longing to bring peace to that troubled heart , [she]73-nina heard with terror the voice of [her]73-nina overpowering love commanding [her]73-nina to be silent . And [she]73-nina submitted after a short and fierce struggle of [her]73-nina old self against the new principle of [her]73-nina life . [She]73-nina wrapped [herself]73-nina up in absolute silence , the only safeguard against some fatal admission . [She]73-nina could not trust [herself]73-nina to make a sign , to murmur a word for fear of saying too much ; and the very violence of the feelings that stirred the innermost recesses of [her]73-nina soul seemed to turn [[her]73-nina person]1207-her person into a stone . The dilated nostrils and the flashing eyes were the only signs of the storm raging within , and those signs of [[his]1617-his daughter]162-his daughter 's emotion [Almayer]72-almayer did not see , for [his]1617-his sight was dimmed by self- pity , by anger , and by despair . Had [Almayer]72-almayer looked at [[his]1617-his daughter]162-his daughter as [she]162-his daughter leant over the front rail of [the verandah]156-the verandah [he]1617-his could have seen the expression of indifference give way to a look of pain , and that again pass away , leaving the glorious beauty of [her]162-his daughter face marred by deep - drawn lines of watchful anxiety . The long grass in [the neglected courtyard]1621-the neglected courtyard stood very straight before [her]162-his daughter eyes in the noonday heat . From [the river - bank]1622-the river - bank there were voices and a shuffle of bare feet approaching [the house]169-the house ; [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi could be heard giving directions to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's men]1624-almayer 's men , and [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's subdued wailing became audible as the small procession bearing the body of [the drowned man]1573-the drowned man and headed by [that sorrowful matron]1626-that sorrowful matron turned the corner of [the house]169-the house . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi had taken the broken anklet off [the man]726-the man 's leg , and now held it in [his]103-babalatchi hand as [he]103-babalatchi moved by the side of [the bearers]1629-the bearers , while [Mahmat]132-mahmat lingered behind timidly , in the hopes of the promised reward . " Lay [him]726-the man there , "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's men]1624-almayer 's men , pointing to a pile of drying planks in front of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " Lay [him]726-the man there . [He]726-the man was [a Kaffir]2876-a kaffir and [the son of a dog]2877-the son of a dog , and [he]726-the man was [[the white man]512-the white man 's friend]2879-the white man 's friend . [He]726-the man drank [the white man]512-the white man 's strong water , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi added , with affected horror . " That [I]103-babalatchi have seen [myself]103-babalatchi . "[103-babalatchi] [The men]1044-the men stretched out the broken limbs on two planks [they]1044-the men had laid level , while [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer covered the body with a piece of white cotton cloth , and after whispering for some time with [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi departed to [her]72-almayer domestic duties . [[Almayer]72-almayer 's men]1624-almayer 's men , after laying down [their]1624-almayer 's men burden , dispersed [themselves]1624-almayer 's men in quest of shady spots wherein to idle the day away . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi was left alone by the corpse that laid rigid under the white cloth in the bright sunshine . [Nina]73-nina came down the steps and joined [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , who put [his]103-babalatchi hand to [his]103-babalatchi forehead , and squatted down with great deference . " [You]132-mahmat have a bangle there , "[73-nina] said [Nina]73-nina , looking down on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's upturned face and into [his]103-babalatchi solitary eye . " [I]1634-the polite statesman have , [Mem Putih]100-mem putih , "[1634-the polite statesman] returned [the polite statesman]1634-the polite statesman . Then turning towards [Mahmat]132-mahmat [he]132-mahmat beckoned [him]132-mahmat closer , calling out , " Come here ! "[132-mahmat] [Mahmat]132-mahmat approached with some hesitation . [He]132-mahmat avoided looking at [Nina]73-nina , but fixed [his]132-mahmat eyes on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . " Now , listen , "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , sharply . " The ring and the anklet [you]73-nina have seen , and [you]73-nina know they belonged to [[Dain]126-dain [the trader]2882-the trader]2881-dain the trader , and to [no other]2883-no other . [Dain]126-dain returned last night in [a canoe]2884-a canoe . [He]126-dain spoke with [the Rajah]123-the rajah , and in the middle of the night left to cross over to [[the white man]512-the white man 's house]529-the white man 's house . There was a great flood , and this morning [you]73-nina found [him]126-dain in [the river]170-the river . "[103-babalatchi] " By [his]126-dain feet [I]132-mahmat dragged [him]126-dain out , "[132-mahmat] muttered [Mahmat]132-mahmat under [his]132-mahmat breath . " [Tuan Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , there will be a recompense ! "[132-mahmat] [he]132-mahmat exclaimed aloud . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi held up the gold bangle before [Mahmat]132-mahmat 's eyes . " What [I]103-babalatchi have told [you]132-mahmat , [Mahmat]132-mahmat , is for all ears . What [I]103-babalatchi give [you]132-mahmat now is for [your]132-mahmat eyes only . Take . "[103-babalatchi] [Mahmat]132-mahmat took the bangle eagerly and hid it in the folds of [his]132-mahmat waist - cloth . " Am [I]132-mahmat a fool to show this thing in [a house]2888-a house with [three women]2889-three women in it ? "[132-mahmat] [he]132-mahmat growled . " But [I]132-mahmat shall tell [them]2889-three women about [Dain]126-dain [the trader]2882-the trader , and there will be talk enough . "[132-mahmat] [He]132-mahmat turned and went away , increasing [his]132-mahmat pace as soon as [he]132-mahmat was outside [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi looked after [him]132-mahmat till [he]132-mahmat disappeared behind the bushes . " Have [I]103-babalatchi done well , [Mem Putih]100-mem putih ? "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi asked , humbly addressing [Nina]73-nina . " [You]103-babalatchi have , "[73-nina] answered [Nina]73-nina . " The ring [you]103-babalatchi may keep [yourself]103-babalatchi . "[73-nina] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi touched [his]103-babalatchi lips and forehead , and scrambled to [his]103-babalatchi feet . [He]103-babalatchi looked at [Nina]73-nina , as if expecting [her]73-nina to say something more , but [Nina]73-nina turned towards [the house]169-the house and went up the steps , motioning [him]103-babalatchi away with [her]73-nina hand . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi picked up [his]103-babalatchi staff and prepared to go . It was very warm , and [he]103-babalatchi did not care for the long pull to [[the Rajah]656-the rajah 's house]1137-the rajah 's house . Yet [he]103-babalatchi must go and tell [the Rajah]123-the rajah - tell of the event ; of the change in [his]103-babalatchi plans ; of all [his]103-babalatchi suspicions . [He]103-babalatchi walked to [the jetty]2614-the jetty and began casting off the rattan painter of [[his]103-babalatchi canoe]1217-his canoe . [The broad expanse of the lower reach]1641-the broad expanse of the lower reach , with [its]1641-the broad expanse of the lower reach shimmering surface dotted by the black specks of [the fishing canoes]1642-the fishing canoes , lay before [his]103-babalatchi eyes . [The fishermen]1643-the fishermen seemed to be racing . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi paused in [his]103-babalatchi work , and looked on with sudden interest . [The man in the foremost canoe]1644-the man in the foremost canoe , now within hail of [the first houses of [Sambir]20-sambir]1645-the first houses of sambir , laid in [his]1644-the man in the foremost canoe paddle and stood up shouting - " [The boats]693-the boats ! [the boats]693-the boats ! [The man - of - war]864-the man - of - war 's boats are coming ! [They]693-the boats are here ! "[1644-the man in the foremost canoe] In a moment [the settlement]523-the settlement was again alive with [people]2652-people rushing to [the riverside]648-the riverside . [The men]1044-the men began to unfasten [[their]1044-the men boats]722-their boats , [the women]376-the women stood in groups looking towards [the bend down [the river]170-the river]1652-the bend down the river . Above the trees lining [the reach]1654-the reach a slight puff of smoke appeared like a black stain on the brilliant blue of the cloudless sky . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stood perplexed , [the painter]1655-the painter in [his]103-babalatchi hand . [He]103-babalatchi looked down [the reach]1654-the reach , then up towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house , and back again at [the river]170-the river as if undecided what to do . At last [he]103-babalatchi made [the canoe]338-the canoe fast again hastily , and ran towards [the house]169-the house and up the steps of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " [Tuan]103-babalatchi ! [Tuan]103-babalatchi ! "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi called , eagerly . " [The boats]693-the boats are coming . [The man - of- war]2895-the man - of- war 's boats . [You]73-nina had better get ready . [The officers]2896-the officers will come here , [I]103-babalatchi know . "[103-babalatchi] [Almayer]72-almayer lifted [his]103-babalatchi head slowly from the table , and looked at [him]103-babalatchi stupidly . " [Mem Putih]100-mem putih ! "[103-babalatchi] exclaimed [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi to [Nina]73-nina , " look at [him]103-babalatchi . [He]103-babalatchi does not hear . [You]73-nina must take care , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi added meaningly . [Nina]73-nina nodded to [him]103-babalatchi with an uncertain smile , and was going to speak , when a sharp report from the gun mounted in the bow of the steam launch that was just then coming into view arrested the words on [her]73-nina parted lips . The smile died out , and was replaced by the old look of anxious attention . From [the hills far away]1662-the hills far away the echo came back like a long - drawn and mournful sigh , as if [the land]1586-the land had sent it in answer to the voice of [its masters]1664-its masters . CHAPTER VIII . The news as to the identity of the body lying now in [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound spread rapidly over [the settlement]523-the settlement . During the forenoon [most of [the inhabitants]1105-the inhabitants]1667-most of the inhabitants remained in [the long street]1669-the long street discussing the mysterious return and the unexpected death of [the man who had become known to [them]1667-most of the inhabitants as [the trader]2882-the trader]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader . [His]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader arrival during [the north - east monsoon]1672-the north - east monsoon , [his]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader long sojourn in [their]1667-most of the inhabitants midst , [his]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader sudden departure with [[his]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader brig]1037-his brig , and , above all , the mysterious appearance of the body , said to be [his]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader , amongst the logs , were subjects to wonder at and to talk over and over again with undiminished interest . [Mahmat]132-mahmat moved from [house]486-house to [house]486-house and from [group]1676-group to [group]1676-group , always ready to repeat [his]132-mahmat tale : how [he]132-mahmat saw the body caught by the sarong in a forked log ; how [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer coming , one of the first , at [his]132-mahmat cries , recognised it , even before [he]132-mahmat had it hauled on [shore]1259-shore ; how [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ordered [him]132-mahmat to bring it out of the water . " By the feet [I]132-mahmat dragged [him]1670-the man who had become known to them as the trader in , and there was no head , "[132-mahmat] exclaimed [Mahmat]132-mahmat , " and how could [[the white man]512-the white man 's wife]817-the white man 's wife know who it was ? [She]817-the white man 's wife was [a witch]2899-a witch , it was well known . And did [you]2900-you see how [the white man]512-the white man [himself]512-the white man ran away at the sight of the body ? Like a deer [he]512-the white man ran ! "[132-mahmat] And here [Mahmat]132-mahmat imitated [Almayer]72-almayer 's long strides , to the great joy of [the beholders]1679-the beholders . And for all [his]132-mahmat trouble [he]132-mahmat had nothing . The ring with the green stone [Tuan Babalatchi]103-babalatchi kept . " Nothing ! Nothing ! "[132-mahmat] [He]132-mahmat spat down at [his]132-mahmat feet in sign of disgust , and left [that group to seek further on a fresh audience]1680-that group to seek further on a fresh audience . The news spreading to [the furthermost parts of [the settlement]523-the settlement]1681-the furthermost parts of the settlement found out [Abdulla]83-abdulla in the cool recess of [[his]83-abdulla godown]1683-his godown , where [he]83-abdulla sat overlooking [[his]83-abdulla Arab clerks]1684-his arab clerks and [the men]1044-the men loading and unloading the up - country canoes . [Reshid]119-taminah , who was busy on [the jetty]2614-the jetty , was summoned into [[his]119-taminah uncle]1687-his uncle 's presence and found [him]1687-his uncle , as usual , very calm and even cheerful , but very much surprised . The rumour of the capture or destruction of [[Dain]126-dain 's brig]1688-dain 's brig had reached [[the Arab]96-arab 's ears]1689-the arab 's ears three days before from [the sea - fishermen]1690-the sea - fishermen and through the dwellers on [the lower reaches of [the river]170-the river]1349-the lower reaches of the river . It had been passed up - stream from neighbour to neighbour till [Bulangi]102-bulangi , whose clearing was nearest to [the settlement]523-the settlement , had brought that news [himself]102-bulangi to [Abdulla]83-abdulla whose favour [he]102-bulangi courted . But rumour also spoke of a fight and of [Dain]126-dain 's death on board [[his]102-bulangi own vessel]1694-his own vessel . And now all [the settlement]523-the settlement talked of [Dain]126-dain 's visit to [the Rajah]123-the rajah and of [his]126-dain death when crossing [the river]170-the river in the dark to see [Almayer]72-almayer . [They]1697-they could not understand this . [Reshid]119-taminah thought that it was very strange . [He]119-taminah felt uneasy and doubtful . But [Abdulla]83-abdulla , after the first shock of surprise , with [the old age]1698-the old age 's dislike for solving riddles , showed a becoming resignation . [He]83-abdulla remarked that [the man]726-the man was dead now at all events , and consequently no more dangerous . Where was the use to wonder at the decrees of Fate , especially if [they]1700-they were propitious to [the True Believers]136-the true believers ? And with a pious ejaculation to [Allah the Merciful]110-allah , [the Compassionate]1701-the compassionate , [Abdulla]83-abdulla seemed to regard the incident as closed for the present . Not so [Reshid]119-taminah . [He]119-taminah lingered by [[his]119-taminah uncle]1687-his uncle , pulling thoughtfully [his]1687-his uncle neatly trimmed beard . " There are many lies , "[119-taminah] [he]119-taminah murmured . " [He]726-the man has been dead once before , and came to life to die again now . [The Dutch]124-the dutch will be here before many days and clamour for [the man]726-the man . Shall [I]119-taminah not believe [my]119-taminah eyes sooner than the tongues of [women]631-women and [idle men]2904-idle men ? "[119-taminah] " [They]1700-they say that the body is being taken to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound , "[83-abdulla] said [Abdulla]83-abdulla . " If [you]119-taminah want to go [there]2669-there [you]119-taminah must go before [the Dutch]124-the dutch arrive here . Go late . It should not be said that [we]2907-we have been seen inside [[that man]826-that man 's enclosure]2909-that man 's enclosure lately . "[83-abdulla] [Reshid]119-taminah assented to the truth of this last remark and left [[his]119-taminah uncle]1687-his uncle 's side . [He]119-taminah leaned against the lintel of the big doorway and looked idly across [the courtyard]988-the courtyard through the open gate on to [the main road of [the settlement]523-the settlement]1705-the main road of the settlement . [It]988-the courtyard lay empty , straight , and yellow under the flood of light . In the hot noontide the smooth trunks of palm trees , the outlines of [the houses]757-the houses , and away there at the other end of [the road]1082-the road the roof of [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house visible over the bushes on [the dark background of forest]1710-the dark background of forest , seemed to quiver in the heat radiating from the steaming earth . Swarms of yellow butterflies rose , and settled to rise again in short flights before [Reshid]119-taminah 's half - closed eyes . From under [his]119-taminah feet arose the dull hum of insects in the long grass of [the courtyard]988-the courtyard . [He]119-taminah looked on sleepily . From [one of the side paths amongst [the houses]757-the houses [a woman]613-a woman stepped out on [the road]1082-the road]1712-one of the side paths amongst the houses a woman stepped out on the road , [a slight girlish figure walking under the shade of a large tray balanced on its head]1716-a slight girlish figure walking under the shade of a large tray balanced on its head . The consciousness of something moving stirred [Reshid]119-taminah 's half - sleeping senses into a comparative wakefulness . [He]119-taminah recognised [Taminah]119-taminah , [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's slave - girl]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl , with [her]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl tray of cakes for sale - an apparition of daily recurrence and of no importance whatever . [She]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl was going towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house . [She]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl could be made useful . [He]119-taminah roused [himself]119-taminah up and ran towards the gate calling out , " [Taminah]119-taminah O ! "[119-taminah] [The girl]402-the girl stopped , hesitated , and came back slowly . [Reshid]119-taminah waited , signing to [her]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl impatiently to come nearer . When near [Reshid Taminah]119-taminah stood with downcast eyes . [Reshid]119-taminah looked at [her]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl a while before [he]119-taminah asked - " Are [you]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl going to [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house ? [They]2911-they say in [the settlement that [[Dain]126-dain [the trader]2882-the trader]2881-dain the trader , [he]2881-dain the trader that was found drowned this morning , is lying in [[the white man]512-the white man 's campong]2916-the white man 's campong]2912-the settlement that dain the trader , he that was found drowned this morning , is lying in the white man 's campong . "[119-taminah] " [I]119-taminah have heard this talk , "[119-taminah] whispered [Taminah]119-taminah ; " and this morning by [the riverside]648-the riverside [I]119-taminah saw the body . Where it is now [I]119-taminah do not know . "[119-taminah] " So [you]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl have seen [it]2918-it ? "[119-taminah] asked [Reshid]119-taminah , eagerly . " Is it [Dain]126-dain ? [You]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl have seen [him]126-dain many times . [You]1130-bulangi 's slave - girl would know [him]126-dain . "[402-the girl] [The girl]402-the girl 's lips quivered and [she]402-the girl remained silent for a while , breathing quickly . " [I]402-the girl have seen [him]126-dain , not a long time ago , "[402-the girl] [she]402-the girl said at last . " The talk is true ; [he]126-dain is dead . What do [you]119-taminah want from [me]402-the girl , [Tuan]126-dain ? [I]402-the girl must go . "[402-the girl] Just then the report of the gun fired on board [the steam launch]694-the steam launch was heard , interrupting [Reshid]119-taminah 's reply . Leaving [the girl]402-the girl [he]119-taminah ran to [the house]169-the house , and met in [the courtyard]988-the courtyard [Abdulla]83-abdulla coming towards the gate . " [The Orang Blanda]125-the orang blanda are come , "[119-taminah] said [Reshid]119-taminah , " and now [we]125-the orang blanda shall have [our]125-the orang blanda reward . "[119-taminah] [Abdulla]83-abdulla shook [his]83-abdulla head doubtfully . " [The white men]2919-the white men 's rewards are long in coming , "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla said . " [White men]471-white men are quick in anger and slow in gratitude . [We]125-the orang blanda shall see . "[83-abdulla] [He]83-abdulla stood at the gate stroking [his]83-abdulla grey beard and listening to the distant cries of greeting at [the other end of [the settlement]523-the settlement]1725-the other end of the settlement . As [Taminah]119-taminah was turning to go [he]83-abdulla called [her]1727-she back . " Listen , [girl]2714-girl , "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla said : " there will be [many white men in [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house]2922-many white men in almayer 's house . [You]2714-girl shall be there selling [your]2714-girl cakes to [the men of [the sea]171-the sea]2924-the men of the sea . What [you]2714-girl see and what [you]2714-girl hear [you]2714-girl may tell [me]83-abdulla . Come here before the sun sets and [I]83-abdulla will give [you]2714-girl a blue handkerchief with red spots . Now go , and forget not to return . "[83-abdulla] [He]83-abdulla gave [her]1727-she a push with the end of [his]83-abdulla long staff as [she]1727-she was going away and made [her]1727-she stumble . " [This slave]2926-this slave is very slow , "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla remarked to [[his]83-abdulla nephew]871-his nephew , looking after [the girl]402-the girl with great disfavour . [Taminah]119-taminah walked on , [her]1727-she tray on the head , [her]1727-she eyes fixed on the ground . From the open doors of [the houses]757-the houses were heard , as [she]1727-she passed , friendly calls inviting [her]1727-she within for business purposes , but [she]1727-she never heeded them , neglecting [her]1727-she sales in the preoccupation of intense thinking . Since the very early morning [she]1727-she had heard much , [she]1727-she had also seen much that filled [her]1727-she heart with a joy mingled with great suffering and fear . Before the dawn , before [she]1727-she left [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's house]1126-bulangi 's house to paddle up to [Sambir]20-sambir [she]1727-she had heard voices outside [the house]169-the house when all in [it]169-the house but [herself]1727-she were asleep . And now , with [her]1727-she knowledge of the words spoken in the darkness , [she]1727-she held in [her]1727-she hand a life and carried in [her]1727-she breast a great sorrow . Yet from [her]1727-she springy step , erect figure , and face veiled over by the everyday look of apathetic indifference , [nobody]163-nobody could have guessed of the double load [she]1727-she carried under the visible burden of the tray piled up high with cakes manufactured by the thrifty hands of [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's wives]1734-bulangi 's wives . In that supple figure straight as an arrow , so graceful and free in its walk , behind those soft eyes that spoke of nothing but of unconscious resignation , there slept all feelings and all passions , all hopes and all fears , the curse of life and the consolation of death . And [she]1727-she knew nothing of it all . [She]1727-she lived like the tall palms amongst whom [she]1727-she was passing now , seeking the light , desiring the sunshine , fearing the storm , unconscious of either . [The slave]998-the slave had no hope , and knew of no change . [She]1727-she knew of [no other sky]1736-no other sky , [no other water]1737-no other water , [no other forest]1738-no other forest , [no other world]1739-no other world , [no other life]1740-no other life . [She]1727-she had no wish , no hope , no love , no fear except of a blow , and no vivid feeling but that of occasional hunger , which was seldom , for [Bulangi]102-bulangi was rich and rice was plentiful in [the solitary house in [[his]102-bulangi clearing]1742-his clearing]1741-the solitary house in his clearing . The absence of pain and hunger was [her]1727-she happiness , and when [she]1727-she felt unhappy [she]1727-she was simply tired , more than usual , after the day 's labour . Then in the hot nights of the south - west monsoon [she]1727-she slept dreamlessly under the bright stars on the platform built outside [the house]169-the house and over [the river]170-the river . Inside [they]1745-they slept too : [Bulangi]102-bulangi by the door ; [[his]102-bulangi wives]1746-his wives further in ; [the children]1747-the children with [[their]1747-the children mothers]1748-their mothers . [She]1727-she could hear [their]1745-they breathing ; [Bulangi]102-bulangi 's sleepy voice ; the sharp cry of [a child soon hushed with tender words]1749-a child soon hushed with tender words . And [she]1727-she closed [her]1727-she eyes to the murmur of the water below [her]1727-she , to the whisper of the warm wind above , ignorant of the never - ceasing life of that tropical nature that spoke to [her]1727-she in vain with the thousand faint voices of [the near forest]1750-the near forest , with the breath of tepid wind ; in the heavy scents that lingered around [her]1727-she head ; in the white wraiths of morning mist that hung over [her]1727-she in the solemn hush of all creation before the dawn . Such had been [her]1727-she existence before the coming of the brig with [the strangers]1751-the strangers . [She]1727-she remembered well that time ; the uproar in [the settlement]523-the settlement , the never - ending wonder , the days and nights of talk and excitement . [She]1727-she remembered [her]1727-she own timidity with [the strange men]1753-the strange men , till [the brig moored to [the bank]331-the bank]1754-the brig moored to the bank became in a manner part of [the settlement]523-the settlement , and the fear wore off in the familiarity of constant intercourse . The call on board then became part of [her]1727-she daily round . [She]1727-she walked hesitatingly up the slanting planks of [the gangway]1757-the gangway amidst the encouraging shouts and more or less decent jokes of [the men]1044-the men idling over [the bulwarks]294-the bulwarks . There [she]1727-she sold [her]1727-she wares to [those men that spoke so loud and carried [themselves]1760-those men that spoke so loud and carried themselves so free so free]1760-those men that spoke so loud and carried themselves so free . There was [a throng , a constant coming and going]1761-a throng , a constant coming and going ; calls interchanged , orders given and executed with shouts ; the rattle of blocks , the flinging about of coils of rope . [She]1727-she sat out of the way under the shade of the awning , with [her]1727-she tray before [her]1727-she , the veil drawn well over [her]1727-she face , feeling shy amongst [so many men]1762-so many men . [She]1727-she smiled at all buyers , but spoke to [none]1763-none , letting [their]1763-none jests pass with stolid unconcern . [She]1727-she heard many tales told around [her]1727-she of [far - off countries]1764-far - off countries , of strange customs , of events stranger still . [Those men]223-those men were brave ; but [the most fearless of [them]223-those men]1766-the most fearless of them spoke of [[their]223-those men chief]1142-their chief with fear . Often [the man [they]223-those men called [[their]223-those men master]1054-their master]1768-the man they called their master passed before [her]1727-she , walking erect and indifferent , in the pride of youth , in the flash of rich dress , with a tinkle of gold ornaments , while [everybody]1337-everybody stood aside watching anxiously for a movement of [his]1768-the man they called their master lips , ready to do [his]1768-the man they called their master bidding . Then all [her]1727-she life seemed to rush into [her]1727-she eyes , and from under [her]1727-she veil [she]1727-she gazed at [him]1768-the man they called their master , charmed , yet fearful to attract attention . One day [he]1768-the man they called their master noticed [her]1727-she and asked , " Who is [that girl]554-that girl ? "[1768-the man they called their master] " [A slave]310-a slave , [Tuan]126-dain ! [A girl that sells cakes , "[1768-the man they called their master] a dozen voices]2929-a girl that sells cakes , " a dozen voices replied together . [She]1727-she rose in terror to run on [shore]1259-shore , when [he]1768-the man they called their master called [her]1727-she back ; and as [she]1727-she stood trembling with head hung down before [him]1768-the man they called their master , [he]1768-the man they called their master spoke kind words , lifting [her]1727-she chin with [his]1768-the man they called their master hand and looking into [her]1727-she eyes with a smile . " Do not be afraid , "[1768-the man they called their master] [he]1768-the man they called their master said . [He]1768-the man they called their master never spoke to [her]1727-she any more . [Somebody]1308-somebody called out from [the river bank]591-the river bank ; [he]1768-the man they called their master turned away and forgot [her]1727-she existence . [Taminah]119-taminah saw [Almayer]72-almayer standing on [the shore]2721-the shore with [Nina]73-nina on [his]1768-the man they called their master arm . [She]1727-she heard [Nina]73-nina 's voice calling out gaily , and saw [Dain]126-dain 's face brighten with joy as [he]126-dain leaped on [shore]1259-shore . [She]1727-she hated the sound of that voice ever since . After that day [she]1727-she left off visiting [[Almayer]72-almayer 's compound]1086-almayer 's compound , and passed the noon hours under the shade of [the brig awning]1777-the brig awning . [She]1727-she watched for [his]126-dain coming with heart beating quicker and quicker , as [he]126-dain approached , into a wild tumult of newly - aroused feelings of joy and hope and fear that died away with [Dain]126-dain 's retreating figure , leaving [her]1727-she tired out , as if after a struggle , sitting still for a long time in dreamy languor . Then [she]1727-she paddled [home]243-home slowly in the afternoon , often letting [[her]1727-she canoe]950-her canoe float with [the lazy stream]1780-the lazy stream in [the quiet backwater of [the river]170-the river]1781-the quiet backwater of the river . The paddle hung idle in the water as [she]1727-she sat in the stern , one hand supporting [her]1727-she chin , [her]1727-she eyes wide open , listening intently to the whispering of [her]1727-she heart that seemed to swell at last into a song of extreme sweetness . Listening to that song [she]1727-she husked the rice at [home]243-home ; it dulled [her]1727-she ears to the shrill bickerings of [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's wives]1734-bulangi 's wives , to the sound of angry reproaches addressed to [herself]1727-she . And when the sun was near its setting [she]1727-she walked to [the bathing - place]1785-the bathing - place and heard it as [she]1727-she stood on the tender grass of [the low bank]1786-the low bank , [her]1727-she robe at [her]1727-she feet , and looked at the reflection of [her]1727-she figure on the glass - like surface of [the creek]941-the creek . Listening to it [she]1727-she walked slowly back , [her]1727-she wet hair hanging over [her]1727-she shoulders ; laying down to rest under the bright stars , [she]1727-she closed [her]1727-she eyes to the murmur of the water below , of the warm wind above ; to the voice of nature speaking through the faint noises of [the great forest]2677-the great forest , and to the song of [her]1727-she own heart . [She]1727-she heard , but did not understand , and drank in the dreamy joy of [her]1727-she new existence without troubling about its meaning or its end , till the full consciousness of life came to [her]1727-she through pain and anger . And [she]1727-she suffered horribly the first time [she]1727-she saw [[Nina]73-nina 's long canoe]1789-nina 's long canoe drift silently past [the sleeping house of Bulangi]1790-the sleeping house of bulangi , bearing [the two lovers]1791-the two lovers into [the white mist of the great river]1792-the white mist of the great river . [Her]1727-she jealousy and rage culminated into a paroxysm of physical pain that left [her]1727-she lying panting on [the river bank]591-the river bank , in the dumb agony of a wounded animal . But [she]1727-she went on moving patiently in the enchanted circle of slavery , going through [her]1727-she task day after day with all the pathos of the grief [she]1727-she could not express , even to [herself]1727-she , locked within [her]1727-she breast . [She]1727-she shrank from [Nina]73-nina as [she]1727-she would have shrunk from the sharp blade of a knife cutting into [her]1727-she flesh , but [she]1727-she kept on visiting [the brig]288-the brig to feed [her]1727-she dumb , ignorant soul on [her]1727-she own despair . [She]1727-she saw [Dain]126-dain many times . [He]126-dain never spoke , [he]126-dain never looked . Could [his]126-dain eyes see only [one woman]1795-one woman 's image ? Could [his]126-dain ears hear only [one woman]1795-one woman 's voice ? [He]126-dain never noticed [her]1727-she ; not once . And then [he]126-dain went away . [She]1727-she saw [him]126-dain and [Nina]73-nina for the last time on that morning when [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , while visiting [[his]103-babalatchi fish baskets]1797-his fish baskets , had [his]103-babalatchi suspicions of [[the white man]512-the white man 's daughter]2813-the white man 's daughter 's love affair with [Dain]126-dain confirmed beyond the shadow of doubt . [Dain]126-dain disappeared , and [Taminah]119-taminah 's heart , where lay useless and barren the seeds of all love and of all hate , the possibilities of all passions and of all sacrifices , forgot its joys and its sufferings when deprived of the help of the senses . [Her]1727-she half - formed , savage mind , [the slave of [her]1727-she body]1800-the slave of her body - as [her]1727-she body was [the slave of another 's will]1801-the slave of another 's will - forgot the faint and vague image of the ideal that had found its beginning in the physical promptings of [her]1727-she savage nature . [She]1727-she dropped back into the torpor of [her]1727-she former life and found consolation - even a certain kind of happiness - in the thought that now [Nina]73-nina and [Dain]126-dain were separated , probably for ever . [He]126-dain would forget . This thought soothed the last pangs of dying jealousy that had nothing now to feed upon , and [Taminah]119-taminah found peace . It was like the dreary tranquillity of [a desert]1802-a desert , where there is peace only because there is no life . And now [he]126-dain had returned . [She]1727-she had recognised [his]126-dain voice calling aloud in the night for [Bulangi]102-bulangi . [She]1727-she had crept out after [[her]1727-she master]394-her master to listen closer to the intoxicating sound . [Dain]126-dain was there , in [a boat]2629-a boat , talking to [Bulangi]102-bulangi . [Taminah]119-taminah , listening with arrested breath , heard another voice . The maddening joy , that only a second before [she]1727-she thought [herself]1727-she incapable of containing within [her]1727-she fast - beating heart , died out , and left [her]1727-she shivering in the old anguish of physical pain that [she]1727-she had suffered once before at the sight of [Dain]126-dain and [Nina]73-nina . [Nina]73-nina spoke now , ordering and entreating in turns , and [Bulangi]102-bulangi was refusing , expostulating , at last consenting . [He]126-dain went in to take a paddle from the heap lying behind the door . Outside the murmur of two voices went on , and [she]1727-she caught a word here and there . [She]1727-she understood that [he]126-dain was fleeing from [white men]471-white men , that [he]126-dain was seeking a hiding - place , that [he]126-dain was in some danger . But [she]1727-she heard also words which woke the rage of jealousy that had been asleep for so many days in [her]1727-she bosom . Crouching low on the mud in the black darkness amongst the piles , [she]1727-she heard the whisper in [the boat]336-the boat that made light of toil , of privation , of danger , of life itself , if in exchange there could be but a short moment of close embrace , a look from the eyes , the feel of light breath , the touch of soft lips . So spoke [Dain]126-dain as [he]126-dain sat in [the canoe]338-the canoe holding [Nina]73-nina 's hands while waiting for [Bulangi]102-bulangi 's return ; and [Taminah]119-taminah , supporting [herself]119-taminah by the slimy pile , felt as if a heavy weight was crushing [her]1727-she down , down into the black oily water at [her]1727-she feet . [She]1727-she wanted to cry out ; to rush at [them]471-white men and tear [their]471-white men vague shadows apart ; to throw [Nina]73-nina into the smooth water , cling to [her]73-nina close , hold [her]73-nina to the bottom where [that man]826-that man could not find [her]73-nina . [She]1727-she could not cry , [she]1727-she could not move . Then footsteps were heard on the bamboo platform above [her]1727-she head ; [she]1727-she saw [Bulangi]102-bulangi get into [[his]102-bulangi smallest canoe]1809-his smallest canoe and take the lead , [the other boat following , paddled by [Dain]126-dain and [Nina]73-nina]1810-the other boat following , paddled by dain and nina . With a slight splash of the paddles dipped stealthily into [the water]351-the water , their indistinct forms passed before [her]1727-she aching eyes and vanished in the darkness of [the creek]941-the creek . [She]1727-she remained there in the cold and wet , powerless to move , breathing painfully under the crushing weight that the mysterious hand of [Fate]137-fate had laid so suddenly upon [her]1727-she slender shoulders , and shivering , [she]1727-she felt within a burning fire , that seemed to feed upon [her]1727-she very life . When the breaking day had spread a pale golden ribbon over the black outline of [the forests]705-the forests , [she]1727-she took up [her]1727-she tray and departed towards [the settlement]523-the settlement , going about [her]1727-she task purely from the force of habit . As [she]1727-she approached [Sambir]123-the rajah [she]1727-she could see the excitement and [she]1727-she heard with momentary surprise of the finding of [Dain]126-dain 's body . It was not true , of course . [She]1727-she knew it well . [She]1727-she regretted that [he]126-dain was not dead . [She]1727-she should have liked [Dain]126-dain to be dead , so as to be parted from [that woman]1815-that woman - from [all women]1816-all women . [She]1727-she felt a strong desire to see [Nina]73-nina , but without any clear object . [She]1727-she hated [her]1815-that woman , and feared [her]1815-that woman and [she]1727-she felt an irresistible impulse pushing [her]1727-she towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house to see [the white woman]1818-the white woman 's face , to look close at those eyes , to hear again that voice , for the sound of which [Dain]126-dain was ready to risk [his]126-dain liberty , [his]126-dain life even . [She]1727-she had seen [her]1815-that woman many times ; [she]1727-she had heard [her]1815-that woman voice daily for many months past . What was there in [her]1727-she ? What was there in that being to make [a man]340-a man speak as [Dain]126-dain had spoken , to make [him]126-dain blind to all other faces , deaf to all other voices ? [She]1727-she left [the crowd]1530-the crowd by [the riverside]648-the riverside , and wandered aimlessly among [the empty houses]1822-the empty houses , resisting the impulse that pushed [her]1727-she towards [Almayer]72-almayer 's campong to seek there in [Nina]73-nina 's eyes the secret of [her]1727-she own misery . The sun mounting higher , shortened the shadows and poured down upon [her]1727-she a flood of light and of stifling heat as [she]1727-she passed on from shadow to light , from light to shadow , amongst [the houses]757-the houses , the bushes , the tall trees , in [her]1727-she unconscious flight from the pain in [her]1727-she own heart . In the extremity of [her]1727-she distress [she]1727-she could find no words to pray for relief , [she]1727-she knew of no heaven to send [her]1727-she prayer to , and [she]1727-she wandered on with tired feet in the dumb surprise and terror at the injustice of the suffering inflicted upon [her]1727-she without cause and without redress . The short talk with [Reshid]119-taminah , the proposal of [Abdulla]83-abdulla steadied [her]1727-she a little and turned [her]1727-she thoughts into another channel . [Dain]126-dain was in some danger . [He]126-dain was hiding from [white men]471-white men . So much [she]1727-she had overheard last night . [They]471-white men all thought [him]126-dain dead . [She]1727-she knew [he]126-dain was alive , and [she]1727-she knew of [his]126-dain hiding- place . What did [the Arabs]503-the arabs want to know about [the white men]2919-the white men ? [The white men]2919-the white men want with [Dain]126-dain ? Did [they]2919-the white men wish to kill [him]126-dain ? [She]1727-she could tell [them]471-white men all - no , [she]1727-she would say nothing , and in the night [she]1727-she would go to [him]126-dain and sell [him]126-dain [his]126-dain life for a word , for a smile , for a gesture even , and be [[his]126-dain slave]473-his slave in [far - off countries]1764-far - off countries , away from [Nina]73-nina . But there were dangers . [The one - eyed Babalatchi who knew everything]1830-the one - eyed babalatchi who knew everything ; [[the white man]512-the white man 's wife]817-the white man 's wife - [she]817-the white man 's wife was [a witch]2899-a witch . Perhaps [they]471-white men would tell . And then there was [Nina]73-nina . [She]1727-she must hurry on and see . In [her]1727-she impatience [she]1727-she left [the path]1223-the path and ran towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's dwelling]1835-almayer 's dwelling through the undergrowth between the palm trees . [She]1727-she came out at the back of [the house]169-the house , where [a narrow ditch , full of stagnant water that overflowed from [the river]170-the river]1837-a narrow ditch , full of stagnant water that overflowed from the river , separated [[Almayer]72-almayer 's campong]777-almayer 's campong from [the rest of [the settlement]523-the settlement]1840-the rest of the settlement . The thick bushes growing on the bank were hiding from [her]1727-she sight [the large courtyard with [its]1842-the large courtyard with its cooking shed cooking shed]1842-the large courtyard with its cooking shed . Above [them]471-white men rose several thin columns of smoke , and from behind the sound of strange voices informed [Taminah]119-taminah that [the Men of the Sea belonging to [the warship]1844-the warship]1843-the men of the sea belonging to the warship had already landed and were camped between [the ditch]1845-the ditch and [the house]169-the house . To the left [one of [[Almayer]72-almayer 's slave - girls]1848-almayer 's slave - girls]1847-one of almayer 's slave - girls came down to the ditch and bent over the shiny water , washing a kettle . To the right the tops of [the banana plantation]990-the banana plantation , visible above the bushes , swayed and shook under the touch of invisible hands gathering the fruit . On the calm water [several canoes moored to a heavy stake]1850-several canoes moored to a heavy stake were crowded together , nearly bridging the ditch just at [the place where [Taminah]119-taminah stood]1851-the place where taminah stood . The voices in [the courtyard]988-the courtyard rose at times into an outburst of calls , replies , and laughter , and then died away into a silence that soon was broken again by a fresh clamour . Now and again the thin blue smoke rushed out thicker and blacker , and drove in odorous masses over [the creek]941-the creek , wrapping [her]1727-she for a moment in a suffocating veil ; then , as the fresh wood caught well alight , the smoke vanished in the bright sunlight , and only the scent of aromatic wood drifted afar , to leeward of the crackling fires . [Taminah]119-taminah rested [her]1727-she tray on a stump of a tree , and remained standing with [her]1727-she eyes turned towards [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house , whose roof and part of a whitewashed wall were visible over the bushes . [The slave - girl]1133-the slave - girl finished [her]1133-the slave - girl work , and after looking for a while curiously at [Taminah]119-taminah , pushed [her]1133-the slave - girl way through the dense thicket back to [the courtyard]988-the courtyard . Round [Taminah]119-taminah there was now a complete solitude . [She]1727-she threw [herself]1727-she down on the ground , and hid [her]1727-she face in [her]1727-she hands . Now when so close [she]1727-she had no courage to see [Nina]73-nina . At every burst of louder voices from [the courtyard]988-the courtyard [she]1727-she shivered in the fear of hearing [Nina]73-nina 's voice . [She]1727-she came to the resolution of waiting where [she]1727-she was till dark , and then going straight to [[Dain]126-dain 's hiding - place]1858-dain 's hiding - place . From where [she]1727-she was [she]1727-she could watch the movements of [white men]471-white men , of [Nina]73-nina , of all [[Dain]126-dain 's friends]1860-dain 's friends , and of [all [his]126-dain enemies]1861-all his enemies . Both were hateful alike to [her]1727-she , for both would take [him]126-dain away beyond [her]1727-she reach . [She]1727-she hid [herself]1727-she in the long grass to wait anxiously for the sunset that seemed so slow to come . On the other side of [the ditch]1845-the ditch , behind the bush , by the clear fires , [the seamen of [the frigate]690-the frigate]1863-the seamen of the frigate had encamped on the hospitable invitation of [Almayer]72-almayer . [Almayer]72-almayer , roused out of [his]126-dain apathy by the prayers and importunity of [Nina]73-nina , had managed to get down in time to [the jetty]2614-the jetty so as to receive [the officers]2896-the officers at [[their]2896-the officers landing]1867-their landing . [The lieutenant in command]1868-the lieutenant in command accepted [his]1868-the lieutenant in command invitation to [[his]1868-the lieutenant in command house]372-his house with the remark that in any case [their]2896-the officers business was with [Almayer]72-almayer - and perhaps not very pleasant , [he]1868-the lieutenant in command added . [Almayer]72-almayer hardly heard [him]1868-the lieutenant in command . [He]126-dain shook hands with [them]2896-the officers absently and led the way towards [the house]169-the house . [He]126-dain was scarcely conscious of the polite words of welcome [he]126-dain greeted [the strangers]1751-the strangers with , and afterwards repeated several times over again in [his]126-dain efforts to appear at ease . The agitation of [[their]2896-the officers host]716-their host did not escape [the officer]1873-the officer 's eyes , and [the chief]1874-the chief confided to [[his]1874-the chief subordinate]1875-his subordinate , in a low voice , [his]1874-the chief doubts as to [Almayer]72-almayer 's sobriety . [The young sub - lieutenant]1876-the young sub - lieutenant laughed and expressed in a whisper the hope that [the white man]512-the white man was not intoxicated enough to neglect the offer of some refreshments . " [He]512-the white man does not seem very dangerous , "[1876-the young sub - lieutenant] [he]1876-the young sub - lieutenant added , as [they]2896-the officers followed [Almayer]72-almayer up the steps of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " No , [he]512-the white man seems more of [a fool]2832-a fool than [a knave]2931-a knave ; [I]1879-the senior have heard of [him]512-the white man , "[1879-the senior] returned [the senior]1879-the senior . [They]2896-the officers sat around the table . [Almayer]72-almayer with shaking hands made gin cocktails , offered them all round , and drank [himself]72-almayer , with every gulp feeling stronger , steadier , and better able to face all the difficulties of [his]512-the white man position . Ignorant of the fate of [the brig]288-the brig [he]512-the white man did not suspect the real object of [the officer]1873-the officer 's visit . [He]512-the white man had a general notion that something must have leaked out about the gunpowder trade , but apprehended nothing beyond some temporary inconveniences . After emptying [his]512-the white man glass [he]512-the white man began to chat easily , lying back in [his]512-the white man chair with one of [his]512-the white man legs thrown negligently over the arm . [The lieutenant]1882-the lieutenant astride on [his]1882-the lieutenant chair , a glowing cheroot in the corner of [his]1882-the lieutenant mouth , listened with a sly smile from behind the thick volumes of smoke that escaped from [his]1882-the lieutenant compressed lips . [The young sub - lieutenant]1876-the young sub - lieutenant , leaning with both elbows on the table , [his]512-the white man head between [his]512-the white man hands , looked on sleepily in the torpor induced by fatigue and the gin . [Almayer]72-almayer talked on - " It is a great pleasure to see white faces here . [I]1884-i have lived [here]2634-here many years in great solitude . [The Malays]86-malays , [you]1876-the young sub - lieutenant understand , are not company for [a white man]242-a white man ; moreover [they]86-malays are not friendly ; [they]86-malays do not understand [our]2934-our ways . [Great rascals]2935-great rascals [they]86-malays are . [I]1884-i believe [I]1884-i am [the only white man on [the east coast]1251-the east coast]2936-the only white man on the east coast that is [a settled resident]2938-a settled resident . [We]2934-our get [visitors]2939-visitors from [Macassar]75-macassar or [Singapore]24-singapore sometimes - [traders]2940-traders , [agents]675-agents , or [explorers]2942-explorers , but [they]2939-visitors are rare . There was [a scientific explorer]2943-a scientific explorer [here]2634-here a year or more ago . [He]2943-a scientific explorer lived in [[my]1884-i house]2945-my house : drank from morning to night . [He]2943-a scientific explorer lived joyously for a few months , and when the liquor [he]2943-a scientific explorer brought with [him]2943-a scientific explorer was gone [he]2943-a scientific explorer returned to [Batavia]21-batavia with a report on the mineral wealth of the interior . Ha , ha , ha ! Good , is it not ? "[1884-i] [He]1884-i ceased abruptly and looked at [[his]1884-i guests]720-his guests with a meaningless stare . While [they]720-his guests laughed [he]1884-i was reciting to [himself]1884-i the old story : " [Dain]126-dain dead , all [my]1884-i plans destroyed . This is the end of all hope and of all things . "[1884-i] [His]1884-i heart sank within [him]1884-i . [He]1884-i felt a kind of deadly sickness . " Very good . Capital ! "[1886-both officers] exclaimed [both officers]1886-both officers . [Almayer]72-almayer came out of [his]1884-i despondency with another burst of talk . " Eh ! what about the dinner ? [You]72-almayer have got [a cook]2946-a cook with [you]72-almayer . That 's all right . There is [a cooking shed in [the other courtyard]2948-the other courtyard]2947-a cooking shed in the other courtyard . [I]72-almayer can give [you]72-almayer a goose . Look at [my]72-almayer geese - the only geese on [the east coast]1251-the east coast - perhaps on [the whole island]2950-the whole island . Is that [[your]72-almayer cook]2951-your cook ? Very good . Here , [Ali]95-ali , show [this Chinaman]2952-this chinaman [the cooking place]2953-the cooking place and tell [Mem Almayer]138-mem almayer to let [him]2952-this chinaman have room [there]2669-there . [[My]72-almayer wife]2663-my wife , [gentlemen]2956-gentlemen , does not come out ; [[my]72-almayer daughter]2594-my daughter may . Meantime have some more drink . It is a hot day . "[72-almayer] [The lieutenant]1882-the lieutenant took the cigar out of [his]1882-the lieutenant mouth , looked at the ash critically , shook it off and turned towards [Almayer]72-almayer . " [We]2958-we have a rather unpleasant business with [you]72-almayer , "[1882-the lieutenant] [he]1882-the lieutenant said . " [I]1882-the lieutenant am sorry , "[1882-the lieutenant] returned [Almayer]72-almayer . " It can be nothing very serious , surely . "[1882-the lieutenant] " If [you]72-almayer think an attempt to blow up [forty men]2959-forty men at least , not a serious matter [you]72-almayer will not find many people of [your]72-almayer opinion , "[1873-the officer] retorted [the officer]1873-the officer sharply . " Blow up ! What ? [I]72-almayer know nothing about it , "[72-almayer] exclaimed [Almayer]72-almayer . " Who did that , or tried to do it ? "[72-almayer] " [A man with whom [you]72-almayer had some dealings]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings , "[1882-the lieutenant] answered [the lieutenant]1882-the lieutenant . " [He]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings passed [here]2634-here under the name of [Dain Maroola]74-dain . [You]72-almayer sold [him]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings the gunpowder [he]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings had in [that brig [we]2963-we captured]2962-that brig we captured . "[1882-the lieutenant] " How did [you]72-almayer hear about [the brig]288-the brig ? "[72-almayer] asked [Almayer]72-almayer . " [I]72-almayer know nothing about the powder [he]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings may have had . "[72-almayer] " [An Arab trader of [this place]2648-this place]2965-an arab trader of this place has sent the information about [your]72-almayer goings on here to [Batavia]21-batavia , a couple of months ago , "[1873-the officer] said [the officer]1873-the officer . " [We]2963-we were waiting for [the brig]288-the brig outside , but [he]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings slipped past [us]2963-we at [the mouth of [the river]170-the river]691-the mouth of the river , and [we]2963-we had to chase [the fellow]2836-the fellow to the southward . When [he]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings sighted [us]2963-we [he]2960-a man with whom you had some dealings ran inside [the reefs]2799-the reefs and put [the brig ashore]2972-the brig ashore . [The crew]239-the crew escaped in [boats]736-boats before [we]2963-we could take possession . As [[our]2963-we boats]2975-our boats neared [the craft]238-the craft [it]238-the craft blew up with a tremendous explosion ; one of the boats being too near got swamped . [Two men]348-two men drowned - that is the result of [your]2978-you speculation , [Mr. Almayer]139-mr. almayer . Now [we]2963-we want [this Dain]2638-this dain . [We]2963-we have good grounds to suppose [he]2638-this dain is hiding in [Sambir]20-sambir . Do [you]2978-you know where [he]2638-this dain is ? [You]2978-you had better put [yourself]2978-you right with [the authorities]2980-the authorities as much as possible by being perfectly frank with [me]1873-the officer . Where is [this Dain]74-dain ? "[1873-the officer] [Almayer]72-almayer got up and walked towards the balustrade of [the verandah]156-the verandah . [He]1892-he seemed not to be thinking of [the officer]1873-the officer 's question . [He]1892-he looked at the body laying straight and rigid under its white cover on which the sun , declining amongst the clouds to the westward , threw a pale tinge of red . [The lieutenant]1882-the lieutenant waited for the answer , taking quick pulls at [his]1882-the lieutenant half - extinguished cigar . Behind [them]1895-them [Ali]95-ali moved noiselessly laying the table , ranging solemnly the ill - assorted and shabby crockery , the tin spoons , the forks with broken prongs , and the knives with saw - like blades and loose handles . [He]95-ali had almost forgotten how to prepare the table for [white men]471-white men . [He]95-ali felt aggrieved ; [Mem Nina]73-nina would not help [him]95-ali . [He]95-ali stepped back to look at [his]95-ali work admiringly , feeling very proud . This must be right ; and if [the master afterwards]1897-the master afterwards is angry and swears , then so much the worse for [Mem Nina]73-nina . Why did [she]73-nina not help ? [He]95-ali left [the verandah]156-the verandah to fetch the dinner .
