At [his]571-her husband feet lay the overturned table , amongst a wreck of crockery and broken bottles . The appearance as of traces left by a desperate struggle was accentuated by the chairs , which seemed to have been scattered violently all over [the place]193-the place , and now lay about [the verandah]156-the verandah with a lamentable aspect of inebriety in [their]2191-their helpless attitudes . Only [Nina]73-nina 's big rocking- chair , standing black and motionless on its high runners , towered above the chaos of demoralised furniture , unflinchingly dignified and patient , waiting for its burden . With a last scornful look towards [the sleeper]2192-the sleeper , [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer passed behind the curtain into [[her]72-almayer own room]2193-her own room . A couple of bats , encouraged by the darkness and the peaceful state of affairs , resumed their silent and oblique gambols above [Almayer]72-almayer 's head , and for a long time the profound quiet of [the house]169-the house was unbroken , save for the deep breathing of [the sleeping man]2195-the sleeping man and the faint tinkle of silver in the hands of [the woman]2854-the woman preparing for flight . In the increasing light of the moon that had risen now above the night mist , the objects on [the verandah]156-the verandah came out strongly outlined in black splashes of shadow with all the uncompromising ugliness of [their]2191-their disorder , and a caricature of the sleeping [Almayer]72-almayer appeared on the dirty whitewash of the wall behind [him]571-her husband in a grotesquely exaggerated detail of attitude and feature enlarged to a heroic size . The discontented bats departed in quest of darker places , and a lizard came out in short , nervous rushes , and , pleased with the white table - cloth , stopped on it in breathless immobility that would have suggested sudden death had it not been for the melodious call [he]571-her husband exchanged with [a less adventurous friend]2198-a less adventurous friend hiding amongst the lumber in [the courtyard]988-the courtyard . Then the boards in [the passage]1004-the passage creaked , the lizard vanished , and [Almayer]72-almayer stirred uneasily with a sigh : slowly , out of the senseless annihilation of drunken sleep , [he]571-her husband was returning , through [the land of dreams]2201-the land of dreams , to waking consciousness . [Almayer]72-almayer 's head rolled from shoulder to shoulder in the oppression of [his]571-her husband dream ; the heavens had descended upon [him]571-her husband like a heavy mantle , and trailed in starred folds far under [him]571-her husband . Stars above , stars all round [him]571-her husband ; and from the stars under [his]571-her husband feet rose a whisper full of entreaties and tears , and sorrowful faces flitted amongst the clusters of light filling the infinite space below . How escape from the importunity of lamentable cries and from the look of staring , sad eyes in the faces which pressed round [him]571-her husband till [he]571-her husband gasped for breath under the crushing weight of worlds that hung over [his]571-her husband aching shoulders ? Get away ! But how ? If [he]571-her husband attempted to move [he]571-her husband would step off into nothing , and perish in the crashing fall of that universe of which [he]571-her husband was the only support . And what were the voices saying ? Urging [him]571-her husband to move ! Why ? Move to destruction ! Not likely ! The absurdity of the thing filled [him]571-her husband with indignation . [He]571-her husband got a firmer foothold and stiffened [his]571-her husband muscles in heroic resolve to carry [his]571-her husband burden to all eternity . And ages passed in the superhuman labour , amidst the rush of circling worlds ; in the plaintive murmur of sorrowful voices urging [him]571-her husband to desist before it was too late - till the mysterious power that had laid upon [him]571-her husband the giant task seemed at last to seek [his]571-her husband destruction . With terror [he]571-her husband felt an irresistible hand shaking [him]571-her husband by the shoulder , while the chorus of voices swelled louder into an agonised prayer to go , go before it is too late . [He]571-her husband felt [himself]571-her husband slipping , losing [his]571-her husband balance , as something dragged at [his]571-her husband legs , and [he]571-her husband fell . With a faint cry [he]571-her husband glided out of the anguish of perishing creation into an imperfect waking that seemed to be still under the spell of [his]571-her husband dream . " What ? What ? "[571-her husband] [he]571-her husband murmured sleepily , without moving or opening [his]571-her husband eyes . [His]571-her husband head still felt heavy , and [he]571-her husband had not the courage to raise [his]571-her husband eyelids . In [his]571-her husband ears there still lingered the sound of entreating whisper . - " Am [I]571-her husband awake ? - Why do [I]571-her husband hear the voices ? "[571-her husband] [he]571-her husband argued to [himself]571-her husband , hazily . - " [I]571-her husband can not get rid of the horrible nightmare yet . - [I]571-her husband have been very drunk . - What is that shaking [me]571-her husband ? [I]571-her husband am dreaming yet - [I]571-her husband must open [my]571-her husband eyes and be done with it . [I]571-her husband am only half awake , it is evident . "[571-her husband] [He]571-her husband made an effort to shake off [his]571-her husband stupor and saw a face close to [his]571-her husband , glaring at [him]571-her husband with staring eyeballs . [He]571-her husband closed [his]571-her husband eyes again in amazed horror and sat up straight in the chair , trembling in every limb . What was [this apparition]2202-this apparition ? - [His]571-her husband own fancy , no doubt . - [His]571-her husband nerves had been much tried the day before - and then the drink ! [He]571-her husband would not see it again if [he]571-her husband had the courage to look . - [He]571-her husband would look directly . - Get a little steadier first . - So . - Now . [He]571-her husband looked . The figure of [a woman standing in the steely light]2203-a woman standing in the steely light , [her]2203-a woman standing in the steely light hands stretched forth in a suppliant gesture , confronted [him]571-her husband from the far - off end of [the verandah]156-the verandah ; and in the space between [him]571-her husband and [the obstinate phantom]2205-the obstinate phantom floated the murmur of words that fell on [his]571-her husband ears in a jumble of torturing sentences , the meaning of which escaped the utmost efforts of [his]571-her husband brain . Who spoke the Malay words ? Who ran away ? Why too late - and too late for what ? What meant those words of hate and love mixed so strangely together , the ever - recurring names falling on [his]571-her husband ears again and again - [Nina]73-nina , [Dain]74-dain ; [Dain]74-dain , [Nina]73-nina ? [Dain]74-dain was dead , and [Nina]73-nina was sleeping , unaware of the terrible experience through which [he]571-her husband was now passing . Was [he]571-her husband going to be tormented for ever , sleeping or waking , and have no peace either night or day ? What was the meaning of this ? [He]571-her husband shouted the last words aloud . [The shadowy woman]2206-the shadowy woman seemed to shrink and recede a little from [him]571-her husband towards the doorway , and there was a shriek . Exasperated by the incomprehensible nature of [his]571-her husband torment , [Almayer]72-almayer made a rush upon the apparition , which eluded [his]571-her husband grasp , and [he]571-her husband brought up heavily against the wall . Quick as lightning [he]571-her husband turned round and pursued fiercely the mysterious figure fleeing from [him]571-her husband with piercing shrieks that were like fuel to the flames of [his]571-her husband anger . Over the furniture , round the overturned table , and now [he]571-her husband had it cornered behind [Nina]73-nina 's chair . To the left , to the right [they]2207-they dodged , the chair rocking madly between [them]2207-they , [she]2206-the shadowy woman sending out shriek after shriek at every feint , and [he]571-her husband growling meaningless curses through [his]571-her husband hard set teeth . " Oh ! the fiendish noise that split [his]571-her husband head and seemed to choke [his]571-her husband breath . - It would kill [him]571-her husband . - It must be stopped ! "[571-her husband] An insane desire to crush that yelling thing induced [him]571-her husband to cast [himself]571-her husband recklessly over the chair with a desperate grab , and [they]2207-they came down together in a cloud of dust amongst the splintered wood . The last shriek died out under [him]571-her husband in a faint gurgle , and [he]571-her husband had secured the relief of absolute silence . [He]571-her husband looked at [the woman]2854-the woman 's face under [him]571-her husband . [A real woman]2209-a real woman ! [He]571-her husband knew [her]2854-the woman . By all that is wonderful ! [Taminah]119-taminah ! [He]571-her husband jumped up ashamed of [his]571-her husband fury and stood perplexed , wiping [his]571-her husband forehead . [The girl]402-the girl struggled to a kneeling posture and embraced [his]571-her husband legs in a frenzied prayer for mercy . " Do n't be afraid , "[571-her husband] [he]571-her husband said , raising [her]402-the girl . " [I]571-her husband shall not hurt [you]402-the girl . Why do [you]402-the girl come to [[my]571-her husband house]2945-my house in the night ? And if [you]402-the girl had to come , why not go behind the curtain where [the women]376-the women sleep ? "[571-her husband] " The place behind the curtain is empty , "[119-taminah] gasped [Taminah]119-taminah , catching [her]402-the girl breath between the words . " There are [no women]3236-no women in [[your]571-her husband house]2623-your house any more , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . [I]119-taminah saw [the old Mem]3238-the old mem go away before [I]119-taminah tried to wake [you]571-her husband . [I]119-taminah did not want [[your]571-her husband women]2858-your women , [I]119-taminah wanted [you]571-her husband . "[119-taminah] " [Old Mem]146-old mem ! "[72-almayer] repeated [Almayer]72-almayer . " Do [you]402-the girl mean [[my]72-almayer wife]2663-my wife ? "[72-almayer] [She]402-the girl nodded [her]402-the girl head . " But of [[my]72-almayer daughter]2594-my daughter [you]402-the girl are not afraid ? "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer . " Have [you]402-the girl not heard [me]402-the girl ? "[402-the girl] [she]402-the girl exclaimed . " Have [I]402-the girl not spoken for a long time when [you]119-taminah lay there with eyes half open ? [She]2594-my daughter is gone too . "[402-the girl] " [I]402-the girl was asleep . Can [you]402-the girl not tell when [a man]340-a man is sleeping and when awake ? "[402-the girl] " Sometimes , "[119-taminah] answered [Taminah]119-taminah in a low voice ; ' sometimes the spirit lingers close to a sleeping body and may hear . [I]0-i spoke a long time before [I]0-i touched [you]119-taminah , and [I]0-i spoke softly for fear it would depart at a sudden noise and leave [you]119-taminah sleeping for ever . [I]0-i took [you]119-taminah by the shoulder only when [you]119-taminah began to mutter words [I]0-i could not understand . Have [you]119-taminah not heard , then , and do [you]119-taminah know nothing ? " "[119-taminah] Nothing of what [you]119-taminah said . What is it ? Tell again if [you]119-taminah want [me]0-i to know . " [He]119-taminah took [her]3243-her by the shoulder and led [her]3243-her unresisting to the front of [the verandah]156-the verandah into a stronger light . [She]3243-her wrung [her]3243-her hands with such an appearance of grief that [he]119-taminah began to be alarmed . "[119-taminah] Speak , " [he]119-taminah said . "[119-taminah] [You]119-taminah made noise enough to wake [even dead men]2211-even dead men . And yet [nobody living]2212-nobody living came , " [he]119-taminah added to [himself]119-taminah in an uneasy whisper . "[2212-nobody living] Are [you]119-taminah mute ? Speak ! " [he]119-taminah repeated . In a rush of words which broke out after a short struggle from [her]3243-her trembling lips [she]3243-her told [him]119-taminah the tale of [Nina]73-nina 's love and [her]3243-her own jealousy . Several times [he]119-taminah looked angrily into [her]3243-her face and told [her]3243-her to be silent ; but [he]119-taminah could not stop the sounds that seemed to [him]119-taminah to run out in a hot stream , swirl about [his]119-taminah feet , and rise in scalding waves about [him]119-taminah , higher , higher , drowning [his]119-taminah heart , touching [his]119-taminah lips with a feel of molten lead , blotting out [his]119-taminah sight in scorching vapour , closing over [his]119-taminah head , merciless and deadly . When [she]3243-her spoke of the deception as to [Dain]74-dain 's death of which [he]119-taminah had been [the victim]3245-the victim only that day , [he]119-taminah glanced again at [her]3243-her with terrible eyes , and made [her]3243-her falter for a second , but [he]119-taminah turned away directly , and [his]119-taminah face suddenly lost all expression in a stony stare far away over [the river]170-the river . Ah ! [the river]170-the river ! [[His]119-taminah old friend]3248-his old friend and [[his]119-taminah old enemy]933-his old enemy , speaking always with the same voice as [he]119-taminah runs from year to year bringing fortune or disappointment happiness or pain , upon the same varying but unchanged surface of glancing currents and swirling eddies . For many years [he]119-taminah had listened to the passionless and soothing murmur that sometimes was the song of hope , at times the song of triumph , of encouragement ; more often the whisper of consolation that spoke of better days to come . For so many years ! So many years ! And now to the accompaniment of that murmur [he]119-taminah listened to the slow and painful beating of [his]119-taminah heart . [He]119-taminah listened attentively , wondering at the regularity of its beats . [He]119-taminah began to count mechanically . One , two . Why count ? At the next beat it must stop . No heart could suffer so and beat so steadily for long . Those regular strokes as of a muffled hammer that rang in [his]119-taminah ears must stop soon . Still beating unceasing and cruel . [No man]2820-no man can bear this ; and is this the last , or will [the next one]3251-the next one be the last ? - How much longer ? O [God]135-god ! how much longer ? [His]119-taminah hand weighed heavier unconsciously on [the girl]402-the girl 's shoulder , and [she]402-the girl spoke the last words of [her]402-the girl story crouching at [his]119-taminah feet with tears of pain and shame and anger . Was [her]402-the girl revenge to fail [her]402-the girl ? [This white man]3253-this white man was like a senseless stone . Too late ! Too late ! "[2213-you] And [you]2213-you saw [her]2214-her go ? " [Almayer]72-almayer 's voice sounded harshly above [her]402-the girl head . "[2213-you] Did [I]0-i not tell [you]2213-you ? " [she]402-the girl sobbed , trying to wriggle gently out from under [his]2213-you grip . "[0-i] Did [I]0-i not tell [you]2213-you that [I]0-i saw [the witchwoman]2215-the witchwoman push [the canoe]338-the canoe ? [I]0-i lay hidden in the grass and heard all the words . [She]2215-the witchwoman that [we]2217-we used to call [the white Mem]73-nina wanted to return to look at [your]2213-you face , but [the witchwoman]2215-the witchwoman forbade [her]2215-the witchwoman , and - " [She]402-the girl sank lower yet on [her]402-the girl elbow , turning half round under the downward push of the heavy hand , [her]402-the girl face lifted up to [him]103-babalatchi with spiteful eyes . "[2215-the witchwoman] And [she]2215-the witchwoman obeyed , " [she]402-the girl shouted out in a half - laugh , half - cry of pain . "[2215-the witchwoman] Let [me]0-i go , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . Why are [you]2213-you angry with [me]0-i ? Hasten , or [you]2213-you shall be too late to show [your]2213-you anger to [the deceitful woman]2219-the deceitful woman . " [Almayer]72-almayer dragged [her]2213-you up to [her]2213-you feet and looked close into [her]2213-you face while [she]2213-you struggled , turning [her]2213-you head away from [his]0-i wild stare . "[2219-the deceitful woman] Who sent [you]2213-you here to torment [me]0-i ? " [he]0-i asked , violently . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not believe [you]2213-you . [You]2213-you lie . " [He]0-i straightened [his]0-i arm suddenly and flung [her]2213-you across [the verandah]156-the verandah towards the doorway , where [she]2213-you lay immobile and silent , as if [she]2213-you had left [her]2213-you life in [his]0-i grasp , a dark heap , without a sound or a stir . "[2213-you] Oh ! [Nina]73-nina ! " whispered [Almayer]72-almayer , in a voice in which reproach and love spoke together in pained tenderness . "[73-nina] Oh ! [Nina]73-nina ! [I]0-i do not believe . " A light draught from [the river]170-the river ran over [the courtyard]988-the courtyard in a wave of bowing grass and , entering [the verandah]156-the verandah , touched [Almayer]72-almayer 's forehead with its cool breath , in a caress of infinite pity . The curtain in [the women]376-the women 's doorway blew out and instantly collapsed with startling helplessness . [He]0-i stared at the fluttering stuff . "[73-nina] [Nina]73-nina ! " cried [Almayer]72-almayer . "[73-nina] Where are [you]73-nina , [Nina]73-nina ? " The wind passed out of [the empty house]3259-the empty house in a tremulous sigh , and all was still . [Almayer]72-almayer hid [his]0-i face in [his]0-i hands as if to shut out a loathsome sight . When , hearing a slight rustle , [he]0-i uncovered [his]0-i eyes , the dark heap by the door was gone . [CHAPTER XI]59-chapter xi . In the middle of [a shadowless square of moonlight]3260-a shadowless square of moonlight , shining on a smooth and level expanse of young rice - shoots , [a little shelter - hut perched on high posts]3261-a little shelter - hut perched on high posts , the pile of brushwood near by and the glowing embers of a fire with [a man stretched before it]3262-a man stretched before it , seemed very small and as if lost in the pale green iridescence reflected from the ground . On three sides of [the clearing]1416-the clearing , appearing very far away in the deceptive light , the big trees of [the forest]915-the forest [, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers]3265-, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers , looked down at the growing young life at [their]3265-, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers feet with the sombre resignation of giants that had lost faith in [their]3265-, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers strength . And in the midst of [them]3265-, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers the merciless creepers clung to the big trunks in cable - like coils , leaped from tree to tree , hung in thorny festoons from the lower boughs , and , sending slender tendrils on high to seek out the smallest branches , carried death to [[their]3265-, lashed together with manifold bonds by a mass of tangled creepers victims]3266-their victims in an exulting riot of silent destruction . On the fourth side , following the curve of [the bank of that branch of [the Pantai]3-the pantai that formed the only access to [the clearing]1416-the clearing]3267-the bank of that branch of the pantai that formed the only access to the clearing , ran a black line of young trees , bushes , and thick second growth , unbroken save for a small gap chopped out in one place . At that gap began the narrow footpath leading from [the water 's edge]1504-the water 's edge to the grass - built shelter used by [the night watchers]3270-the night watchers when the ripening crop had to be protected from the wild pigs . [The pathway]3271-the pathway ended at the foot of [the piles on which [the hut]622-the hut was built]3272-the piles on which the hut was built , in [a circular space covered with ashes and bits of burnt wood]3274-a circular space covered with ashes and bits of burnt wood . In the middle of [that space]3275-that space , by the dim fire , lay [Dain]74-dain . [He]74-dain turned over on [his]74-dain side with an impatient sigh , and , pillowing [his]74-dain head on [his]74-dain bent arm , lay quietly with [his]74-dain face to the dying fire . The glowing embers shone redly in a small circle , throwing a gleam into [his]74-dain wide - open eyes , and at every deep breath the fine white ash of bygone fires rose in a light cloud before [his]74-dain parted lips , and danced away from the warm glow into the moonbeams pouring down upon [[Bulangi]102-bulangi 's clearing]2852-bulangi 's clearing . [His]74-dain body was weary with the exertion of the past few days , [his]74-dain mind more weary still with the strain of solitary waiting for [his]74-dain fate . Never before had [he]74-dain felt so helpless . [He]74-dain had heard the report of the gun fired on board [the launch]3277-the launch , and [he]74-dain knew that [his]74-dain life was in untrustworthy hands , and that [[his]74-dain enemies]424-his enemies were very near . During the slow hours of the afternoon [he]74-dain roamed about on the edge of [the forest]915-the forest , or , hiding in the bushes , watched [the creek]941-the creek with unquiet eyes for some sign of danger . [He]74-dain feared not death , yet [he]74-dain desired ardently to live , for life to [him]74-dain was [Nina]73-nina . [She]73-nina had promised to come , to follow [him]74-dain , to share [his]74-dain danger and [his]74-dain splendour . But with [her]73-nina by [his]74-dain side [he]74-dain cared not for danger , and without [her]73-nina there could be no splendour and no joy in existence . Crouching in [his]74-dain shady hiding - place , [he]74-dain closed [his]74-dain eyes , trying to evoke the gracious and charming image of the white figure that for [him]74-dain was the beginning and the end of life . With eyes shut tight , [his]74-dain teeth hard set , [he]74-dain tried in a great effort of passionate will to keep [his]74-dain hold on that vision of supreme delight . In vain ! [His]74-dain heart grew heavy as the figure of [Nina]73-nina faded away to be replaced by another vision this time - a vision of [armed men , of angry faces , of glittering arms]3281-armed men , of angry faces , of glittering arms - and [he]74-dain seemed to hear the hum of excited and triumphant voices as [they]3282-their discovered [him]74-dain in [[his]74-dain hiding - place]3283-his hiding - place . Startled by the vividness of [his]74-dain fancy , [he]74-dain would open [his]74-dain eyes , and , leaping out into the sunlight , resume [his]74-dain aimless wanderings around [the clearing]1416-the clearing . As [he]74-dain skirted in [his]74-dain weary march the edge of [the forest]915-the forest [he]74-dain glanced now and then into [its]915-the forest dark shade , so enticing in its deceptive appearance of coolness , so repellent with its unrelieved gloom , where lay , entombed and rotting , countless generations of trees , and where [their]3282-their successors stood as if mourning , in dark green foliage , immense and helpless , awaiting [their]3282-their turn . Only [the parasites]3286-the parasites seemed to live there in a sinuous rush upwards into the air and sunshine , feeding on the dead and [the dying alike]3287-the dying alike , and crowning [[their]3282-their victims]3266-their victims with pink and blue flowers that gleamed amongst the boughs , incongruous and cruel , like a strident and mocking note in the solemn harmony of the doomed trees . [A man]340-a man could hide there , thought [Dain]74-dain , as [he]74-dain approached a place where the creepers had been torn and hacked into an archway that might have been the beginning of [a path]3290-a path . As [he]74-dain bent down to look through [he]74-dain heard angry grunting , and a sounder of wild pig crashed away in the undergrowth . An acrid smell of damp earth and of decaying leaves took [him]74-dain by the throat , and [he]74-dain drew back with a scared face , as if [he]74-dain had been touched by the breath of Death itself . The very air seemed dead in there - heavy and stagnating , poisoned with the corruption of countless ages . [He]74-dain went on , staggering on [his]74-dain way , urged by the nervous restlessness that made [him]74-dain feel tired yet caused [him]74-dain to loathe the very idea of immobility and repose . Was [he]74-dain [a wild man]3291-a wild man to hide in [the woods]390-the woods and perhaps be killed there - in the darkness - where there was no room to breathe ? [He]74-dain would wait for [[his]74-dain enemies]424-his enemies in the sunlight , where [he]74-dain could see the sky and feel the breeze . [He]74-dain knew how [a Malay chief]3294-a malay chief should die . The sombre and desperate fury , that peculiar inheritance of [[his]74-dain race]3295-his race , took possession of [him]74-dain , and [he]74-dain glared savagely across [the clearing]1416-the clearing towards the gap in the bushes by [the riverside]648-the riverside . [They]424-his enemies would come from there . In imagination [he]74-dain saw [them]424-his enemies now . [He]74-dain saw the bearded faces and the white jackets of [the officers]2896-the officers , the light on the levelled barrels of the rifles . What is the bravery of [the greatest warrior]3299-the greatest warrior before the firearms in the hand of [a slave]310-a slave ? [He]74-dain would walk toward [them]424-his enemies with a smiling face , with [his]74-dain hands held out in a sign of submission till [he]74-dain was very near [them]424-his enemies . [He]74-dain would speak friendly words - come nearer yet - yet nearer - so near that [they]424-his enemies could touch [him]74-dain with [their]424-his enemies hands and stretch them out to make [him]74-dain [a captive]3301-a captive . That would be the time : with a shout and a leap [he]74-dain would be in the midst of [them]424-his enemies , kriss in hand , killing , killing , killing , and would die with the shouts of [[his]74-dain enemies]424-his enemies in [his]74-dain ears , [their]424-his enemies warm blood spurting before [his]74-dain eyes . Carried away by [his]74-dain excitement , [he]74-dain snatched the kriss hidden in [his]74-dain sarong , and , drawing a long breath , rushed forward , struck at the empty air , and fell on [his]74-dain face . [He]74-dain lay as if stunned in the sudden reaction from [his]74-dain exaltation , thinking that , even if [he]74-dain died thus gloriously , it would have to be before [he]74-dain saw [Nina]73-nina . Better so . If [he]74-dain saw [her]73-nina again [he]74-dain felt that death would be too terrible . With horror [he]74-dain , [the descendant of [Rajahs]107-rajahs and of [conquerors]3304-conquerors]3303-the descendant of rajahs and of conquerors , had to face the doubt of [his]74-dain own bravery . [His]74-dain desire of life tormented [him]74-dain in a paroxysm of agonising remorse . [He]74-dain had not the courage to stir a limb . [He]74-dain had lost faith in [himself]74-dain , and there was nothing else in [him]74-dain of what makes [a man]340-a man . The suffering remained , for it is ordered that it should abide in [the human body]3306-the human body even to the last breath , and fear remained . Dimly [he]74-dain could look into the depths of [his]74-dain passionate love , see its strength and its weakness , and felt afraid . The sun went down slowly . The shadow of [the western forest]3307-the western forest marched over [the clearing]1416-the clearing , covered [the man]726-the man 's scorched shoulders with its cool mantle , and went on hurriedly to mingle with the shadows of [other forests on [the eastern side]3311-the eastern side]3310-other forests on the eastern side . The sun lingered for a while amongst the light tracery of the higher branches , as if in friendly reluctance to abandon the body stretched in [the green paddy - field]3312-the green paddy - field . Then [Dain , revived by the cool of the evening breeze]3313-dain , revived by the cool of the evening breeze , sat up and stared round [him]74-dain . As [he]74-dain did so the sun dipped sharply , as if ashamed of being detected in a sympathising attitude , and [the clearing]1416-the clearing , which during the day was all light , became suddenly all darkness , where the fire gleamed like an eye . [Dain]74-dain walked slowly towards [the creek]941-the creek , and , divesting [himself]74-dain of [his]74-dain torn sarong , [his]74-dain only garment , entered the water cautiously . [He]74-dain had had nothing to eat that day , and had not dared show [himself]74-dain in daylight by [the water - side]3316-the water - side to drink . Now , as [he]74-dain swam silently , [he]74-dain swallowed a few mouthfuls of water that lapped about [his]74-dain lips . This did [him]74-dain good , and [he]74-dain walked with greater confidence in [himself]74-dain and [others]262-others as [he]74-dain returned towards the fire . Had [he]74-dain been betrayed by [Lakamba]85-lakamba all would have been over by this . [He]74-dain made up a big blaze , and while it lasted dried [himself]74-dain , and then lay down by the embers . [He]74-dain could not sleep , but [he]74-dain felt a great numbness in all [his]74-dain limbs . [His]74-dain restlessness was gone , and [he]74-dain was content to lay still , measuring the time by watching the stars that rose in endless succession above [the forests]705-the forests , while the slight puffs of wind under the cloudless sky seemed to fan their twinkle into a greater brightness . Dreamily [he]74-dain assured [himself]74-dain over and over again that [she]3319-her would come , till the certitude crept into [his]74-dain heart and filled [him]74-dain with a great peace . Yes , when the next day broke , [they]3320-they would be together on [the great blue sea that was like life]3321-the great blue sea that was like life - away from [the forests that were like death]3322-the forests that were like death . [He]74-dain murmured the name of [Nina]73-nina into [the silent space]3323-the silent space with a tender smile : this seemed to break the spell of stillness , and far away by [the creek]941-the creek a frog croaked loudly as if in answer . A chorus of loud roars and plaintive calls rose from the mud along the line of bushes . [He]74-dain laughed heartily ; doubtless it was [their]3320-they love - song . [He]74-dain felt affectionate towards the frogs and listened , pleased with the noisy life near [him]74-dain . When the moon peeped above [the trees]3325-the trees [he]74-dain felt the old impatience and the old restlessness steal over [him]74-dain . Why was [she]3319-her so late ? True , it was a long way to come with a single paddle . With what skill and what endurance could those small hands manage a heavy paddle ! It was very wonderful - such small hands , such soft little palms that knew how to touch [his]74-dain cheek with a feel lighter than the fanning of a butterfly 's wing . Wonderful ! [He]74-dain lost [himself]74-dain lovingly in the contemplation of this tremendous mystery , and when [he]74-dain looked at the moon again it had risen a hand 's breadth above the trees . Would [she]3319-her come ? [He]74-dain forced [himself]74-dain to lay still , overcoming the impulse to rise and rush round [the clearing]1416-the clearing again . [He]74-dain turned this way and that ; at last , quivering with the effort , [he]74-dain lay on [his]74-dain back , and saw [her]3319-her face among the stars looking down on [him]74-dain . The croaking of frogs suddenly ceased . With the watchfulness of [a hunted man]3327-a hunted man [Dain]74-dain sat up , listening anxiously , and heard several splashes in the water as the frogs took rapid headers into [the creek]941-the creek . [He]74-dain knew that [they]3329-they had been alarmed by something , and stood up suspicious and attentive . A slight grating noise , then the dry sound as of two pieces of wood struck against each other . [Somebody]1308-somebody was about to land ! [He]74-dain took up an armful of brushwood , and , without taking [his]74-dain eyes from [the path]1223-the path , held it over the embers of [his]74-dain fire . [He]74-dain waited , undecided , and saw something gleam amongst the bushes ; then a white figure came out of the shadows and seemed to float towards [him]74-dain in the pale light . [His]74-dain heart gave a great leap and stood still , then went on shaking [his]74-dain frame in furious beats . [He]74-dain dropped the brushwood upon the glowing coals , and had an impression of shouting [her]3319-her name - of rushing to meet [her]3319-her ; yet [he]74-dain emitted no sound , [he]74-dain stirred not an inch , but [he]74-dain stood silent and motionless like chiselled bronze under the moonlight that streamed over [his]74-dain naked shoulders . As [he]74-dain stood still , fighting with [his]74-dain breath , as if bereft of [his]74-dain senses by the intensity of [his]74-dain delight , [she]3319-her walked up to [him]74-dain with quick , resolute steps , and , with the appearance of one about to leap from a dangerous height , threw both [her]3319-her arms round [his]74-dain neck with a sudden gesture . A small blue gleam crept amongst the dry branches , and the crackling of reviving fire was the only sound as [they]3332-they faced [each other]1412-each other in the speechless emotion of that meeting ; then the dry fuel caught at once , and a bright hot flame shot upwards in a blaze as high as [their]3332-they heads , and in its light [they]3332-they saw [each other]1412-each other 's eyes . [Neither of [them]3332-they]3335-neither of them spoke . [He]74-dain was regaining [his]74-dain senses in a slight tremor that ran upwards along [his]74-dain rigid body and hung about [his]74-dain trembling lips . [She]3319-her drew back [her]3319-her head and fastened [her]3319-her eyes on [his]74-dain in one of those long looks that are [a woman]613-a woman 's most terrible weapon ; a look that is more stirring than the closest touch , and more dangerous than the thrust of a dagger , because it also whips the soul out of the body , but leaves the body alive and helpless , to be swayed here and there by the capricious tempests of passion and desire ; a look that enwraps [the whole body , and that penetrates into the innermost recesses of the being , bringing terrible defeat in the delirious uplifting of accomplished conquest]3337-the whole body , and that penetrates into the innermost recesses of the being , bringing terrible defeat in the delirious uplifting of accomplished conquest . It has the same meaning for [the man of [the forests]705-the forests and [the sea]171-the sea]3338-the man of the forests and the sea as for [the man threading the paths of the more dangerous wilderness of houses]3341-the man threading the paths of the more dangerous wilderness of houses and [streets]3342-streets . [Men that had felt in [their]3343-men that had felt in their breasts breasts]3343-men that had felt in their breasts the awful exultation such a look awakens become mere things of to - day - which is paradise ; forget yesterday - which was suffering ; care not for to - morrow - which may be perdition . [They]3343-men that had felt in their breasts wish to live under that look for ever . It is the look of [woman]2688-woman 's surrender . [He]74-dain understood , and , as if suddenly released from [his]74-dain invisible bonds , fell at [her]3319-her feet with a shout of joy , and , embracing [her]3319-her knees , hid [his]74-dain head in the folds of [her]3319-her dress , murmuring disjointed words of gratitude and love . Never before had [he]74-dain felt so proud as now , when at the feet of [that woman that half belonged to [[his]74-dain enemies]424-his enemies]3345-that woman that half belonged to his enemies . [Her]3319-her fingers played with [his]74-dain hair in an absent - minded caress as [she]3319-her stood absorbed in thought . The thing was done . [[Her]3319-her mother]637-her mother was right . [The man]726-the man was [[her]3319-her slave]3349-her slave . As [she]3319-her glanced down at [his]74-dain kneeling form [she]3319-her felt a great pitying tenderness for [that man [she]3319-her was used to call]3350-that man she was used to call - even in [her]3319-her thoughts - [the master of life]3167-the master of life . [She]3319-her lifted [her]3319-her eyes and looked sadly at [the southern heavens under which lay the path of]3352-the southern heavens under which lay the path of [their]3353-their lives - [her]3319-her own , and [that man]826-that man 's at [her]3319-her feet . Did [he]74-dain not say [himself]74-dain is that [she]3319-her was the light of [his]74-dain life ? [She]3319-her would be [his]74-dain light and [his]74-dain wisdom ; [she]3319-her would be [his]74-dain greatness and [his]74-dain strength ; yet hidden from the eyes of all [men]304-men [she]3319-her would be , above all , [his]74-dain only and lasting weakness . [A very woman]3356-a very woman ! In the sublime vanity of [her]3319-her kind [she]3319-her was thinking already of moulding [a god]3357-a god from the clay at [her]3319-her feet . [A god for [others]262-others to worship]3358-a god for others to worship . [She]3319-her was content to see [him]74-dain as [he]74-dain was now , and to feel [him]74-dain quiver at the slightest touch of [her]3319-her light fingers . And while [her]3319-her eyes looked sadly at the southern stars a faint smile seemed to be playing about [her]3319-her firm lips . Who can tell in the fitful light of a camp fire ? It might have been a smile of triumph , or of conscious power , or of tender pity , or , perhaps , of love . [She]3319-her spoke softly to [him]74-dain , and [he]74-dain rose to [his]74-dain feet , putting [his]74-dain arm round [her]3319-her in quiet consciousness of [his]74-dain ownership ; [she]3319-her laid [her]3319-her head on [his]74-dain shoulder with a sense of defiance to all [the world]190-the world in the encircling protection of that arm . [He]74-dain was [hers]3319-her with all [his]74-dain qualities and all [his]74-dain faults . [His]74-dain strength and [his]74-dain courage , [his]74-dain recklessness and [his]74-dain daring , [his]74-dain simple wisdom and [his]74-dain savage cunning - all were [hers]3319-her . As [they]3361-their passed together out of the red light of the fire into the silver shower of rays that fell upon [the clearing]1416-the clearing [he]74-dain bent [his]74-dain head over [her]3319-her face , and [she]3319-her saw in [his]74-dain eyes the dreamy intoxication of boundless felicity from the close touch of [her]3319-her slight figure clasped to [his]74-dain side . With a rhythmical swing of [their]3361-their bodies [they]3361-their walked through the light towards the outlying shadows of [the forests]705-the forests that seemed to guard [their]3361-their happiness in solemn immobility . [Their]3361-their forms melted in the play of light and shadow at the foot of the big trees , but the murmur of tender words lingered over [the empty clearing]3364-the empty clearing , grew faint , and died out . A sigh as of immense sorrow passed over [the land]1586-the land in the last effort of the dying breeze , and in the deep silence which succeeded , [the earth]3366-the earth and [the heavens]3367-the heavens were suddenly hushed up in the mournful contemplation of human love and human blindness . [They]3361-their walked slowly back to the fire . [He]74-dain made for [her]3319-her a seat out of the dry branches , and , throwing [himself]74-dain down at [her]3319-her feet , lay [his]74-dain head in [her]3319-her lap and gave [himself]74-dain up to the dreamy delight of the passing hour . [Their]3361-their voices rose and fell , tender or animated as [they]3361-their spoke of [their]3361-their love and of [their]3361-their future . [She]3319-her , with a few skilful words spoken from time to time , guided [his]74-dain thoughts , and [he]74-dain let [his]74-dain happiness flow in a stream of talk passionate and tender , grave or menacing , according to the mood which [she]3319-her evoked . [He]74-dain spoke to [her]3319-her of [[his]74-dain own island]3368-his own island , where [the gloomy forests]3369-the gloomy forests and [the muddy rivers]3370-the muddy rivers were unknown . [He]74-dain spoke of [[its]3368-his own island terraced fields]3371-its terraced fields , of the murmuring clear rills of sparkling water that flowed down the sides of [great mountains]3372-great mountains , bringing life to [the land]1586-the land and joy to [its]3368-his own island tillers . And [he]74-dain spoke also of [the mountain peak that rising lonely above [the belt of trees]3375-the belt of trees knew the secrets of the passing clouds]3374-the mountain peak that rising lonely above the belt of trees knew the secrets of the passing clouds , and was the dwelling - place of the mysterious spirit of [[his]74-dain race]3295-his race , of [the guardian genius of [[his]74-dain house]372-his house]3377-the guardian genius of his house . [He]74-dain spoke of [vast horizons swept by fierce winds that whistled high above [the summits of [burning mountains]3381-burning mountains]3380-the summits of burning mountains]3379-vast horizons swept by fierce winds that whistled high above the summits of burning mountains . [He]74-dain spoke of [[his]74-dain forefathers]3382-his forefathers that conquered ages ago [the island of which [he]74-dain was to be [the future ruler]3384-the future ruler]3383-the island of which he was to be the future ruler . And then as , in [her]3385-her interest , [she]3385-her brought [her]3385-her face nearer to [his]74-dain , [he]74-dain , touching lightly the thick tresses of [her]3385-her long hair , felt a sudden impulse to speak to [her]3385-her of [the sea [he]74-dain loved so well]3386-the sea he loved so well ; and [he]74-dain told [her]3385-her of its never - ceasing voice , to which [he]74-dain had listened as [a child]968-a child , wondering at its hidden meaning that [no living man]3388-no living man has penetrated yet ; of its enchanting glitter ; of its senseless and capricious fury ; how its surface was for ever changing , and yet always enticing , while its depths were for ever the same , cold and cruel , and full of the wisdom of destroyed life . [He]74-dain told [her]3385-her how it held [men]304-men slaves of its charm for a lifetime , and then , regardless of [their]304-men devotion , swallowed [them]304-men up , angry at [their]304-men fear of its mystery , which it would never disclose , not even to [those that loved it most]3390-those that loved it most . While [he]74-dain talked , [Nina]73-nina 's head had been gradually sinking lower , and [her]3385-her face almost touched [his]74-dain now . [Her]3385-her hair was over [his]74-dain eyes , [her]3385-her breath was on [his]74-dain forehead , [her]3385-her arms were about [his]74-dain body . [No two beings]3391-no two beings could be closer to each other , yet [she]3385-her guessed rather than understood the meaning of [his]74-dain last words that came out after a slight hesitation in a faint murmur , dying out imperceptibly into a profound and significant silence : "[73-nina] [The sea]171-the sea , [O Nina]73-nina , is like [a woman]613-a woman 's heart . " [She]3385-her closed [his]74-dain lips with a sudden kiss , and answered in a steady voice - "[613-a woman] But to [the men that have no fear]2222-the men that have no fear , [O master of [my]0-i life]2223-o master of my life , [the sea]171-the sea is ever true . " Over [their]3392-their heads a film of dark , thread - like clouds , looking like immense cobwebs drifting under the stars , darkened the sky with the presage of the coming thunderstorm . From [the invisible hills]3393-the invisible hills the first distant rumble of thunder came in a prolonged roll which , after tossing about from [hill to hill]3394-hill to hill , lost itself in [the forests of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]3395-the forests of the pantai . [Dain]74-dain and [Nina]73-nina stood up , and [the former]3396-the former looked at the sky uneasily . "[613-a woman] It is time for [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi to be [here]2634-here , " [he]74-dain said . "[103-babalatchi] The night is more than half gone . [[Our]2226-our road]2227-our road is long , and a bullet travels quicker than [the best canoe]2228-the best canoe . " "[103-babalatchi] [He]103-babalatchi will be here before the moon is hidden behind the clouds , " said [Nina]73-nina . "[103-babalatchi] [I]0-i heard a splash in the water , " [she]73-nina added . "[0-i] Did [you]2229-you hear it too ? " "[2229-you] Alligator , " answered [Dain]74-dain shortly , with a careless glance towards [the creek]941-the creek . "[2229-you] The darker the night , " [he]74-dain continued , "[2229-you] the shorter will be [[our]2226-our road]2227-our road , for then [we]2226-our could keep in the current of [the main stream]947-the main stream , but if it is light - even no more than now - [we]2226-our must follow the small channels of sleeping water , with nothing to help [our]2226-our paddles . " "[74-dain] [Dain]74-dain , " interposed [Nina]73-nina , earnestly , "[74-dain] it was [no alligator]2232-no alligator . [I]0-i heard the bushes rustling near [the landing - place]2233-the landing - place . " "[0-i] Yes , " said [Dain]74-dain , after listening awhile . "[0-i] It can not be [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , who would come in [a big war canoe]2234-a big war canoe , and openly . [Those that are coming]2235-those that are coming , whoever [they]2235-those that are coming are , do not wish to make much noise . But [you]0-i have heard , and now [I]0-i can see , " [he]0-i went on quickly . "[0-i] It is but [one man]2236-one man . Stand behind [me]0-i , [Nina]73-nina . If [he]2236-one man is [a friend]2611-a friend [he]2236-one man is welcome ; if [he]2236-one man is [an enemy]1355-an enemy [you]0-i shall see [him]2236-one man die . " [He]0-i laid [his]0-i hand on [his]0-i kriss , and awaited the approach of [[his]0-i unexpected visitor]3398-his unexpected visitor . The fire was burning very low , and small clouds - precursors of the storm - crossed the face of the moon in rapid succession , and their flying shadows darkened [the clearing]1416-the clearing . [He]0-i could not make out who [the man]726-the man might be , but [he]0-i felt uneasy at the steady advance of [the tall figure walking on the path with a heavy tread]3401-the tall figure walking on the path with a heavy tread , and hailed it with a command to stop . [The man]726-the man stopped at some little distance , and [Dain]74-dain expected [him]726-the man to speak , but all [he]0-i could hear was [his]726-the man deep breathing . Through a break in the flying clouds a sudden and fleeting brightness descended upon [the clearing]1416-the clearing . Before the darkness closed in again , [Dain]74-dain saw a hand holding some glittering object extended towards [him]74-dain , heard [Nina]73-nina 's cry of "[2606-father] [Father]2606-father ! " and in an instant [the girl]402-the girl was between [him]74-dain and [Almayer]72-almayer 's revolver . [Nina]73-nina 's loud cry woke up the echoes of [the sleeping woods]3405-the sleeping woods , and [the three]3406-the three stood still as if waiting for the return of silence before [they]3406-the three would give expression to [their]3406-the three various feelings . At the appearance of [Nina]73-nina , [Almayer]72-almayer 's arm fell by [his]74-dain side , and [he]74-dain made a step forward . [Dain]74-dain pushed [the girl]402-the girl gently aside . "[2606-father] Am [I]0-i a wild beast that [you]2240-you should try to kill [me]0-i suddenly and in the dark , [Tuan Almayer]84-tuan almayer ? " said [Dain]74-dain , breaking the strained silence . "[84-tuan almayer] Throw some brushwood on the fire , " [he]0-i went on , speaking to [Nina]73-nina , "[84-tuan almayer] while [I]0-i watch [[my]0-i white friend]2241-my white friend , lest harm should come to [you]2241-my white friend or to [me]0-i , O delight of [my]0-i heart ! " [Almayer]72-almayer ground [his]74-dain teeth and raised [his]74-dain arm again . With a quick bound [Dain]74-dain was at [his]74-dain side : there was a short scuffle , during which one chamber of the revolver went off harmlessly , then the weapon , wrenched out of [Almayer]72-almayer 's hand , whirled through the air and fell in the bushes . [The two men]3408-the two men stood close together , breathing hard . The replenished fire threw out an unsteady circle of light and shone on the terrified face of [Nina]73-nina , who looked at [them]3408-the two men with outstretched hands . "[74-dain] [Dain]74-dain ! " [she]73-nina cried out warningly , "[74-dain] [Dain]74-dain ! " [He]74-dain waved [his]74-dain hand towards [her]73-nina in a reassuring gesture , and , turning to [Almayer]72-almayer , said with great courtesy - "[74-dain] Now [we]2242-we may talk , [Tuan]84-tuan almayer . It is easy to send out death , but can [your]84-tuan almayer wisdom recall the life ? [She]2243-she might have been harmed , " [he]74-dain continued , indicating [Nina]73-nina . "[84-tuan almayer] [Your]84-tuan almayer hand shook much ; for [myself]0-i [I]0-i was not afraid . " "[73-nina] [Nina]73-nina ! " exclaimed [Almayer]72-almayer , "[73-nina] come to [me]0-i at once . What is this sudden madness ? What bewitched [you]73-nina ? Come to [[your]73-nina father]2814-your father , and together [we]2242-we shall try to forget this horrible nightmare ! " [He]74-dain opened [his]74-dain arms with the certitude of clasping [her]73-nina to [his]74-dain breast in another second . [She]73-nina did not move . As it dawned upon [him]74-dain that [she]73-nina did not mean to obey [he]74-dain felt a deadly cold creep into [his]74-dain heart , and , pressing the palms of [his]74-dain hands to [his]74-dain temples , [he]74-dain looked down on the ground in mute despair . [Dain]74-dain took [Nina]73-nina by the arm and led [her]73-nina towards [[her]73-nina father]408-her father . "[2245-his people] Speak to [him]2814-your father in the language of [[his]2814-your father people]2245-his people , " [he]74-dain said . "[2245-his people] [He]2814-your father is grieving - as who would not grieve at losing [thee]2246-thee , [[my]0-i pearl]2247-my pearl ! Speak to [him]2814-your father the last words [he]2814-your father shall hear spoken by that voice , which must be very sweet to [him]2814-your father , but is all [my]0-i life to [me]0-i . " [He]74-dain released [her]2248-you , and , stepping back a few paces out of the circle of light , stood in the darkness looking at [them]2248-you with calm interest . The reflection of a distant flash of lightning lit up the clouds over [their]2248-you heads , and was followed after a short interval by the faint rumble of thunder , which mingled with [Almayer]72-almayer 's voice as [he]74-dain began to speak . "[2248-you] Do [you]2248-you know what [you]2248-you are doing ? Do [you]2248-you know what is waiting for [you]2248-you if [you]2248-you follow [that man]826-that man ? Have [you]2248-you no pity for [yourself]2248-you ? Do [you]2248-you know that [you]2248-you shall be at first [his]826-that man plaything and then [a scorned slave]2250-a scorned slave , [a drudge]2251-a drudge , and [a servant of some new fancy of that man]2252-a servant of some new fancy of that man ? " [She]2248-you raised [her]2248-you hand to stop [him]826-that man , and turning [her]2248-you head slightly , asked - "[826-that man] [You]826-that man hear [this Dain]2638-this dain ! Is it true ? " "[2638-this dain] By [all the gods]2254-all the gods ! " came the impassioned answer from the darkness - "[2254-all the gods] by heaven and earth , by [my]0-i head and thine [I]0-i swear : this is [a white man]242-a white man 's lie . [I]0-i have delivered [my]0-i soul into [your]2248-you hands for ever ; [I]0-i breathe with [your]2248-you breath , [I]0-i see with [your]2248-you eyes , [I]0-i think with [your]2248-you mind , and [I]0-i take [you]2248-you into [my]0-i heart for ever . " "[0-i] [You]826-that man thief ! " shouted the exasperated [Almayer]72-almayer . A deep silence succeeded this outburst , then the voice of [Dain]74-dain was heard again . "[0-i] Nay , [Tuan]84-tuan almayer , " [he]0-i said in a gentle tone , "[0-i] that is not true also . [The girl]402-the girl came of [her]402-the girl own will . [I]0-i have done no more but to show [her]402-the girl [my]0-i love like [a man]340-a man ; [she]402-the girl heard the cry of [my]0-i heart , and [she]402-the girl came , and the dowry [I]0-i have given to [the woman [you]826-that man call [[your]826-that man wife]2604-your wife]2258-the woman you call your wife . " [Almayer]72-almayer groaned in [his]0-i extremity of rage and shame . [Nina]73-nina laid [her]73-nina hand lightly on [his]0-i shoulder , and the contact , light as the touch of a falling leaf , seemed to calm [him]0-i . [He]0-i spoke quickly , and in English this time . "[2260-they] Tell [me]0-i , " [he]0-i said - "[2260-they] tell [me]0-i , what have [they]2260-they done to [you]826-that man , [[your]826-that man mother]2742-your mother and [that man]826-that man ? What made [you]826-that man give [yourself]826-that man up to [that savage]2263-that savage ? For [he]2263-that savage is [a savage]2264-a savage . Between [him]2263-that savage and [you]826-that man there is a barrier that nothing can remove . [I]0-i can see in [your]826-that man eyes the look of those who commit suicide when [they]2265-they are mad . [You]826-that man are mad . Do n't smile . It breaks [my]0-i heart . If [I]0-i were to see [you]826-that man drowning before [my]0-i eyes , and [I]0-i without the power to help [you]826-that man , [I]0-i could not suffer a greater torment . Have [you]826-that man forgotten the teaching of so many years ? " "[826-that man] No , " [she]826-that man interrupted , "[826-that man] [I]0-i remember it well . [I]0-i remember how it ended also . Scorn for scorn , contempt for contempt , hate for hate . [I]0-i am not of [[your]826-that man race]2266-your race . Between [[your]826-that man people]2267-your people and [me]0-i there is also a barrier that nothing can remove . [You]826-that man ask why [I]0-i want to go , and [I]0-i ask [you]826-that man why [I]0-i should stay . " [He]0-i staggered as if struck in the face , but with a quick , unhesitating grasp [she]826-that man caught [him]0-i by the arm and steadied [him]0-i . "[0-i] Why [you]0-i should stay ! " [he]0-i repeated slowly , in a dazed manner , and stopped short , astounded at the completeness of [his]0-i misfortune . "[826-that man] [You]826-that man told [me]0-i yesterday , " [she]826-that man went on again , "[826-that man] that [I]0-i could not understand or see [your]826-that man love for [me]0-i : it is so . How can [I]0-i ? [No two human beings]2268-no two human beings understand [each other]1412-each other . [They]2268-no two human beings can understand but [their]2268-no two human beings own voices . [You]826-that man wanted [me]0-i to dream [your]826-that man dreams , to see [your]826-that man own visions - the visions of life amongst the white faces of [those who cast [me]0-i out from [their]2270-those who cast me out from their midst midst]2270-those who cast me out from their midst in angry contempt . But while [you]826-that man spoke [I]0-i listened to the voice of [[my]0-i own self]2271-my own self ; then [this man]2272-this man came , and all was still ; there was only the murmur of [his]2272-this man love . [You]826-that man call [him]2272-this man [a savage]2264-a savage ! What do [you]826-that man call [[my]0-i mother]2645-my mother , [[your]826-that man wife]2604-your wife ? " "[73-nina] [Nina]73-nina ! " cried [Almayer]72-almayer , "[826-that man] take [your]73-nina eyes off [my]0-i face . " [She]72-almayer looked down directly , but continued speaking only a little above a whisper . "[826-that man] In time , " [she]72-almayer went on , "[826-that man] both [our]2276-our voices , [that man]826-that man 's and [mine]0-i , spoke together in a sweetness that was intelligible to [our]2276-our ears only . [You]826-that man were speaking of gold then , but [our]2276-our ears were filled with the song of [our]2276-our love , and [we]2276-our did not hear [you]826-that man . Then [I]0-i found that [we]2276-our could see through [each other]1412-each other 's eyes : that [he]826-that man saw things that [nobody]163-nobody but [myself]0-i and [he]826-that man could see . [We]2276-our entered [a land where [no one]429-no one could follow [us]2276-our , and least of all [you]826-that man . Then [I]0-i began to live]2280-a land where no one could follow us , and least of all you . then i began to live . " [She]826-that man paused . [Almayer]72-almayer sighed deeply . With [her]826-that man eyes still fixed on the ground [she]826-that man began speaking again . "[0-i] And [I]0-i mean to live . [I]0-i mean to follow [him]826-that man . [I]0-i have been rejected with scorn by [the white people]2282-the white people , and now [I]0-i am [a Malay]2637-a malay ! [He]826-that man took [me]0-i in [his]826-that man arms , [he]826-that man laid [his]826-that man life at [my]0-i feet . [He]826-that man is brave ; [he]826-that man will be powerful , and [I]0-i hold [his]826-that man bravery and [his]826-that man strength in [my]0-i hand , and [I]0-i shall make [him]826-that man great . [His]826-that man name shall be remembered long after both [our]2284-our bodies are laid in the dust . [I]0-i love [you]2285-you no less than [I]0-i did before , but [I]0-i shall never leave [him]826-that man , for without [him]826-that man [I]0-i can not live . " "[826-that man] If [he]826-that man understood what [you]0-i have said , " answered [Almayer]72-almayer , scornfully , "[826-that man] [he]826-that man must be highly flattered . [You]0-i want [him]826-that man as a tool for some incomprehensible ambition of [yours]0-i . Enough , [Nina]73-nina . If [you]73-nina do not go down at once to [the creek]941-the creek , where [Ali]95-ali is waiting with [my]0-i canoe , [I]0-i shall tell [him]826-that man to return to [the settlement]523-the settlement and bring [the Dutch officers]728-the dutch officers [here]2634-here . [You]73-nina can not escape from [this clearing]2290-this clearing , for [I]0-i have cast adrift [[your]73-nina canoe]2698-your canoe . If [the Dutch]124-the dutch catch [this hero of yours]2292-this hero of yours [they]728-the dutch officers will hang [him]826-that man as sure as [I]0-i stand here . Now go . " [He]0-i made a step towards [[his]0-i daughter]162-his daughter and laid hold of [her]162-his daughter by the shoulder , [his]0-i other hand pointing down the path to [the landing - place]2233-the landing - place . "[728-the dutch officers] Beware ! " exclaimed [Dain]74-dain ; "[728-the dutch officers] [this woman]2293-this woman belongs to [me]0-i ! " [Nina]73-nina wrenched [herself]73-nina free and looked straight at [Almayer]72-almayer 's angry face . "[728-the dutch officers] No , [I]0-i will not go , " [she]73-nina said with desperate energy . "[728-the dutch officers] If [he]826-that man dies [I]0-i shall die too ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i die ! " said [Almayer]72-almayer , contemptuously . "[0-i] Oh , no ! [You]0-i shall live a life of lies and deception till [some other vagabond]2294-some other vagabond comes along to sing ; how did [you]0-i say that ? The song of love to [you]0-i ! Make up [your]0-i mind quickly . " [He]0-i waited for a while , and then added meaningly - "[0-i] Shall [I]0-i call out to [Ali]95-ali ? " "[0-i] Call out , " [she]3412-she answered in Malay , "[0-i] [you]0-i that can not be true to [[your]0-i own countrymen]2295-your own countrymen . Only a few days ago [you]0-i were selling the powder for [their]2295-your own countrymen destruction ; now [you]0-i want to give up to [them]2295-your own countrymen [the man that yesterday [you]0-i called [[your]0-i friend]2297-your friend]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend . Oh , [Dain]74-dain , " [she]3412-she said , turning towards [the motionless but attentive figure in the darkness]3413-the motionless but attentive figure in the darkness , "[74-dain] instead of bringing [you]0-i life [I]0-i bring [you]0-i death , for [he]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend will betray unless [I]0-i leave [you]0-i for ever ! " [Dain]74-dain came into the circle of light , and , throwing [his]74-dain arm around [Nina]73-nina 's neck , whispered in [her]73-nina ear - "[0-i] [I]0-i can kill [him]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend where [he]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend stands , before a sound can pass [his]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend lips . For [you]0-i it is to say yes or no . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi can not be far now . " [He]74-dain straightened [himself]74-dain up , taking [his]74-dain arm off [her]73-nina shoulder , and confronted [Almayer]72-almayer , who looked at [them]3414-them both with an expression of concentrated fury . "[103-babalatchi] No ! " [she]73-nina cried , clinging to [Dain]74-dain in wild alarm . "[103-babalatchi] No ! Kill [me]0-i ! Then perhaps [he]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend will let [you]0-i go . [You]0-i do not know the mind of [a white man]242-a white man . [He]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend would rather see [me]0-i dead than standing where [I]0-i am . Forgive [me]0-i , [[your]0-i slave]3056-your slave , but [you]0-i must not . " [She]3056-your slave fell at [his]0-i feet sobbing violently and repeating , "[0-i] Kill [me]0-i ! Kill [me]0-i ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i want [you]0-i alive , " said [Almayer]72-almayer , speaking also in [Malay]89-malay , with sombre calmness . "[0-i] [You]0-i go , or [he]2296-the man that yesterday you called your friend hangs . Will [you]0-i obey ? " [Dain]74-dain shook [Nina]73-nina off , and , making a sudden lunge , struck [Almayer]72-almayer full in the chest with the handle of [his]74-dain kriss , keeping the point towards [himself]74-dain . "[141-hai] [Hai]141-hai , look ! It was easy for [me]0-i to turn the point the other way , " [he]0-i said in [his]0-i even voice . "[0-i] Go , [Tuan Putih]116-tuan putih , " [he]0-i added with dignity . "[116-tuan putih] [I]0-i give [you]0-i [your]0-i life , [my]0-i life , and [her]2300-her life . [I]0-i am [the slave of [this woman]2293-this woman]2301-the slave of this woman 's desire , and [she]2300-her wills it so . " There was not a glimmer of light in the sky now , and the tops of the trees were as invisible as their trunks , being lost in the mass of clouds that hung low over [the woods]390-the woods , [the clearing]1416-the clearing , and [the river]170-the river . Every outline had disappeared in the intense blackness that seemed to have destroyed everything but space . Only the fire glimmered like a star forgotten in this annihilation of all visible things , and nothing was heard after [Dain]74-dain ceased speaking but the sobs of [Nina]73-nina , whom [he]74-dain held in [his]74-dain arms , kneeling beside the fire . [Almayer]72-almayer stood looking down at [them]3418-them in gloomy thoughtfulness . As [he]74-dain was opening [his]74-dain lips to speak [they]3418-them were startled by a cry of warning by [the riverside]648-the riverside , followed by the splash of many paddles and the sound of voices . "[2300-her] [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi ! " shouted [Dain]74-dain , lifting up [Nina]73-nina as [he]74-dain got upon [his]74-dain feet quickly . "[127-ada] [Ada]127-ada ! [Ada]127-ada ! " came the answer from [the panting statesman who ran up [the path]1223-the path and stood amongst [them]3418-them]3420-the panting statesman who ran up the path and stood amongst them . "[127-ada] Run to [my]0-i canoe , " [he]0-i said to [Dain]74-dain excitedly , without taking any notice of [Almayer]72-almayer . "[127-ada] Run ! [we]2303-we must go . [That woman]1815-that woman has told [them]2305-them all ! " "[1815-that woman] [What woman]2306-what woman ? " asked [Dain]74-dain , looking at [Nina]73-nina . Just then there was [only one woman in [the whole world]3423-the whole world]3422-only one woman in the whole world for [him]74-dain . "[2306-what woman] The she - dog with white teeth ; [the seven times [accursed slave of [Bulangi]102-bulangi]2308-accursed slave of bulangi]2307-the seven times accursed slave of bulangi . [She]1815-that woman yelled at [[Abdulla]83-abdulla 's gate]2309-abdulla 's gate till [she]1815-that woman woke up all [Sambir]20-sambir . Now [the white officers]2310-the white officers are coming , guided by [her]1815-that woman and [Reshid]119-taminah . If [you]2311-you want to live , do not look at [me]0-i , but go ! " "[2311-you] How do [you]2311-you know this ? " asked [Almayer]72-almayer . "[2311-you] Oh , [Tuan]127-ada ! what matters how [I]0-i know ! [I]0-i have only one eye , but [I]0-i saw lights in [[Abdulla]83-abdulla 's house]1062-abdulla 's house and in [[his]83-abdulla campong]2313-his campong as [we]2314-we were paddling past . [I]0-i have ears , and while [we]2314-we lay under the bank [I]0-i have heard [the messengers sent out to [[the white men]2919-the white men 's house]2317-the white men 's house]2315-the messengers sent out to the white men 's house . " "[2315-the messengers sent out to the white men 's house] Will [you]2311-you depart without [that woman who is [[my]0-i daughter]2594-my daughter]2318-that woman who is my daughter ? " said [Almayer]72-almayer , addressing [Dain]74-dain , while [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi stamped with impatience , muttering , "[2315-the messengers sent out to the white men 's house] Run ! Run at once ! " "[2820-no man] No , " answered [Dain]74-dain , steadily , "[2820-no man] [I]0-i will not go ; to [no man]2820-no man will [I]0-i abandon [this woman]2293-this woman . " "[0-i] Then kill [me]0-i and escape [yourself]2311-you , " sobbed out [Nina]73-nina . [He]0-i clasped [her]73-nina close , looking at [her]73-nina tenderly , and whispered , "[2311-you] [We]2322-we will never part , O [Nina]73-nina ! " "[73-nina] [I]0-i shall not stay here any longer , " broke in [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , angrily . "[0-i] This is great foolishness . [No woman]2323-no woman is worth [a man]340-a man 's life . [I]0-i am [an old man]3077-an old man , and [I]0-i know . " [He]0-i picked up [his]0-i staff , and , turning to go , looked at [Dain]74-dain as if offering [him]74-dain [his]0-i last chance of escape . But [Dain]74-dain 's face was hidden amongst [Nina]73-nina 's black tresses , and [he]74-dain did not see this last appealing glance . [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi vanished in the darkness . Shortly after [his]103-babalatchi disappearance [they]2326-they heard [the war canoe]3424-the war canoe leave [the landing - place]2233-the landing - place in the swish of the numerous paddles dipped in the water together . Almost at the same time [Ali]95-ali came up from [the riverside]648-the riverside , two paddles on [his]95-ali shoulder . "[0-i] [[Our]2326-they canoe]2327-our canoe is hidden up [the creek]941-the creek , [Tuan Almayer]84-tuan almayer , " [he]0-i said , "[84-tuan almayer] in [the dense bush where [the forest comes down to the water]2330-the forest comes down to the water]2329-the dense bush where the forest comes down to the water . [I]0-i took it there because [I]0-i heard from [[Babalatchi]103-babalatchi 's paddlers]2331-babalatchi 's paddlers that [the white men]2919-the white men are coming here . " "[2919-the white men] Wait for [me]0-i there , " said [Almayer]72-almayer , "[2919-the white men] but keep [the canoe]338-the canoe hidden . " [He]0-i remained silent , listening to [Ali]95-ali 's footsteps , then turned to [Nina]73-nina . "[73-nina] [Nina]73-nina , " [he]0-i said sadly , "[73-nina] will [you]73-nina have no pity for [me]0-i ? " There was no answer . [She]73-nina did not even turn [her]73-nina head , which was pressed close to [Dain]74-dain 's breast . [He]0-i made a movement as if to leave [them]3427-them and stopped . By the dim glow of the burning - out fire [he]0-i saw [their]3427-them two motionless figures . [The woman]2854-the woman 's back turned to [him]0-i with the long black hair streaming down over the white dress , and [Dain]74-dain 's calm face looking at [him]0-i above [her]2854-the woman head . "[73-nina] [I]0-i can not , " [he]0-i muttered to [himself]0-i . After a long pause [he]0-i spoke again a little lower , but in an unsteady voice , "[73-nina] It would be too great a disgrace . [I]0-i am [a white man]242-a white man . " [He]0-i broke down completely there , and went on tearfully , "[242-a white man] [I]0-i am [a white man , and of good family]2335-a white man , and of good family . [Very good family]2336-very good family , " [he]0-i repeated , weeping bitterly . "[2336-very good family] It would be a disgrace . . . all over [the islands]217-the islands , . . . [the only white man on [the east coast]1251-the east coast]2936-the only white man on the east coast . No , it can not be . . . [white men]471-white men finding [[my]0-i daughter]2594-my daughter with [this Malay]2984-this malay . [[My]0-i daughter]2594-my daughter ! " [he]0-i cried aloud , with a ring of despair in [his]0-i voice . [He]0-i recovered [his]0-i composure after a while and said distinctly - "[0-i] [I]0-i will never forgive [you]2594-my daughter , [Nina]73-nina - never ! If [you]2594-my daughter were to come back to [me]0-i now , the memory of this night would poison all [my]0-i life . [I]0-i shall try to forget . [I]0-i have [no daughter]2344-no daughter . There used to be [a half - caste woman in [[my]0-i house]2945-my house]2345-a half - caste woman in my house , but [she]2345-a half - caste woman in my house is going even now . [You]2594-my daughter , [Dain]74-dain , or whatever [your]2594-my daughter name may be , [I]0-i shall take [you]2594-my daughter and [that woman]1815-that woman to [the island]363-the island at [the mouth of [the river]170-the river]691-the mouth of the river [myself]0-i . Come with [me]0-i . " [He]0-i led the way , following [the bank]331-the bank as far as [the forest]915-the forest . [Ali]95-ali answered to [his]0-i call , and , pushing [their]3431-they way through the dense bush , [they]3431-they stepped into [the canoe]338-the canoe hidden under the overhanging branches . [Dain]74-dain laid [Nina]73-nina in the bottom , and sat holding [her]73-nina head on [his]0-i knees . [Almayer]72-almayer and [Ali]95-ali each took up a paddle . As [they]3431-they were going to push out [Ali]95-ali hissed warningly . [All]1915-all listened . In the great stillness before the bursting out of the thunderstorm [they]3431-they could hear the sound of oars working regularly in [their]3431-they row - locks . The sound approached steadily , and [Dain]74-dain , looking through the branches , could see the faint shape of [a big white boat]3434-a big white boat . [A woman]613-a woman 's voice said in a cautious tone - "[0-i] There is [the place where [you]2352-you may land [white men]471-white men]2351-the place where you may land white men ; a little higher - there ! " [The boat]336-the boat was passing [them]3431-they so close in [the narrow creek]527-the narrow creek that the blades of the long oars nearly touched [the canoe]338-the canoe . "[2352-you] Way enough ! Stand by to jump on [shore]1259-shore ! [He]2355-he is alone and unarmed , " was the quiet order in [a man]340-a man 's voice , and in [Dutch]124-the dutch . [Somebody else]3440-somebody else whispered : "[2355-he] [I]0-i think [I]0-i can see a glimmer of a fire through the bush . " And then [the boat]336-the boat floated past [them]3431-they , disappearing instantly in the darkness . "[2355-he] Now , " whispered [Ali]95-ali , eagerly , "[2355-he] let [us]2356-us push out and paddle away . " The little canoe swung into [the stream]1985-the stream , and as it sprung forward in response to the vigorous dig of the paddles [they]3431-they could hear an angry shout . "[2355-he] [He]2355-he is not by the fire . Spread out , [men]304-men , and search for [him]2355-he ! " Blue lights blazed out in [different parts of [the clearing]1416-the clearing]3443-different parts of the clearing , and the shrill voice of [a woman]613-a woman cried in accents of rage and pain - "[2358-o senseless white men] Too late ! [O senseless white men]2358-o senseless white men ! [He]2355-he has escaped ! " CHAPTER XII . "[2355-he] That is [the place]193-the place , " said [Dain]74-dain , indicating with the blade of [his]74-dain paddle [a small islet about a mile ahead of [the canoe]338-the canoe]3446-a small islet about a mile ahead of the canoe - "[2355-he] that is [the place where [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi promised that [a boat]2629-a boat from [the prau]60-the prau]2360-the place where babalatchi promised that a boat from the prau would come for [me]0-i when the sun is overhead . [We]2362-they will wait for [that boat]981-that boat [there]2669-there . " [Almayer]72-almayer , who was steering , nodded without speaking , and by a slight sweep of [his]74-dain paddle laid the head of [the canoe]338-the canoe in the required direction . [They]2362-they were just leaving [the southern outlet of [the Pantai]3-the pantai]3449-the southern outlet of the pantai , which lay behind [them]2362-they in a straight and long vista of water shining between two walls of thick verdure that ran downwards and towards each other , till at last [they]2362-they joined and sank together in the far - away distance . The sun , rising above [the calm waters of [the Straits]61-the straits]3450-the calm waters of the straits , marked its own path by a streak of light that glided upon [the sea]171-the sea and darted up [the wide reach of [the river]170-the river]3452-the wide reach of the river , a hurried messenger of light and life to [the gloomy forests of [the coast]810-the coast]3454-the gloomy forests of the coast ; and in this radiance of the sun 's pathway floated [the black canoe]3456-the black canoe heading for [the islet which lay bathed in sunshine]3457-the islet which lay bathed in sunshine , the yellow sands of [[its]3456-the black canoe encircling beach]3458-its encircling beach shining like an inlaid golden disc on the polished steel of [the unwrinkled sea]3459-the unwrinkled sea . To the north and south of [it]3456-the black canoe rose other islets , joyous in their brilliant colouring of green and yellow , and on the main coast the sombre line of mangrove bushes ended to the southward in [the reddish cliffs of [Tanjong Mirrah]62-tanjong mirrah]3460-the reddish cliffs of tanjong mirrah , advancing into [the sea]171-the sea , steep and shadowless under the clear , light of the early morning . The bottom of [the canoe]338-the canoe grated upon [the sand]3463-the sand as [the little craft]3464-the little craft ran upon [the beach]3465-the beach . [Ali]95-ali leaped on [shore]1259-shore and held on while [Dain]74-dain stepped out carrying [Nina]73-nina in [his]74-dain arms , exhausted by the events and the long travelling during the night . [Almayer]72-almayer was the last to leave [the boat]336-the boat , and together with [Ali]95-ali ran [it]336-the boat higher up on [the beach]3465-the beach . Then [Ali]95-ali , tired out by the long paddling , laid down in the shade of [the canoe]338-the canoe , and incontinently fell asleep . [Almayer]72-almayer sat sideways on the gunwale , and with [his]74-dain arms crossed on [his]74-dain breast , looked to [the southward]3470-the southward upon [the sea]171-the sea . After carefully laying [Nina]73-nina down in the shade of the bushes growing in [the middle of [the islet]1216-the islet]3472-the middle of the islet , [Dain]74-dain threw [himself]74-dain beside [her]73-nina and watched in silent concern the tears that ran down from under [her]73-nina closed eyelids , and lost [themselves]3474-themselves in that fine sand upon which [they]3474-themselves both were lying face to face . These tears and this sorrow were for [him]74-dain a profound and disquieting mystery . Now , when the danger was past , why should [she]73-nina grieve ? [He]74-dain doubted [her]73-nina love no more than [he]74-dain would have doubted the fact of [his]74-dain own existence , but as [he]74-dain lay looking ardently in [her]73-nina face , watching [her]73-nina tears , [her]73-nina parted lips , [her]73-nina very breath , [he]74-dain was uneasily conscious of something in [her]73-nina [he]74-dain could not understand . Doubtless [she]73-nina had the wisdom of [perfect beings]3475-perfect beings . [He]74-dain sighed . [He]74-dain felt something invisible that stood between [them]3474-themselves , something that would let [him]74-dain approach [her]73-nina so far , but no farther . No desire , no longing , no effort of will or length of life could destroy this vague feeling of [their]3474-themselves difference . With awe but also with great pride [he]74-dain concluded that it was [her]73-nina own incomparable perfection . [She]73-nina was [his]74-dain , and yet [she]73-nina was like [a woman from [another world]781-another world]3476-a woman from another world . [His]74-dain ! [His]74-dain ! [He]74-dain exulted in the glorious thought ; nevertheless [her]73-nina tears pained [him]74-dain . With a wisp of [her]73-nina own hair which [he]74-dain took in [his]74-dain hand with timid reverence [he]74-dain tried in an access of clumsy tenderness to dry the tears that trembled on [her]73-nina eyelashes . [He]74-dain had [his]74-dain reward in a fleeting smile that brightened [her]73-nina face for the short fraction of a second , but soon the tears fell faster than ever , and [he]74-dain could bear it no more . [He]74-dain rose and walked towards [Almayer]72-almayer , who still sat absorbed in [his]74-dain contemplation of [the sea]171-the sea . It was a very , very long time since [he]74-dain had seen [the sea]171-the sea - [that sea that leads everywhere]3480-that sea that leads everywhere , brings everything , and takes away so much . [He]74-dain had almost forgotten why [he]74-dain was [there]2669-there , and dreamily [he]74-dain could see all [his]74-dain past life on the smooth and boundless surface that glittered before [his]74-dain eyes . [Dain]74-dain 's hand laid on [Almayer]72-almayer 's shoulder recalled [him]74-dain with a start from [some country very far away]3482-some country very far away indeed . [He]74-dain turned round , but [his]74-dain eyes seemed to look rather at the place where [Dain]74-dain stood than at [the man]726-the man [himself]74-dain . [Dain]74-dain felt uneasy under the unconscious gaze . "[2362-they] What ? " said [Almayer]72-almayer . "[2365-she] [She]2365-she is crying , " murmured [Dain]74-dain , softly . "[2365-she] [She]2365-she is crying ! Why ? " asked [Almayer]72-almayer , indifferently . "[0-i] [I]0-i came to ask [you]2366-you . [[My]0-i [Ranee]147-ranee]2367-my ranee smiles when looking at [the man [she]2365-she loves]2368-the man she loves . It is [the white woman that is crying now]2369-the white woman that is crying now . [You]2366-you would know .
