" [Almayer]72-almayer shrugged [his]0-i shoulders and turned away again towards [the sea]171-the sea . "[2366-you] Go , [Tuan Putih]116-tuan putih , " urged [Dain]74-dain . "[116-tuan putih] Go to [her]2365-she ; [her]2365-she tears are more terrible to [me]0-i than the anger of gods . " "[116-tuan putih] Are they ? [You]2366-you will see them more than once . [She]2365-she told [me]0-i [she]2365-she could not live without [you]2366-you , " answered [Almayer]72-almayer , speaking without the faintest spark of expression in [his]0-i face , ' so it behoves [you]2366-you to go to [her]2365-she quick , for fear [you]2366-you may find [her]2365-she dead . "[0-i] [He]0-i burst into a loud and unpleasant laugh which made [Dain]74-dain stare at [him]0-i with some apprehension , but got off the gunwale of [the boat]336-the boat and moved slowly towards [Nina]73-nina , glancing up at the sun as [he]0-i walked . " And [you]74-dain go when the sun is overhead ? "[0-i] [he]0-i said . " Yes , [Tuan]116-tuan putih . Then [we]3485-we go , "[0-i] answered [Dain]74-dain . " [I]72-almayer have not long to wait , "[72-almayer] muttered [Almayer]72-almayer . " It is most important for [me]0-i to see [you]74-dain go . Both of [you]74-dain . Most important , "[0-i] [he]0-i repeated , stopping short and looking at [Dain]74-dain fixedly . [He]0-i went on again towards [Nina]73-nina , and [Dain]74-dain remained behind . [Almayer]72-almayer approached [[his]0-i daughter]162-his daughter and stood for a time looking down on [her]162-his daughter . [She]162-his daughter did not open [her]162-his daughter eyes , but hearing footsteps near [her]162-his daughter , murmured in a low sob , " [Dain]74-dain . "[72-almayer] [Almayer]72-almayer hesitated for a minute and then sank on the sand by [her]162-his daughter side . [She]162-his daughter , not hearing a responsive word , not feeling a touch , opened [her]162-his daughter eyes - saw [[her]162-his daughter father]408-her father , and sat up suddenly with a movement of terror . " Oh , [father]2606-father ! "[162-his daughter] [she]162-his daughter murmured faintly , and in that word there was expressed regret and fear and dawning hope . " [I]72-almayer shall never forgive [you]162-his daughter , [Nina]73-nina , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , in a dispassionate voice . " [You]162-his daughter have torn [my]2373-you heart from [me]2373-you while [I]2373-you dreamt of [your]162-his daughter happiness . [You]162-his daughter have deceived [me]2373-you . [Your]162-his daughter eyes that for [me]2373-you were like truth itself lied to [me]2373-you in every glance - for how long ? [You]162-his daughter know that best . When [you]162-his daughter were caressing [my]2373-you cheek [you]162-his daughter were counting the minutes to the sunset that was the signal for [your]162-his daughter meeting with [that man]826-that man - there ! "[2373-you] [He]2373-you ceased , and [they]2374-they both sat silent side by side , not looking at [each other]1412-each other , but gazing at [the vast expanse of [the sea]171-the sea]2376-the vast expanse of the sea . [Almayer]72-almayer 's words had dried [Nina]73-nina 's tears , and [her]73-nina look grew hard as [she]73-nina stared before [her]73-nina into the limitless sheet of blue that shone limpid , unwaving , and steady like heaven itself . [He]2373-you looked at it also , but [his]2373-you features had lost all expression , and life in [his]2373-you eyes seemed to have gone out . The face was a blank , without a sign of emotion , feeling , reason , or even knowledge of itself . All passion , regret , grief , hope , or anger - all were gone , erased by the hand of fate , as if after this last stroke everything was over and there was no need for any record . [Those few who saw [Almayer]72-almayer during the short period of [his]2373-you remaining days]2378-those few who saw almayer during the short period of his remaining days were always impressed by the sight of that face that seemed to know nothing of what went on within : like the blank wall of a prison enclosing sin , regrets , and pain , and wasted life , in the cold indifference of mortar and stones . " What is there to forgive ? "[73-nina] asked [Nina]73-nina , not addressing [Almayer]72-almayer directly , but more as if arguing with [herself]73-nina . " Can [I]73-nina not live [my]73-nina own life as [you]2373-you have lived [yours]2373-you ? The path [you]2373-you would have wished [me]73-nina to follow has been closed to [me]73-nina by no fault of [mine]73-nina . "[73-nina] " [You]2373-you never told [me]72-almayer , "[72-almayer] muttered [Almayer]72-almayer . " [You]2373-you never asked [me]73-nina , "[73-nina] [she]73-nina answered , " and [I]73-nina thought [you]2373-you were like [the others]159-the others and did not care . [I]73-nina bore the memory of [my]73-nina humiliation alone , and why should [I]73-nina tell [you]2373-you that it came to [me]73-nina because [I]73-nina am [[your]2373-you daughter]3084-your daughter ? [I]73-nina knew [you]2373-you could not avenge [me]73-nina . "[73-nina] " And yet [I]72-almayer was thinking of that only , "[72-almayer] interrupted [Almayer]72-almayer , " and [I]72-almayer wanted to give [you]2373-you years of happiness for the short day of [your]2373-you suffering . [I]72-almayer only knew of one way . "[72-almayer] " Ah ! but it was not [my]72-almayer way ! "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer replied . " Could [you]72-almayer give [me]72-almayer happiness without life ? Life ! "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer repeated with sudden energy that sent the word ringing over [the sea]171-the sea . " Life that means power and love , "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer added in a low voice . " That ! "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , pointing [his]2380-you finger at [Dain]74-dain standing close by and looking at [them]2381-them in curious wonder . " Yes , that ! "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer replied , looking [[her]72-almayer father]408-her father full in the face and noticing for the first time with a slight gasp of fear the unnatural rigidity of [his]408-her father features . " [I]72-almayer would have rather strangled [you]74-dain with [my]72-almayer own hands , "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , in an expressionless voice which was such a contrast to the desperate bitterness of [his]2380-you feelings that it surprised even [himself]2380-you . [He]2380-you asked [himself]2380-you who spoke , and , after looking slowly round as if expecting to see [somebody]1308-somebody , turned again [his]2380-you eyes towards [the sea]171-the sea . " [You]2380-you say that because [you]2380-you do not understand the meaning of [my]72-almayer words , "[72-almayer] [she]72-almayer said sadly . " Between [you]2380-you and [[my]72-almayer mother]2645-my mother there never was any love . When [I]72-almayer returned to [Sambir]123-the rajah [I]72-almayer found [the place which [I]72-almayer thought would be a peaceful refuge for [my]72-almayer heart]3491-the place which i thought would be a peaceful refuge for my heart , filled with weariness and hatred - and mutual contempt . [I]72-almayer have listened to [your]2380-you voice and to [her]2645-my mother voice . Then [I]72-almayer saw that [you]2380-you could not understand [me]72-almayer ; for was [I]72-almayer not part of [that woman]1815-that woman ? Of [her]2645-my mother who was the regret and shame of [your]2380-you life ? [I]72-almayer had to choose - [I]72-almayer hesitated . Why were [you]2380-you so blind ? Did [you]2380-you not see [me]72-almayer struggling before [your]2380-you eyes ? But , when [he]3493-he came , all doubt disappeared , and [I]72-almayer saw only the light of the blue and cloudless heaven - "[72-almayer] " [I]72-almayer will tell [you]2380-you the rest , "[72-almayer] interrupted [Almayer]72-almayer : " when [that man]826-that man came [I]2385-his also saw the blue and the sunshine of the sky . A thunderbolt has fallen from that sky , and suddenly all is still and dark around [me]2385-his for ever . [I]2385-his will never forgive [you]2386-her , [Nina]73-nina ; and to - morrow [I]2385-his shall forget [you]2386-her ! [I]2385-his shall never forgive [you]2386-her , "[2385-his] [he]2385-his repeated with mechanical obstinacy while [she]2386-her sat , [her]2386-her head bowed down as if afraid to look at [[her]2386-her father]408-her father . To [him]2385-his it seemed of the utmost importance that [he]2385-his should assure [her]2386-her of [his]2385-his intention of never forgiving . [He]2385-his was convinced that [his]2385-his faith in [her]2386-her had been the foundation of [his]2385-his hopes , the motive of [his]2385-his courage , of [his]2385-his determination to live and struggle , and to be victorious for [her]2386-her sake . And now [his]2385-his faith was gone , destroyed by [her]2386-her own hands ; destroyed cruelly , treacherously , in the dark ; in the very moment of success . In the utter wreck of [his]2385-his affections and of all [his]2385-his feelings , in the chaotic disorder of [his]2385-his thoughts , above the confused sensation of physical pain that wrapped [him]2385-his up in a sting as of a whiplash curling round [him]2385-his from [his]2385-his shoulders down to [his]2385-his feet , only one idea remained clear and definite - not to forgive [her]2386-her ; only one vivid desire - to forget [her]2386-her . And this must be made clear to [her]2386-her - and to [himself]2385-his - by frequent repetition . That was [his]2385-his idea of [his]2385-his duty to [himself]2385-his - to [[his]2385-his race]3295-his race - to [his]2385-his respectable connections ; to the whole universe unsettled and shaken by this frightful catastrophe of [his]2385-his life . [He]2385-his saw it clearly and believed [he]2385-his was [a strong man]2389-a strong man . [He]2385-his had always prided [himself]2385-his upon [his]2385-his unflinching firmness . And yet [he]2385-his was afraid . [She]2386-her had been all in all to [him]2385-his . What if [he]2385-his should let the memory of [his]2385-his love for [her]2386-her weaken the sense of [his]2385-his dignity ? [She]2386-her was [a remarkable woman]2390-a remarkable woman ; [he]2385-his could see that ; all the latent greatness of [his]2385-his nature - in which [he]2385-his honestly believed - had been transfused into [that slight , girlish figure]2391-that slight , girlish figure . Great things could be done ! What if [he]2385-his should suddenly take [her]2386-her to [his]2385-his heart , forget [his]2385-his shame , and pain , and anger , and - follow [her]2386-her ! What if [he]2385-his changed [his]2385-his heart if not [his]2385-his skin and made [her]2386-her life easier between the two loves that would guard [her]2386-her from any mischance ! [His]2385-his heart yearned for [her]2386-her . What if [he]2385-his should say that [his]2385-his love for [her]2386-her was greater than . . . " [I]2385-his will never forgive [you]2386-her , [Nina]73-nina ! "[2385-his] [he]2385-his shouted , leaping up madly in the sudden fear of [his]2385-his dream . This was the last time in [his]2385-his life that [he]2385-his was heard to raise [his]2385-his voice . Henceforth [he]2385-his spoke always in a monotonous whisper like an instrument of which all the strings but one are broken in a last ringing clamour under a heavy blow . [She]2386-her rose to [her]2386-her feet and looked at [him]2385-his . The very violence of [his]2385-his cry soothed [her]2386-her in an intuitive conviction of [his]2385-his love , and [she]2386-her hugged to [her]2386-her breast the lamentable remnants of that affection with the unscrupulous greediness of [women who cling desperately to the very scraps and rags of love , any kind of love]2392-women who cling desperately to the very scraps and rags of love , any kind of love , as a thing that of right belongs to [them]2392-women who cling desperately to the very scraps and rags of love , any kind of love and is the very breath of [their]2392-women who cling desperately to the very scraps and rags of love , any kind of love life . [She]2386-her put both [her]2386-her hands on [Almayer]72-almayer 's shoulders , and looking at [him]2385-his half tenderly , half playfully , [she]2386-her said - " [You]2385-his speak so because [you]2385-his love [me]2386-her . "[2386-her] [Almayer]72-almayer shook [his]2385-his head . " Yes , [you]2385-his do , "[2386-her] [she]2386-her insisted softly ; then after a short pause [she]2386-her added , " and [you]2385-his will never forget [me]2386-her . "[2386-her] [Almayer]72-almayer shivered slightly . [She]2386-her could not have said a more cruel thing . " Here is [the boat]336-the boat coming now , "[74-dain] said [Dain]74-dain , [his]74-dain arm outstretched towards a black speck on [the water between [the coast]810-the coast and [the islet]1216-the islet]2393-the water between the coast and the islet . [They]2396-we all looked at it and remained standing in silence till [the little canoe]2397-the little canoe came gently on [the beach]3465-the beach and [a man]340-a man landed and walked towards [them]2396-we . [He]340-a man stopped some distance off and hesitated . " What news ? "[74-dain] asked [Dain]74-dain . " [We]2396-we have had orders secretly and in the night to take off from [this islet]3496-this islet [a man]340-a man and [a woman]613-a woman . [I]74-dain see [the woman]2854-the woman . Which of [you]73-nina is [the man]726-the man ? "[74-dain] " Come , delight of [my]74-dain eyes , "[74-dain] said [Dain]74-dain to [Nina]73-nina . " Now [we]2396-we go , and [your]73-nina voice shall be for [my]74-dain ears only . [You]73-nina have spoken [your]73-nina last words to [the Tuan Putih]116-tuan putih , [[your]73-nina father]2814-your father . Come . "[74-dain] [She]73-nina hesitated for a while , looking at [Almayer]72-almayer , who kept [his]2400-his eyes steadily on [the sea]171-the sea , then [she]73-nina touched [his]2400-his forehead in a lingering kiss , and a tear - one of [her]73-nina tears - fell on [his]2400-his cheek and ran down [his]2400-his immovable face . " Goodbye , "[73-nina] [she]73-nina whispered , and remained irresolute till [he]2400-his pushed [her]73-nina suddenly into [Dain]74-dain 's arms . " If [you]73-nina have any pity for [me]72-almayer , "[72-almayer] murmured [Almayer]72-almayer , as if repeating some sentence learned by heart , " take [that woman]1815-that woman away . "[72-almayer] [He]2400-his stood very straight , [his]2400-his shoulders thrown back , [his]2400-his head held high , and looked at [them]2402-them as [they]2402-them went down [the beach]3465-the beach to [the canoe]338-the canoe , walking enlaced in [each other]1412-each other 's arms . [He]2400-his looked at the line of [their]2402-them footsteps marked in the sand . [He]2400-his followed [their]2402-them figures moving in the crude blaze of the vertical sun , in that light violent and vibrating , like a triumphal flourish of brazen trumpets . [He]2400-his looked at [the man]726-the man 's brown shoulders , at the red sarong round [his]726-the man waist ; at the tall , slender , dazzling white figure [he]726-the man supported . [He]2400-his looked at the white dress , at the falling masses of the long black hair . [He]2400-his looked at [them]2402-them embarking , and at [the canoe]338-the canoe growing smaller in the distance , with rage , despair , and regret in [his]2400-his heart , and on [his]2400-his face a peace as that of a carved image of oblivion . Inwardly [he]2400-his felt [himself]2400-his torn to pieces , but [Ali]95-ali - who now aroused - stood close to [[his]95-ali master]1119-his master , saw on [his]95-ali features the blank expression of [those who live in that hopeless calm which sightless eyes only can give]2409-those who live in that hopeless calm which sightless eyes only can give . [The canoe]338-the canoe disappeared , and [Almayer]72-almayer stood motionless with [his]2400-his eyes fixed on its wake . [Ali]95-ali from under the shade of [his]95-ali hand examined [the coast]810-the coast curiously . As the sun declined , the sea - breeze sprang up from the northward and shivered with its breath the glassy surface of [the water]351-the water . " Dapat ! "[95-ali] exclaimed [Ali]95-ali , joyously . " Got [him]95-ali , [master]3503-master ! Got prau ! Not there ! Look more [Tanah Mirrah]63-tanah mirrah side . Aha ! That way ! [Master]3503-master , see ? Now plain . See ? "[95-ali] [Almayer]72-almayer followed [Ali]95-ali 's forefinger with [his]2400-his eyes for a long time in vain . At last [he]2400-his sighted a triangular patch of yellow light on the red background of [the cliffs of [Tanjong Mirrah]62-tanjong mirrah]2413-the cliffs of tanjong mirrah . It was the sail of the prau that had caught the sunlight and stood out , distinct with its gay tint , on the dark red of [the cape]2414-the cape . The yellow triangle crept slowly from [cliff to cliff]2415-cliff to cliff , till it cleared [the last point of land]2416-the last point of land and shone brilliantly for a fleeting minute on the blue of [the open sea]2417-the open sea . Then [the prau]433-the prau bore up to the southward : the light went out of the sail , and all at once [the vessel]1107-the vessel itself disappeared , vanishing in the shadow of [the steep headland]2420-the steep headland that looked on , patient and lonely , watching over [the empty sea]2421-the empty sea . [Almayer]72-almayer never moved . Round [the little islet]2422-the little islet the air was full of the talk of the rippling water . The crested wavelets ran up [the beach]3465-the beach audaciously , joyously , with the lightness of young life , and died quickly , unresistingly , and graciously , in the wide curves of transparent foam on the yellow sand . Above , the white clouds sailed rapidly southwards as if intent upon overtaking something . [Ali]95-ali seemed anxious . " [Master]3503-master , "[95-ali] [he]95-ali said timidly , " time to get [house]486-house now . Long way off to pull . All ready , [sir]3121-sir . "[95-ali] " Wait , "[72-almayer] whispered [Almayer]72-almayer . Now [she]72-almayer was gone [his]95-ali business was to forget , and [he]95-ali had a strange notion that it should be done systematically and in order . To [Ali]95-ali 's great dismay [he]95-ali fell on [his]95-ali hands and knees , and , creeping along the sand , erased carefully with [his]95-ali hand all traces of [Nina]73-nina 's footsteps . [He]95-ali piled up small heaps of sand , leaving behind [him]95-ali a line of miniature graves right down to [the water]351-the water . After burying the last slight imprint of [Nina]73-nina 's slipper [he]95-ali stood up , and , turning [his]95-ali face towards [the headland where [he]95-ali had last seen [the prau]433-the prau]2425-the headland where he had last seen the prau , [he]95-ali made an effort to shout out loud again [his]95-ali firm resolve to never forgive . [Ali]95-ali watching [him]95-ali uneasily saw only [his]95-ali lips move , but heard no sound . [He]95-ali brought [his]95-ali foot down with a stamp . [He]95-ali was [a firm man - firm as a rock]2427-a firm man - firm as a rock . Let [her]73-nina go . [He]95-ali never had [a daughter]2428-a daughter . [He]95-ali would forget . [He]95-ali was forgetting already . [Ali]95-ali approached [him]95-ali again , insisting on immediate departure , and this time [he]95-ali consented , and [they]2429-they went together towards [[their]2429-they canoe]2430-their canoe , [Almayer]72-almayer leading . For all [his]95-ali firmness [he]95-ali looked very dejected and feeble as [he]95-ali dragged [his]95-ali feet slowly through the sand on [the beach]3465-the beach ; and by [his]95-ali side - invisible to [Ali]95-ali - stalked [that particular fiend whose mission it is to jog the memories of [men]304-men , lest [they]304-men should forget the meaning of life]2432-that particular fiend whose mission it is to jog the memories of men , lest they should forget the meaning of life . [He]95-ali whispered into [Almayer]72-almayer 's ear a childish prattle of many years ago . [Almayer]72-almayer , [his]95-ali head bent on one side , seemed to listen to [[his]95-ali invisible companion]2434-his invisible companion , but [his]95-ali face was like the face of [a man that has died struck from behind]2435-a man that has died struck from behind - a face from [which all feelings and all expression are suddenly wiped off by the hand of unexpected death]2436-which all feelings and all expression are suddenly wiped off by the hand of unexpected death . [They]2437-they slept on [the river]170-the river that night , mooring [their]2437-they canoe under the bushes and lying down in the bottom side by side , in the absolute exhaustion that kills hunger , thirst , all feeling and all thought in the overpowering desire for that deep sleep which is like the temporary annihilation of the tired body . Next day [they]2437-they started again and fought doggedly with the current all the morning , till about midday [they]2437-they reached [the settlement]523-the settlement and made fast [[their]2437-they little craft]2440-their little craft to [the jetty of [Lingard]77-lingard and [Co. Almayer]148-co. almayer]2441-the jetty of lingard and co. almayer walked straight to [the house]169-the house , and [Ali]95-ali followed , paddles on shoulder , thinking that [he]95-ali would like to eat something . As [they]2437-they crossed [the front courtyard]2443-the front courtyard [they]2437-they noticed the abandoned look of [the place]193-the place . [Ali]95-ali looked in at [[the different servants]2445-the different servants ' houses]2446-the different servants ' houses : all were empty . In [the back courtyard]379-the back courtyard there was the same absence of sound and life . In [the cooking - shed]2006-the cooking - shed the fire was out and the black embers were cold . [A tall , lean man]2449-a tall , lean man came stealthily out of [the banana plantation]990-the banana plantation , and went away rapidly across [the open space]2451-the open space looking at [them]2452-them with big , frightened eyes over [his]2449-a tall , lean man shoulder . [Some vagabond]2453-some vagabond without [a master]2454-a master ; there were many such in [the settlement]523-the settlement , and [they]2453-some vagabond looked upon [Almayer]72-almayer as [[their]2453-some vagabond patron]2456-their patron . [They]2453-some vagabond prowled about [[his]2449-a tall , lean man premises]2457-his premises and picked [their]2453-some vagabond living [there]2669-there , sure that nothing worse could befall [them]2453-some vagabond than a shower of curses when [they]2453-some vagabond got in the way of [the white man]512-the white man , whom [they]2453-some vagabond trusted and liked , and called [a fool]2832-a fool amongst [themselves]2453-some vagabond . In [the house]169-the house , which [Almayer]72-almayer entered through [the back verandah]2180-the back verandah , the only living thing that met [his]2449-a tall , lean man eyes was [his]2449-a tall , lean man small monkey which , hungry and unnoticed for the last two days , began to cry and complain in monkey language as soon as it caught sight of the familiar face . [Almayer]72-almayer soothed it with a few words and ordered [Ali]95-ali to bring in some bananas , then while [Ali]95-ali was gone to get [them]2463-them [he]2449-a tall , lean man stood in the doorway of [the front verandah]1001-the front verandah looking at the chaos of overturned furniture . Finally [he]2449-a tall , lean man picked up the table and sat on it while the monkey let itself down from the roof - stick by its chain and perched on [his]2449-a tall , lean man shoulder . When the bananas came [they]2453-some vagabond had [their]2453-some vagabond breakfast together ; both hungry , both eating greedily and showering the skins round [them]2453-some vagabond recklessly , in the trusting silence of perfect friendship . [Ali]95-ali went away , grumbling , to cook some rice [himself]95-ali , for [all the women about [the house]169-the house]2465-all the women about the house had disappeared ; [he]95-ali did not know where . [Almayer]72-almayer did not seem to care , and , after [he]2449-a tall , lean man finished eating , [he]2449-a tall , lean man sat on the table swinging [his]2449-a tall , lean man legs and staring at [the river]170-the river as if lost in thought . After some time [he]2449-a tall , lean man got up and went to the door of [a room on the right of [the verandah]156-the verandah]2468-a room on the right of the verandah . That was [the office]2470-the office . [The office of [Lingard]79-lingard and Co. [He]2449-a tall , lean man very seldom went in [there]2669-there]2471-the office of lingard and co. he very seldom went in there . There was no business now , and [he]2449-a tall , lean man did not want [an office]2473-an office . The door was locked , and [he]2449-a tall , lean man stood biting [his]2449-a tall , lean man lower lip , trying to think of the place where the key could be . Suddenly [he]2449-a tall , lean man remembered : in [[the women]376-the women 's room]377-the women 's room hung upon a nail . [He]2449-a tall , lean man went over to the doorway where the red curtain hung down in motionless folds , and hesitated for a moment before pushing it aside with [his]2449-a tall , lean man shoulder as if breaking down some solid obstacle . A great square of sunshine entering through the window lay on the floor . On the left [he]2449-a tall , lean man saw [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer 's big wooden chest , the lid thrown back , empty ; near it the brass nails of [Nina]73-nina 's European trunk shone in the large initials N. A. on the cover . A few of [Nina]73-nina 's dresses hung on wooden pegs , stiffened in a look of offended dignity at [their]2476-their abandonment . [He]2449-a tall , lean man remembered making the pegs [himself]2449-a tall , lean man and noticed that they were very good pegs . Where was the key ? [He]2449-a tall , lean man looked round and saw it near the door where [he]2449-a tall , lean man stood . It was red with rust . [He]2449-a tall , lean man felt very much annoyed at that , and directly afterwards wondered at [his]2449-a tall , lean man own feeling . What did it matter ? There soon would be no key - no door - nothing ! [He]2449-a tall , lean man paused , key in hand , and asked [himself]2449-a tall , lean man whether [he]2449-a tall , lean man knew well what [he]2449-a tall , lean man was about . [He]2449-a tall , lean man went out again on [the verandah]156-the verandah and stood by the table thinking . The monkey jumped down , and , snatching a banana skin , absorbed itself in picking it to shreds industriously . " Forget ! "[72-almayer] muttered [Almayer]72-almayer , and that word started before [him]2449-a tall , lean man a sequence of events , a detailed programme of things to do . [He]2449-a tall , lean man knew perfectly well what was to be done now . First this , then that , and then forgetfulness would come easy . Very easy . [He]2449-a tall , lean man had a fixed idea that if [he]2449-a tall , lean man should not forget before [he]2449-a tall , lean man died [he]2449-a tall , lean man would have to remember to all eternity . Certain things had to be taken out of [his]2449-a tall , lean man life , stamped out of sight , destroyed , forgotten . For a long time [he]2449-a tall , lean man stood in deep thought , lost in the alarming possibilities of unconquerable memory , with the fear of death and eternity before [him]2449-a tall , lean man . " Eternity ! "[2449-a tall , lean man] [he]2449-a tall , lean man said aloud , and the sound of that word recalled [him]2449-a tall , lean man out of [his]2449-a tall , lean man reverie . [The monkey]2478-the monkey started , dropped the skin , and grinned up at [him]2449-a tall , lean man amicably . [He]2449-a tall , lean man went towards [the office]2470-the office door and with some difficulty managed to open it . [He]2449-a tall , lean man entered in a cloud of dust that rose under [his]2449-a tall , lean man feet . Books open with torn pages bestrewed the floor ; other books lay about grimy and black , looking as if they had never been opened . Account books . In those books [he]2449-a tall , lean man had intended to keep day by day a record of [his]2449-a tall , lean man rising fortunes . Long time ago . A very long time . For many years there has been no record to keep on the blue and red ruled pages ! In the middle of [the room]1198-the room [the big office]2481-the big office desk , with one of [its]2481-the big office legs broken , careened over like the hull of [a stranded ship]2482-a stranded ship ; most of the drawers had fallen out , disclosing heaps of paper yellow with age and dirt . The revolving office chair stood in its place , but [he]2449-a tall , lean man found the pivot set fast when [he]2449-a tall , lean man tried to turn it . No matter . [He]2449-a tall , lean man desisted , and [his]2449-a tall , lean man eyes wandered slowly from object to object . All those things had cost a lot of money at the time . The desk , the paper , the torn books , and the broken shelves , all under a thick coat of dust . The very dust and bones of a dead and gone business . [He]2449-a tall , lean man looked at all these things , all that was left after so many years of work , of strife , of weariness , of discouragement , conquered so many times . And all for what ? [He]2449-a tall , lean man stood thinking mournfully of [his]2449-a tall , lean man past life till [he]2449-a tall , lean man heard distinctly the clear voice of [a child speaking amongst all this wreck , ruin , and waste]2483-a child speaking amongst all this wreck , ruin , and waste . [He]2449-a tall , lean man started with a great fear in [his]2449-a tall , lean man heart , and feverishly began to rake in the papers scattered on the floor , broke the chair into bits , splintered the drawers by banging them against the desk , and made a big heap of all that rubbish in one corner of [the room]1198-the room . [He]2449-a tall , lean man came out quickly , slammed the door after [him]2449-a tall , lean man , turned the key , and , taking it out , ran to the front rail of [the verandah]156-the verandah , and , with a great swing of [his]2449-a tall , lean man arm , sent the key whizzing into [the river]170-the river . This done [he]2449-a tall , lean man went back slowly to the table , called the monkey down , unhooked its chain , and induced it to remain quiet in the breast of [his]2449-a tall , lean man jacket . Then [he]2449-a tall , lean man sat again on the table and looked fixedly at the door of [the room [he]2449-a tall , lean man had just left]2487-the room he had just left . [He]2449-a tall , lean man listened also intently . [He]2449-a tall , lean man heard a dry sound of rustling ; sharp cracks as of dry wood snapping ; a whirr like of a bird 's wings when it rises suddenly , and then [he]2449-a tall , lean man saw a thin stream of smoke come through the keyhole . [The monkey]2478-the monkey struggled under [his]2449-a tall , lean man coat . [Ali]95-ali appeared with [his]95-ali eyes starting out of [his]95-ali head . " [Master]3503-master ! House burn ! "[95-ali] [he]95-ali shouted . [Almayer]72-almayer stood up holding by the table . [He]2449-a tall , lean man could hear the yells of alarm and surprise in [the settlement]523-the settlement . [Ali]95-ali wrung [his]95-ali hands , lamenting aloud . " Stop this noise , [fool]2788-fool ! "[72-almayer] said [Almayer]72-almayer , quietly . " Pick up [my]72-almayer hammock and blankets and take them to [the other house]3510-the other house . Quick , now ! "[72-almayer] The smoke burst through the crevices of the door , and [Ali]95-ali , with the hammock in [his]95-ali arms , cleared in one bound the steps of [the verandah]156-the verandah . " It has caught well , "[72-almayer] muttered [Almayer]72-almayer to [himself]72-almayer . " Be quiet , [Jack]149-jack , "[95-ali] [he]95-ali added , as the monkey made a frantic effort to escape from its confinement . The door split from top to bottom , and a rush of flame and smoke drove [Almayer]72-almayer away from the table to the front rail of [the verandah]156-the verandah . [He]2449-a tall , lean man held on there till a great roar overhead assured [him]2449-a tall , lean man that the roof was ablaze . Then [he]2449-a tall , lean man ran down the steps of [the verandah]156-the verandah , coughing , half choked with the smoke that pursued [him]2449-a tall , lean man in bluish wreaths curling about [his]2449-a tall , lean man head . On the other side of [the ditch]1845-the ditch , separating [[Almayer]72-almayer 's courtyard]2494-almayer 's courtyard from [the settlement]523-the settlement , [a crowd of the inhabitants of [Sambir]20-sambir]2496-a crowd of the inhabitants of sambir looked at [the burning house of]2497-the burning house of [the white man]512-the white man . In the calm air the flames rushed up on high , coloured pale brick - red , with violet gleams in the strong sunshine . The thin column of smoke ascended straight and unwavering till it lost itself in the clear blue of the sky , and , in the great empty space between [the two houses]2499-the two houses [the interested spectators]2500-the interested spectators could see the tall figure of [the Tuan Putih , with bowed head and dragging feet]2501-the tuan putih , with bowed head and dragging feet , walking slowly away from the fire towards the shelter of " [[Almayer]72-almayer 's Folly]3138-almayer 's folly . "[2501-the tuan putih , with bowed head and dragging feet] In that manner did [Almayer]72-almayer move into [[his]2449-a tall , lean man new house]673-his new house . [He]2449-a tall , lean man took possession of [the new ruin]2503-the new ruin , and in the undying folly of [his]2449-a tall , lean man heart set [himself]2449-a tall , lean man to wait in anxiety and pain for that forgetfulness which was so slow to come . [He]2449-a tall , lean man had done all [he]2449-a tall , lean man could . Every vestige of [Nina]73-nina 's existence had been destroyed ; and now with every sunrise [he]2449-a tall , lean man asked [himself]2449-a tall , lean man whether the longed - for oblivion would come before sunset , whether it would come before [he]2449-a tall , lean man died ? [He]2449-a tall , lean man wanted to live only long enough to be able to forget , and the tenacity of [his]2449-a tall , lean man memory filled [him]2449-a tall , lean man with dread and horror of death ; for should it come before [he]2449-a tall , lean man could accomplish the purpose of [his]2449-a tall , lean man life [he]2449-a tall , lean man would have to remember for ever ! [He]2449-a tall , lean man also longed for loneliness . [He]2449-a tall , lean man wanted to be alone . But [he]2449-a tall , lean man was not . In the dim light of [the rooms]2504-the rooms with [their]2504-the rooms closed shutters , in the bright sunshine of [the verandah]156-the verandah , wherever [he]2449-a tall , lean man went , whichever way [he]2449-a tall , lean man turned , [he]2449-a tall , lean man saw the small figure of [a little maiden with pretty olive face , with long black hair , [her]73-nina little pink robe slipping off [her]73-nina shoulders , [her]73-nina big eyes looking up at [him]2449-a tall , lean man in the tender trustfulness of [a petted child]2507-a petted child]2506-a little maiden with pretty olive face , with long black hair , her little pink robe slipping off her shoulders , her big eyes looking up at him in the tender trustfulness of a petted child . [Ali]95-ali did not see anything , but [he]95-ali also was aware of the presence of [a child]968-a child in [the house]169-the house . In [his]95-ali long talks by the evening fires of [the settlement]523-the settlement [he]95-ali used to tell [[his]95-ali intimate friends]2511-his intimate friends of [Almayer]72-almayer 's strange doings . [[His]95-ali master]1119-his master had turned sorcerer in [his]1119-his master old age . [Ali]95-ali said that often when [Tuan Putih]116-tuan putih had retired for the night [he]95-ali could hear [him]95-ali talking to something in [[his]95-ali room]2513-his room . [Ali]95-ali thought that it was a spirit in the shape of [a child]968-a child . [He]95-ali knew [[his]95-ali master]1119-his master spoke to [a child]968-a child from certain expressions and words [[his]95-ali master]1119-his master used . [[His]95-ali master]1119-his master spoke in Malay a little , but mostly in English , which [he]95-ali , [Ali]95-ali , could understand . [Master]3503-master spoke to [the child]544-the child at times tenderly , then [he]3503-master would weep over it , laugh at it , scold [it]544-the child , beg of it to go away ; curse it . It was a bad and stubborn spirit . [Ali]95-ali thought [[his]95-ali master]1119-his master had imprudently called it up , and now could not get rid of it . [[His]95-ali master]1119-his master was very brave ; [he]1119-his master was not afraid to curse this spirit in the very Presence ; and once [he]1119-his master fought with it . [Ali]95-ali had heard a great noise as of running about inside [the room]1198-the room and groans . [[His]95-ali master]1119-his master groaned . [Spirits]2525-spirits do not groan . [[His]95-ali master]1119-his master was brave , but foolish . [You]2527-you can not hurt a spirit . [Ali]95-ali expected to find [[his]95-ali master]1119-his master dead next morning , but [he]1119-his master came out very early , looking much older than the day before , and had no food all day . So far [Ali]95-ali to [the settlement]523-the settlement . To [Captain Ford]99-ford [he]95-ali was much more communicative , for the good reason that [Captain Ford]99-ford had the purse and gave orders . On each of [Ford]99-ford 's monthly visits to [Sambir]20-sambir [Ali]95-ali had to go on board with a report about [the inhabitant of [" [Almayer]72-almayer 's Folly]65-" almayer 's folly]3512-the inhabitant of " almayer 's folly . "[95-ali] On [his]95-ali first visit to [Sambir]20-sambir , after [Nina]73-nina 's departure , [Ford]99-ford had taken charge of [Almayer]72-almayer 's affairs . [They]2530-they were not cumbersome . [The shed]2173-the shed for the storage of goods was empty , [the boats]693-the boats had disappeared , appropriated - generally in night - time - by [various citizens of [Sambir]20-sambir]2533-various citizens of sambir in need of [means of transport]2534-means of transport . During a great flood [the jetty of [Lingard]79-lingard and [Co.]148-co. almayer]2535-the jetty of lingard and co. left [the bank]331-the bank and floated down [the river]170-the river , probably in search of more cheerful surroundings ; even the flock of geese - " the only geese on [the east coast]1251-the east coast "[148-co. almayer] - departed somewhere , preferring the unknown dangers of the bush to the desolation of [[their]2538-their old home]2539-their old home . As time went on the grass grew over the black patch of ground where [the old house]2540-the old house used to stand , and nothing remained to mark the place of [the dwelling that had sheltered [Almayer]72-almayer 's young hopes]2541-the dwelling that had sheltered almayer 's young hopes , [his]99-ford foolish dream of splendid future , [his]99-ford awakening , and [his]99-ford despair . [Ford]99-ford did not often visit [Almayer]72-almayer , for visiting [Almayer]72-almayer was not a pleasant task . At first [he]99-ford used to respond listlessly to [the old seaman]283-the old seaman 's boisterous inquiries about [his]99-ford health ; [he]99-ford even made efforts to talk , asking for news in a voice that made it perfectly clear that no news from [this world]2543-this world had any interest for [him]99-ford . Then gradually [he]99-ford became more silent - not sulkily - but as if [he]99-ford was forgetting how to speak . [He]99-ford used also to hide in [the darkest rooms of [the house]169-the house]2544-the darkest rooms of the house , where [Ford]99-ford had to seek [him]99-ford out guided by the patter of the monkey galloping before [him]99-ford . The monkey was always there to receive and introduce [Ford]99-ford . The little animal seemed to have taken complete charge of [[its]2546-it master]2547-its master , and whenever [it]2546-it wished for [his]99-ford presence on [the verandah]156-the verandah [it]2546-it would tug perseveringly at [his]99-ford jacket , till [Almayer]72-almayer obediently came out into the sunshine , which [he]99-ford seemed to dislike so much . One morning [Ford]99-ford found [him]99-ford sitting on the floor of [the verandah]156-the verandah , [his]99-ford back against the wall , [his]99-ford legs stretched stiffly out , [his]99-ford arms hanging by [his]99-ford side . [His]99-ford expressionless face , [his]99-ford eyes open wide with immobile pupils , and the rigidity of [his]99-ford pose , made [him]99-ford look like [an immense man]2550-an immense man - doll broken and flung there out of the way . As [Ford]99-ford came up the steps [he]99-ford turned [his]99-ford head slowly . " [Ford]99-ford , "[99-ford] [he]99-ford murmured from the floor , " [I]99-ford can not forget . "[99-ford] " Ca n't [you]99-ford ? "[99-ford] said [Ford]99-ford , innocently , with an attempt at joviality : " [I]99-ford wish [I]99-ford was like [you]99-ford . [I]99-ford am losing [my]99-ford memory - age , [I]99-ford suppose ; only the other day [[my]99-ford mate]3514-my mate - "[99-ford] [He]99-ford stopped , for [Almayer]72-almayer had got up , stumbled , and steadied [himself]72-almayer on [[his]99-ford friend]518-his friend 's arm . " Hallo ! [You]99-ford are better to - day . Soon be all right , "[99-ford] said [Ford]99-ford , cheerfully , but feeling rather scared . [Almayer]72-almayer let go [his]99-ford arm and stood very straight with [his]99-ford head up and shoulders thrown back , looking stonily at the multitude of suns shining in ripples of [the river]170-the river . [His]99-ford jacket and [his]99-ford loose trousers flapped in the breeze on [his]99-ford thin limbs . " Let [her]3514-my mate go ! "[99-ford] [he]99-ford whispered in a grating voice . " Let [her]3514-my mate go . To - morrow [I]99-ford shall forget . [I]99-ford am [a firm man]3515-a firm man , . . . firm as [a . . . rock , . . . firm]3516-a . . . rock , . . . firm . . . "[99-ford] [Ford]99-ford looked at [his]99-ford face - and fled . [The skipper]632-the skipper was [a tolerably firm man]2554-a tolerably firm man [himself]632-the skipper - as [those who had sailed with [him]632-the skipper]2555-those who had sailed with him could testify - but [Almayer]72-almayer 's firmness was altogether too much for [his]632-the skipper fortitude . Next time [the steamer]610-the steamer called in [Sambir Ali]150-ali came on board early with a grievance . [He]2557-he complained to [Ford]99-ford that [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng [the Chinaman]2558-the chinaman had invaded [[Almayer]72-almayer 's house]524-almayer 's house , and actually had lived [there]2669-there for the last month . " And [they]3517-they both smoke , "[150-ali] added [Ali]150-ali . " Phew ! Opium , [you]99-ford mean ? "[150-ali] [Ali]150-ali nodded , and [Ford]99-ford remained thoughtful ; then [he]99-ford muttered to [himself]99-ford , " [Poor devil]3518-poor devil ! The sooner the better now . "[99-ford] In the afternoon [he]99-ford walked up to [the house]169-the house . " What are [you]99-ford doing [here]2634-here ? "[99-ford] [he]99-ford asked of [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , whom [he]99-ford found strolling about on [the verandah]156-the verandah . [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng explained in bad Malay , and speaking in that monotonous , uninterested voice of [an opium smoker]2563-an opium smoker pretty far gone , that [[his]99-ford house]372-his house was old , the roof leaked , and the floor was rotten . So , being [an old friend]2565-an old friend for many , many years , [he]99-ford took [his]99-ford money , [his]99-ford opium , and two pipes , and came to live in [this big house]2566-this big house . " There is [plenty of room]3520-plenty of room . [He]99-ford smokes , and [I]99-ford live [here]2634-here . [He]99-ford will not smoke long , "[99-ford] [he]99-ford concluded . " Where is [he]99-ford now ? "[99-ford] asked [Ford]99-ford . " Inside . [He]99-ford sleeps , "[118-jim - eng] answered [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , wearily . [Ford]99-ford glanced in through the doorway . In the dim light of [the room]1198-the room [he]99-ford could see [Almayer]72-almayer lying on [his]99-ford back on the floor , [his]99-ford head on a wooden pillow , the long white beard scattered over [his]99-ford breast , the yellow skin of the face , the half - closed eyelids showing the whites of the eye only . . . . [He]99-ford shuddered and turned away . As [he]99-ford was leaving [he]99-ford noticed a long strip of faded red silk , with some Chinese letters on it , which [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng had just fastened to one of the pillars . " What 's that ? "[99-ford] [he]99-ford asked . " That , "[118-jim - eng] said [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , in [his]118-jim - eng colourless voice , " that is the name of [the house]169-the house . All the same like [[my]118-jim - eng house]2945-my house . Very good name . "[118-jim - eng] [Ford]99-ford looked at [him]118-jim - eng for awhile and went away . [He]99-ford did not know what the crazy - looking maze of the Chinese inscription on the red silk meant . Had [he]99-ford asked [Jim - Eng]118-jim - eng , that [patient Chinaman]2568-patient chinaman would have informed [him]99-ford with proper pride that its meaning was : " House of heavenly delight . "[2568-patient chinaman] In the evening of the same day [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi called on [Captain Ford]99-ford . [[The captain]611-the captain 's cabin]2570-the captain 's cabin opened on [deck]2571-deck , and [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi sat astride on the high step , while [Ford]99-ford smoked [his]99-ford pipe on the settee inside . [The steamer]610-the steamer was leaving next morning , and [the old statesman]2573-the old statesman came as usual for a last chat . " [We]3524-we had news from [Bali]12-bali last moon , "[103-babalatchi] remarked [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi . " [A grandson]3525-a grandson is born to [the old Rajah]123-the rajah , and there is great rejoicing . "[99-ford] [Ford]99-ford sat up interested . " Yes , "[103-babalatchi] went on [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , in answer to [Ford]99-ford 's look . " [I]103-babalatchi told [him]3525-a grandson . That was before [he]3525-a grandson began to smoke . "[103-babalatchi] " Well , and what ? "[99-ford] asked [Ford]99-ford . " [I]103-babalatchi escaped with [my]103-babalatchi life , "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , with perfect gravity , " because [the white man]512-the white man is very weak and fell as [he]512-the white man rushed upon [me]103-babalatchi . "[103-babalatchi] Then , after a pause , [he]103-babalatchi added , " [She]3525-a grandson is mad with joy . "[103-babalatchi] " [Mrs. Almayer]72-almayer , [you]103-babalatchi mean ? "[103-babalatchi] " Yes , [she]3525-a grandson lives in [[our]3527-we [Rajah]123-the rajah 's house]3528-our rajah 's house . [She]3525-a grandson will not die soon . [Such women]3529-such women live a long time , "[103-babalatchi] said [Babalatchi]103-babalatchi , with a slight tinge of regret in [his]103-babalatchi voice . " [She]3525-a grandson has dollars , and [she]3525-a grandson has buried them , but [we]3527-we know where . [We]3527-we had much trouble with [those people]3530-those people . [We]3527-we had to pay a fine and listen to threats from [the white men]2919-the white men , and now [we]3527-we have to be careful . "[103-babalatchi] [He]103-babalatchi sighed and remained silent for a long while . Then with energy : " There will be fighting . There is a breath of war on [the islands]217-the islands . Shall [I]103-babalatchi live long enough to see ? . . . Ah , [Tuan]103-babalatchi ! "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi went on , more quietly , " the old times were best . Even [I]103-babalatchi have sailed with [Lanun men]3533-lanun men , and boarded in the night [silent ships with white sails]3534-silent ships with white sails . That was before [an English Rajah]3535-an english rajah ruled in [Kuching]66-kuching . Then [we]3527-we fought amongst [ourselves]3527-we and were happy . Now when [we]3527-we fight with [you]103-babalatchi [we]3527-we can only die ! "[103-babalatchi] [He]103-babalatchi rose to go . " [Tuan]103-babalatchi , "[103-babalatchi] [he]103-babalatchi said , " [you]103-babalatchi remember [the girl that [man Bulangi]3537-man bulangi]3536-the girl that man bulangi had ? [Her]3536-the girl that man bulangi that caused all the trouble ? "[103-babalatchi] " Yes , "[99-ford] said [Ford]99-ford . " What of [her]3536-the girl that man bulangi ? "[99-ford] " [She]3536-the girl that man bulangi grew thin and could not work . Then [Bulangi]102-bulangi , who is [a thief]3538-a thief and [a pig - eater]3539-a pig - eater , gave [her]3536-the girl that man bulangi to [me]2574-i for fifty dollars . [I]2574-i sent [her]3536-the girl that man bulangi amongst [[my]2574-i women]3540-my women to grow fat . [I]2574-i wanted to hear the sound of [her]3536-the girl that man bulangi laughter , but [she]3536-the girl that man bulangi must have been bewitched , and . . . [she]3536-the girl that man bulangi died two days ago . Nay , [Tuan]103-babalatchi . Why do [you]103-babalatchi speak bad words ? [I]2574-i am old - that is true - but why should [I]2574-i not like the sight of a young face and the sound of a young voice in [[my]2574-i house]2945-my house ? "[2574-i] [He]2574-i paused , and then added with a little mournful laugh , " [I]2574-i am like [a white man]242-a white man talking too much of what is not [men]304-men 's talk when [they]304-men speak to [one another]1464-one another . "[2574-i] And [he]2574-i went off looking very sad . [The crowd]1530-the crowd massed in a semicircle before the steps of " [[Almayer]72-almayer 's Folly]3138-almayer 's folly , "[1530-the crowd] swayed silently backwards and forwards , and opened out before [the group of white - robed and turbaned men advancing through the grass towards [the house]169-the house]2576-the group of white - robed and turbaned men advancing through the grass towards the house . [Abdulla]83-abdulla walked first , supported by [Reshid]119-taminah and followed by [all the Arabs in [Sambir]20-sambir]2578-all the arabs in sambir . As [they]2579-they entered [the lane]2580-the lane made by [the respectful throng]2581-the respectful throng there was a subdued murmur of voices , where the word " [Mati]152-mati "[1530-the crowd] was the only one distinctly audible . [Abdulla]83-abdulla stopped and looked round slowly . " Is [he]83-abdulla dead ? "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla asked . " May [you]83-abdulla live ! "[1530-the crowd] answered [the crowd]1530-the crowd in one shout , and then there succeeded a breathless silence . [Abdulla]83-abdulla made a few paces forward and found [himself]83-abdulla for the last time face to face with [[his]83-abdulla old enemy]933-his old enemy . Whatever [he]83-abdulla might have been once [he]83-abdulla was not dangerous now , lying stiff and lifeless in the tender light of the early day . [The only white man on [the east coast]1251-the east coast]2936-the only white man on the east coast was dead , and [his]2936-the only white man on the east coast soul , delivered from the trammels of [his]2936-the only white man on the east coast earthly folly , stood now in the presence of Infinite Wisdom . On the upturned face there was that serene look which follows the sudden relief from anguish and pain , and it testified silently before the cloudless heaven that [the man lying there under the gaze of indifferent eyes]2586-the man lying there under the gaze of indifferent eyes had been permitted to forget before [he]2936-the only white man on the east coast died . [Abdulla]83-abdulla looked down sadly at [this Infidel [he]83-abdulla had fought so long and had bested so many times]2587-this infidel he had fought so long and had bested so many times . Such was the reward of [the Faithful]2588-the faithful ! Yet in [the Arab]96-arab 's old heart there was a feeling of regret for that thing gone out of [his]83-abdulla life . [He]83-abdulla was leaving fast behind [him]83-abdulla friendships , and enmities , successes , and disappointments - all that makes up a life ; and before [him]83-abdulla was only the end . Prayer would fill up the remainder of the days allotted to [the True Believer]2589-the true believer ! [He]83-abdulla took in [his]83-abdulla hand the beads that hung at [his]83-abdulla waist . " [I]150-ali found [him]83-abdulla here , like this , in the morning , "[150-ali] said [Ali]150-ali , in a low and awed voice . [Abdulla]83-abdulla glanced coldly once more at the serene face . " Let [us]2590-us go , "[83-abdulla] [he]83-abdulla said , addressing [Reshid]119-taminah . And as [they]2590-us passed through [the crowd that fell back before [them]2590-us]2591-the crowd that fell back before them , the beads in [Abdulla]83-abdulla 's hand clicked , while in a solemn whisper [he]83-abdulla breathed out piously the name of [Allah]110-allah ! The Merciful ! [The Compassionate]1701-the compassionate !
